Short Description:
Leatherman Tool Group, Inc. is an American company based in Portland, Oregon, founded in 1983 by Timothy S. Leatherman and Steve Berliner. The company is known for pioneering high-quality, multi-purpose hand tools, starting with the Pocket Survival Tool (PST). Today, Leatherman offers nearly two dozen different multi-tools, which are available in over 70 countries.

The core products are durable multi-tools that combine various hand tools like pliers, knives, and screwdrivers into a single, portable device. These tools are designed for versatility and reliability, appealing to outdoor enthusiasts, tradespeople, military personnel, and everyday consumers. Leatherman emphasizes American manufacturing and quality craftsmanship, producing its tools in Portland and providing local jobs. With over 40 years of experience, Leatherman is recognized for its commitment to innovation and excellence, making it a trusted brand for those who value practical, all-in-one solutions for various tasks.

Short Description:
The American Concrete Pavement Association (ACPA) is a prominent industry organization focused on enhancing the use and quality of concrete pavements. Established in 1964 and based in Irving, Texas, ACPA represents over 400 members, including contractors, material suppliers, and equipment manufacturers across the United States and Canada. The organization aims to provide leadership, technical expertise, and advocacy to promote sustainable concrete infrastructure.

ACPA offers a variety of services, including technical support and research to improve pavement design and maintenance, advocacy for the concrete pavement industry in policy discussions, and educational programs to enhance industry knowledge. The association also promotes the benefits of concrete pavements to public agencies and the general public, encouraging wider adoption in infrastructure projects such as highways and airports. Through its efforts, ACPA plays a vital role in advancing concrete pavement technology and ensuring the durability and sustainability of concrete infrastructure.

Short Description:
Aramsco is a prominent specialty distributor based in Paulsboro, New Jersey, established in 1966. The company serves contractors and facility maintenance professionals across the U.S. and Canada, offering a wide range of products in sectors such as environmental safety, disaster response, restoration, and facility maintenance. With a portfolio of over 40,000 products, Aramsco supplies essential equipment, chemicals, tools, and more to support specialty contractors in their work.

In addition to product distribution, Aramsco enhances customer support through various value-added services, including training and education programs, equipment rental, repair, and financing. The company operates more than 80 branches and employs over 1,000 people, generating reported revenues of around $313 million. Aramsco also utilizes advanced digital commerce solutions to facilitate seamless ordering and compliance for its customers, ensuring they have reliable access to the products and services they need.

Short Description:
Ariat International is a prominent American brand that specializes in performance footwear, apparel, and accessories for equestrian sports, work industries, and outdoor activities. Founded in 1993 by Beth Cross and Pam Parker, the company has become the largest equestrian sports brand globally. Headquartered in Union City, California, Ariat integrates advanced athletic shoe technology into traditional riding boots, enhancing comfort and performance.

Ariat's product offerings include performance boots for English and Western horseback riding, work boots, outdoor footwear, and durable apparel designed for demanding environments. The brand also provides complementary accessories for equestrian and outdoor activities. Ariat serves a diverse customer base, including professional and amateur equestrian athletes, rodeo participants, ranch workers, and outdoor enthusiasts. The company is actively involved in the equestrian community, sponsoring major organizations like the Professional Bull Riders and the International Federation for Equestrian Sports.

Ariat is committed to innovation, quality, and corporate social responsibility, partnering with organizations to support injured veterans. The brand is dedicated to delivering high-quality products that blend athletic technology with traditional craftsmanship.

Short Description:
Powerfleet, formerly known as Fleet Complete, is a global leader in fleet management and mobile workforce technology solutions. Founded in 2000 in Toronto, Canada, the company has grown to serve fleet-based organizations across North America, Europe, Mexico, and Australia.

Powerfleet offers a cloud-based platform that connects vehicles, mobile workers, cargo, and stationary assets to enhance fleet operations. Their services include GPS fleet management for real-time vehicle tracking and route optimization, as well as mobile workforce management solutions that improve productivity through customizable workflows. Additionally, Powerfleet has developed an AI-powered predictive maintenance platform in partnership with Pitstop, which monitors critical vehicle components to reduce downtime and enhance safety.

With a diverse customer base of over 5,000 organizations, Powerfleet caters to small and medium-sized businesses as well as large enterprises in industries such as logistics, transportation, and supply chain management. The company is committed to innovation and customer service, supported by a strong leadership team.

Short Description:
BarSplice Products, Inc. is a family-owned designer and manufacturer based in Dayton, Ohio, specializing in mechanical splicing and anchorage systems for the reinforcing steel industry. Founded in 1972, the company has grown into a recognized leader, serving customers across all 50 U.S. states and internationally. Under the leadership of the Casella family, BarSplice emphasizes innovation, quality, and customer service.

The company designs and manufactures mechanical couplers and headed bar reinforcement solutions that comply with stringent building codes, including those set by the American Concrete Institute and Department of Transportation. BarSplice focuses on using American-made materials and rigorous testing to ensure the reliability of its products. They also offer custom solutions for various applications, including restoration, repair, and precast concrete projects.

BarSplice serves a diverse customer base in the construction and reinforcing steel industries, including contractors and precast manufacturers. The company is dedicated to providing accurate pricing, dependable lead times, and technical support, reflecting its commitment to strong customer relationships and continuous improvement.

Short Description:
Besser Company is a machinery manufacturing firm based in Alpena, Michigan, established in 1904. The company specializes in innovative production systems and equipment for the global concrete products industry, serving markets such as masonry, hardscape, pipe, and precast concrete.

Besser's core offerings include complete production systems for manufacturing concrete products, a variety of machinery and equipment like molds, batch plants, and curing systems, as well as material handling solutions. The company also provides parts and expert technical service, ensuring that customers can maintain and optimize their equipment. Additionally, Besser offers training and education to help staff effectively use and maintain their machinery.

As an employee-owned company, Besser is committed to quality and innovation. It has built a strong reputation for advancing concrete product manufacturing technology and supports producers worldwide with its comprehensive range of products and services.

Short Description:
Blend Plants is an Italian company that specializes in automated mobile mixing plants for concrete, cold asphalt, and cementitious mixtures. Founded in 1983, the company has built a global distribution network and focuses on environmentally sustainable solutions in the construction equipment sector.

Their product lineup includes mobile mixing plants, horizontal silos for material storage, concrete agitators, pumping plants, and various construction machinery such as mixers, blenders, and pumps. Blend Plants emphasizes mobility and automation, allowing for efficient production in remote locations while reducing energy consumption and production costs. Their technology supports a circular economy by minimizing waste and promoting the use of recycled materials.

The company serves diverse applications in the construction industry, including recycling, railway and road construction, and logistics. As a member of the Italian Industrial Hub, Blend Plants is committed to innovation and environmental responsibility, providing solutions that benefit both the environment and the construction sector.

Short Description:
Since 1989, BoMetals has earned a reputation in the concrete and masonry accessory market for continuous innovation, enthusiastic customer service and dedication to the construction industry.

BoMetals serves the concrete accessory market by manufacturing a wide variety of products used in commercial and residental construction. These products include a comprehensive offering of PVC and TPER Waterstop to meet the needs of any job. We also supply Mastic and Hydrophilic Waterstops. BoMetals is also the nations top manufacturer of keykold joint systems. They include QuicKeyTM, the only galvanized joint system that features square dowel knockouts and PRO-KEYTM, with a patented positive stake to key interlock. Other concrete produ ts include Keyway Caps  Dovetail Anchor Slot, Expansion Board Cap, Zip Joint, Chamfer adn Radius Formers plus much more.
  
BoMetals serves teh masonry market with a complete line of Control Joint products, which are available in both PVC and Rubber compounds. We also manufacture Block Cap and Weep Tubes.
 
All BoMetals products are available through a national network of distributors and warehouses. A trained and knowledgeable sales and engineering staff offer personalized service unparalleled in the industry today.

Short Description:
Boot Barn Holdings, Inc. is a prominent American specialty retailer founded in 1978 and based in Irvine, California. The company operates around 396 stores across 44 states and has a robust online presence through several websites. Boot Barn specializes in Western and work-related footwear, apparel, and accessories, catering to a diverse customer base that includes Western lifestyle enthusiasts, workers in various industries, outdoor adventurers, and fashion-conscious consumers.

Command Alkon is a technology company based in Birmingham, Alabama, founded in 1976. It specializes in software solutions for the heavy building materials industry, serving suppliers and producers of concrete, aggregates, cement, asphalt, and ready-mix products. The company focuses on providing innovative technology to address industry challenges and enhance operations globally.

Under the leadership of CEO Martin Willoughby since 2021, Command Alkon has transitioned many traditional software products to cloud-based applications. Short Description:
The Concrete Reinforcing Steel Institute (CRSI), established in 1924 and based in Schaumburg, Illinois, is a leading technical institute and Standards Developing Organization focused on steel reinforced concrete construction. CRSI serves the reinforced concrete industry by providing technical publications, standards, design aids, and educational programs. Their resources include design guides, manuals, and checklists that assist professionals in the design and construction of reinforced concrete structures.

CRSI also offers educational opportunities through CRSI Rebar U, featuring e-learning courses and webinars that qualify for continuing education units. The institute supports research and innovation in reinforced concrete technology, including initiatives like the Certified Plant Program for epoxy-coated reinforcing bars. With a broad membership base that includes manufacturers, fabricators, and industry professionals, CRSI advocates for best practices and recognizes excellence through events and awards. Overall, CRSI is dedicated to advancing the steel reinforced concrete industry through comprehensive resources and support.

Devine Chemicals Ltd is a UK-based manufacturer and global distributor of speciality chemicals, located in Stanley, County Durham. Established in 1994, the company has over 30 years of experience in the chemical industry and operates with a dedicated team of fewer than 50 employees.

The company specializes in a wide range of speciality chemical products, including dispersants, water retention aids, rheology modifiers, defoamers, wax emulsions, and high-performance pigments. Short Description:
Durajoint Concrete Accessories located in Garrettsville Ohio is a veteran-owned manufacturer of branded products produced for the concrete industry, Durajoint® Waterstop (PVC, TPER, Arctic Grade, Hydrophilic and  Non-Hydrophilic) and Preco® Forming Accessories (rebar supports, spacers, and forming accessories). These leading brands are sold through two distinct sales channels, the distributor-based Cast-In-Place Division, and the producer-based Precast Division. Global sales, customer service, and technical support are performed by an internal sales team, product support staff, and outside sales force consisting of manufactures'​ representatives.
 
In the Early 1950's, Electrovert, a New York based plastics company developed Durajoint® the "Original PVC Waterstop". The original conception of Durajoint® PVC Waterstop was developed and used in a project for the St. Lawrence Seaway, which was once considered an impassable river. With the project completion in 1959 it consisted of 19 locks and 6 canals. Ranked as one of the most outstanding feats of engineering in the twentieth century, this gateway to North America has allowed 2.5 billion tons of cargo over the last 50 years to travel between the Atlantic Ocean and Great Lakes region.

In the mid 1960's, W.R. Grace purchased the Electrovert Company and began marketing the Durajoint® brand under their construction products division, later known as A.C. Horn. In 1993, Tamms Industries purchased A.C. Horn from W.R. Grace, and folded the Durajoint® brand under Tamms. In March of 2001 Michael E. Diskin a former executive of Master Builders Technologies (later known as BASF) purchased the Durajoint® PVC Waterstop line from Tamms and marketed it under the company banner of Durajoint® Concrete Accessories.

In December of 2004, the opportunity to expand the concrete accessories line arose with the acquisition of the Master Builders Preco Concrete Accessories line.

Fluke Corporation is an American manufacturer based in Everett, Washington, specializing in industrial test, measurement, and diagnostic equipment. Founded in 1948 by John Fluke, Sr., the company has become a global leader in portable electronic test tools and software. Fluke designs and produces a wide range of instruments, including handheld electronic test tools like multimeters and thermal imagers, industrial testing equipment such as calibration tools and power quality analyzers, and diagnostic equipment including oscilloscopes and network testers.

Fluke serves a diverse customer base across various sectors, including industrial and manufacturing, electrical contracting, aerospace, scientific research, and healthcare through its Fluke Biomedical division. Short Description:
Hexagon Asset Lifecycle Intelligence is a division of Hexagon that provides digital solutions for the design, construction, and operation of industrial facilities. The company focuses on enhancing productivity and sustainability throughout the asset lifecycle by unlocking data and modernizing industrial projects. 

Its product portfolio includes Intergraph Smart® 3D, a 3D design software for plant engineering; Intergraph Smart® Completions, which automates asset information management; and PAS Cyber Integrity, a solution for cybersecurity in industrial operations. The division also offers software for engineering data management, plant design, and project management, among others.

Headquartered in Madison, Alabama, Hexagon Asset Lifecycle Intelligence employs around 2,400 people and serves clients in over 80 countries across various industries, including oil and gas, manufacturing, and infrastructure. The division is set to become a standalone software and SaaS company by early 2026, allowing it to focus on its growth strategy in asset lifecycle intelligence and related fields.

For decades, we have combined engineering excellence with a customer-first approach, providing unmatched value to our clients in construction, infrastructure, and beyond.

Founded with a commitment to revolutionize the concrete mixing process, Holcombe Mixers has grown into a global leader in volumetric mixing technology. International is a historic company with roots dating back to 1831, starting with the invention of the McCormick reaper. Headquartered in Lisle, Illinois, it has grown into a large enterprise with around 15,000 employees and became part of the TRATON GROUP in 2021, alongside Scania, MAN, and Volkswagen Truck & Bus.

The company specializes in manufacturing commercial vehicles, including International trucks and engines, IC Bus® school and commercial buses, and Fleetrite aftermarket parts. International focuses on enhancing uptime and productivity for customers through comprehensive ownership solutions, such as warranties, extended service contracts, financing, and predictive maintenance. Its vision emphasizes accelerating sustainable mobility, integrating various propulsion technologies, and maintaining a strong commitment to customer service and innovation in the transportation sector.

Short Description:
Knowify is a New York City-based company founded in 2012 that provides cloud-based software for trade contractors. The company offers an integrated platform designed to help manage all aspects of construction contracting businesses, including project management, team coordination, and financial oversight. Its core product is a job management software platform that allows trade contractors to bid, manage, and invoice both commercial and residential construction jobs efficiently.

The platform supports the entire project lifecycle, featuring tools for contract management, scheduling, time tracking, invoicing, and real-time financial reporting. It integrates with QuickBooks Online to streamline financial operations. Knowify emphasizes personalized customer care with best-in-class onboarding, training, and ongoing support from a U.S.-based team. With pricing starting at $99 per month, it is accessible to small and medium-sized trade contractors. The company is recognized for its strong culture and has raised approximately $8 million in funding, reflecting confidence in its specialized approach to the trades industry.

Short Description:
Kubota Tractor Corporation (KTC) is the U.S. subsidiary of Kubota Corporation, a global company founded in 1890 in Osaka, Japan. Established in 1972, KTC focuses on the U.S. tractor market, following the successful introduction of its first tractor in 1969. The company is part of a global network that includes around 180 companies across 120 countries and employs approximately 52,000 people.

KTC offers a wide range of products tailored for the U.S. market, including agricultural tractors, construction equipment, lawn and garden equipment, hay machinery, utility vehicles, and engines. The company serves a diverse customer base, including farmers, construction companies, landscapers, and residential customers, supported by a network of over 1,100 dealerships across the country. Kubota is committed to improving lives through innovative machinery and environmental solutions, emphasizing sustainable development and customer service.

Makinex USA is an Australian-owned company that designs, develops, manufactures, and distributes innovative construction equipment. Founded in Sydney in 2004, the company aims to enhance productivity and efficiency in the global construction industry. Its name reflects its mission to eliminate inefficiencies through advanced tools and machinery.

Based in Mansfield, Texas, Makinex USA has established a strong presence in the U.S. market, particularly since opening an office in Los Angeles in 2015. The company has experienced rapid growth, with revenue exceeding that of its Australian and European markets, supported by partnerships with major customers like Home Depot and United Rentals.

Makinex offers a variety of construction products, including powered hand trucks, mini loaders, hybrid power generators, and pressure washers. The company prioritizes premium, safety-oriented products designed to improve efficiency on construction sites, focusing on markets that value high-quality equipment. Leadership includes founder Rory Kennard and Brad Boehler, who oversees North American operations.

Short Description:
Michigan Pneumatic Tool, Inc. is a full-service air tool company based in Romulus, Michigan, with over 75 years of experience. Founded in 1945, the company specializes in the design, manufacture, distribution, repair, and rebuilding of industrial pneumatic tools. It serves a wide range of industries, including construction, demolition, petrochemical, and assembly.

The company offers a comprehensive product line that features impact wrenches, drills, sanders, grinders, and various other pneumatic tools. Michigan Pneumatic Tool is also recognized for its extensive inventory of parts, including hard-to-find and obsolete components. In addition to manufacturing new tools, the company provides repair services for major brand name industrial air tools and offers rebuilt and re-engineered products.

With a focus on immediate and efficient service, Michigan Pneumatic Tool is committed to meeting the needs of its diverse customer base across multiple sectors. Its combination of quality products, repair services, and parts availability positions it as a leader in the pneumatic tool industry.

Short Description:
The National Hispanic Contractors Association (NAHICA) is a nationwide organization established in 2008 that supports Hispanic-owned construction companies across the United States. Its mission is to connect, empower, and advocate for Hispanic contractors by providing education, certification, networking, and business development resources.

NAHICA serves a diverse community of Hispanic contractors, including both established business owners and emerging entrepreneurs in various construction specialties such as general contracting, electrical, plumbing, and more. The association emphasizes the importance of the Hispanic workforce in the construction industry and works to enhance their leadership and participation.

The organization offers workshops, technical training, and mentorship programs to improve members' skills. It promotes certification processes and advocates for the inclusion of Hispanic contractors in the industry. Members benefit from a national network, exclusive business opportunities, and discounts on materials and services. NAHICA also organizes events like Expo Contratista, which provide valuable networking and educational opportunities for Hispanic contractors.

Short Description:
NCFI Geotechnical Polyurethanes, a division of NCFI Polyurethanes, is based in Mount Airy, North Carolina. Established in 1964 by Dr. Harris W. "Ace" Bradley, the company has a rich history in polyurethane foam technology. It operates manufacturing facilities in Dalton, Georgia, and Houston, Texas, along with 14 distribution warehouses across the United States.

The company specializes in polyurethane foam products for geotechnical applications, including the Terrathane brand, which is known for concrete lifting, highway repair, pipeline stabilization, and foundation support. NCFI also provides a variety of polyurethane chemical systems for insulation, roofing, agricultural uses, and more. To support contractors and applicators, NCFI offers a range of equipment, including mechanical purge guns, airless sprayers, and specialized rig setups. With a commitment to quality and customer support, NCFI serves diverse clients, including government agencies and aerospace organizations like NASA and Virgin Galactic.

Short Description:
Nilfisk is a global leader in professional and consumer cleaning equipment, established in 1906 in Denmark. Originally named Fisker & Nielsen, the company has a rich history of innovation, beginning with the creation of a lightweight vacuum cleaner in 1910. Today, Nilfisk focuses on quality, reliability, and technological advancement in its cleaning solutions.

The company's product portfolio includes professional cleaning equipment such as floorcare machines, industrial vacuum cleaners, and high-pressure washers, as well as consumer products like domestic vacuum cleaners and wet & dry vacuums. Nilfisk also offers comprehensive aftermarket services to ensure optimal product performance and longevity. With a commitment to innovation and environmental responsibility, Nilfisk aims to enhance customer performance while minimizing costs and environmental impact.

Nilfisk serves a diverse customer base across various industries, including professional cleaning companies and industrial facilities. The company has a strong global presence, with sales and manufacturing operations on three continents, and continues to expand its market share through effective brand building and competitive offerings.

Short Description:
PALFINGER MARINE is a prominent international manufacturer of deck equipment and lifesaving appliances for the marine industry. Established in 1992, the company is a division of the PALFINGER Group, which has a rich history dating back to 1932 in Austria. With its headquarters in Salzburg, PALFINGER MARINE has expanded its global presence through strategic acquisitions and now operates 25 sales and service hubs across Europe, Asia, the Americas, the Middle East, and Africa.

The company offers a diverse range of products, including marine and offshore cranes, winches, slipway systems, access equipment, life and rescue boats, davits, and fenders. PALFINGER MARINE is dedicated to innovation, reliability, and safety, serving a wide customer base that includes shipyards, offshore operators, wind farm developers, and rescue organizations. Recognized as a global market leader, PALFINGER MARINE leverages its engineering expertise and extensive service network to deliver high-quality solutions to various maritime sectors.

Short Description:
Pedigree Technologies is a software and telematics company based in Fargo, North Dakota. Founded in 2003, it specializes in web-based solutions for fleet and asset management across the United States and Canada. With nearly two decades of experience, the company focuses on connecting and monitoring mobile and stationary assets in various industries, including transportation, oil and gas, construction, and food and beverage.

The company's primary offering is the OneView platform, a comprehensive software solution that allows businesses to track, monitor, and diagnose high-value assets in real time from any device. This platform enhances operational visibility, enabling efficient management of vehicles, equipment, and personnel. Pedigree Technologies also provides a range of telematics tools, including electronic logging devices, tire pressure monitoring systems, and asset tracking solutions, all designed to improve fleet safety and operational efficiency.

Pedigree Technologies prioritizes customer relationships and offers tailored support to meet the unique needs of its clients, which include small businesses and nationally recognized companies. Their focus on technology, trust, and teamwork helps clients achieve enhanced operational efficiency and safety.

Short Description:
Plate 2000: Strength | Quality | Precision 

Plate 2000 manufactures the highest quality concrete finishing tools, renowned for their durability, flatness, and precision. We specialize in producing the strongest Float Pans and Trowel Blades—designed for both ride-on and walk-behind power trowels. Our tools are made from premium-grade steel and engineered to deliver superior performance, longer life, and the best concrete finish possible. 

With over 25 years of experience, Plate 2000 has built a reputation for excellence in manufacturing and customer service. We maintain efficient, streamlined production processes that allow us to offer some of the most competitive lead times in the industry. 

In recent years, Plate 2000 has gone beyond concrete finishing tools to expand its product line. Our growing range now includes Concrete Buckets and Washout Pans, providing even more solutions to support concrete professionals on the job site. 

Plate 2000 continues to evolve—driven by innovation, committed to quality, and focused on meeting the real-world needs of concrete contractors worldwide.

Revolution Concrete Mixers is a prominent manufacturer in the concrete mixer industry, boasting over 50 years of experience. Formerly known as McNeilus Mixers, the company rebranded in 2023 after being acquired by Right Lane Industries. Headquartered in Rochester, Minnesota, Revolution Concrete Mixers emphasizes innovation and technological advancement in its product offerings.

The company provides a variety of advanced concrete mixer products, including the Insight Mixer System™, GradeGuard™, and R83 Drum™. These products are designed to enhance performance, safety, and sustainability in concrete mixing. Revolution Concrete Mixers serves a diverse customer base, including concrete producers, construction companies, and contractors, both in the U.S. and internationally. Their mission is to lead the industry in innovation and efficiency while maintaining a strong commitment to customer collaboration and environmental responsibility.

Short Description:
RIB Software GmbH, based in Stuttgart, Germany, is a prominent technology company that specializes in software solutions for the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (AEC) industry. Founded in 1961, RIB became a subsidiary of Schneider Electric in 2020 and employs over 700 people across more than 20 branches worldwide.

The company offers a wide range of software products designed to manage the entire project lifecycle, including its flagship product, iTWO, a 5D enterprise application that integrates cost, schedule, and project data. RIB's portfolio includes Building Information Modeling (BIM) software, cost estimation tools, project management software, and computer-aided design (CAD) solutions, among others. RIB Software serves over half a million users globally, focusing on enhancing efficiency and sustainability in construction by connecting people, processes, and data. The company is committed to empowering professionals to build more effectively while driving digital transformation in the industry.

Short Description:
Safewaze is a U.S.-based manufacturer focused on fall protection, fall arrest, rescue, and confined space equipment. Founded in 1994 by Gene Verble and Darrell Hagler, the company operates from a 100,000 square foot manufacturing facility in Concord, North Carolina. Safewaze is dedicated to enhancing workplace safety for workers at height, offering a wide range of products including harnesses, lanyards, self-retracting lifelines, anchors, and rescue gear.

The company serves various industries such as construction, industrial, solar, wind, tower, and energy. Safewaze emphasizes quality by primarily manufacturing or assembling its products in the U.S. They also provide expert advice, training, and repair services, supported by research and development and testing laboratories. With a commitment to innovation and customer service, Safewaze aims to be a trusted partner in safety, fostering a culture of respect and continuous learning among its approximately 140 employees.

Short Description:
TEI Rock Drills is a family-owned American company based in Montrose, Colorado, founded in 1980 by Bill Patterson. The company specializes in designing and manufacturing rock drill excavator attachments, limited access drill rigs, and safety equipment, primarily serving the construction and mining industries.

Initially starting as an engineering consultancy, TEI pivoted to manufacturing after recognizing a need for parts for Gardner Denver drills. The company introduced its first excavator-mounted drilling attachments in 1984, focusing on portability and solutions for limited-access drilling. TEI's product offerings include versatile drilling attachments with patented drifters, compact drill rigs for challenging environments, and in-house manufactured components and safety products.

With a commitment to innovation, TEI holds seven international patents, including a unique drifter system that enhances drill stability. The company operates an ISO-certified facility, employing around 40-44 people and ensuring all products are made with American parts. TEI has shifted its customer base towards civil construction markets, with a growing international presence in regions such as the UK, South America, and Asia.

Short Description:
Tenstar Simulation AB is a Swedish company founded in 2009, focused on simulation-based training solutions for machines and vehicles. Headquartered in Tanumshede, Sweden, the company operates globally, with its simulators utilized across all continents in sectors such as construction, transport, agriculture, forestry, and traffic.

The company offers a diverse range of professional machine education simulators that create realistic and effective training environments. Each simulator features developed exercise programs that enhance key operator skills, including maintenance, driving, and safety. Tenstar emphasizes realism through advanced hardware, life-like graphics, and innovative features like head tracking and upcoming voice assistance to support users with reading disabilities.

Tenstar's simulators are environmentally friendly, producing significantly lower CO2 emissions compared to real machines, and are cost-effective, with operating costs estimated at just 5-10 euros per hour. Their primary customers include schools and training companies, contributing to safer and more efficient training processes for future machine and vehicle operators.

Short Description:
Vacuworx, based in Tulsa, Oklahoma, has been a leader in vacuum lifting systems since its founding in 1999. The company designs, manufactures, and sells innovative solutions that enhance safety and productivity in heavy material handling. Initially focused on the oil and gas industry, Vacuworx has expanded its applications to various sectors, including pipeline construction, water and sewer, highway construction, and manufacturing.

The flagship product line includes the RC Series lifters, which transformed pipe handling by offering a safer alternative to traditional methods. The product range also features the MC Series mini lifters and vacuum pad systems for lifting heavy materials like steel plates and concrete slabs. Vacuworx operates from a modern 155,000-square-foot facility in Tulsa and has additional manufacturing capabilities in Australia. With a global network of qualified dealers, the company serves customers across six continents, emphasizing collaboration and innovation to meet industry needs.

Short Description:
WORD Rock Drills is a family-owned manufacturer and distributor located in Elon, North Carolina. Established in 2006, the company specializes in rock drilling attachments, systems, and standalone wagon drills for excavators and skid steers. Their products are designed to convert existing heavy equipment into effective rock drilling tools, catering to various applications such as construction, solar field installation, and dewatering projects.

The product lineup includes rock drilling attachments, standalone wagon drills, limited access drilling rigs, and all-in-one drilling units. These solutions enable customers to perform drilling tasks with different hole sizes and depths, tailored to their specific project needs. WORD Rock Drills is committed to quick delivery and customer service, with standard products shipped in four weeks or less and a robust inventory that allows for 24-hour shipment of in-stock parts.

The company focuses on serving construction and drilling service providers, ensuring they receive reliable and efficient drilling equipment. With a strong emphasis on quality, competitive pricing, and responsive support, WORD Rock Drills positions itself as a leading supplier of rock drilling solutions in the United States.

Short Description:
AAC Worldwide is a specialized technical trade journal focused on the Autoclaved Aerated Concrete (AAC) industry. It serves as an international platform for industry news, market developments, and technical insights related to AAC, a lightweight and sustainable building material known for its thermal insulation and fire resistance.

The company publishes a technical trade journal that covers innovations, market trends, and case studies in the AAC sector. It provides updates on market size, growth forecasts, and regulatory developments, helping professionals in AAC production, construction, and related fields stay informed. AAC Worldwide also offers detailed reports and articles on AAC applications in various construction sectors, emphasizing its benefits in sound insulation, thermal efficiency, fire safety, and environmental sustainability.

AAC Worldwide targets a diverse audience, including AAC manufacturers, construction companies, architects, engineers, and industry suppliers. Its mission is to support the growth and adoption of AAC, particularly in regions like North America, where the material is increasingly recognized for its advantages in various building projects.

aSa - Applied Systems Associates, Inc. is a leading provider of specialized software solutions for the reinforcing steel industry, established in 1969 and based in Murrysville, Pennsylvania. The company develops, customizes, and supports software that automates key processes such as estimating, rebar detailing, production management, material tracking, billing, and general accounting. Their modular software suite allows customers to expand their capabilities as their business grows.

With a global presence, aSa employs between 51 and 200 people and generates approximately $10.7 million in revenue. The company serves a diverse range of clients, including small and large rebar fabricators, contract estimators, engineering firms, and multi-plant corporations. In addition to software, aSa offers quality rebar tags, tag printers, and business forms, along with expert consulting services to help clients maximize the value of their solutions. The company also supports cloud computing and modern hardware integration, ensuring its offerings remain current with technological advancements.

Short Description:
Brokk is a multinational company based in Skellefteå, Sweden, founded in 1976. It is recognized as the leading manufacturer of remote-controlled demolition machines. The company was established by brothers Lars and Per-Martin Holmgren, who created the first demolition robot to improve safety and efficiency in confined space demolition, particularly in metal processing plants. Their innovative technology allows operators to control machines from a distance, significantly reducing risks and job times.

Brokk specializes in a range of remote-controlled demolition robots designed for hazardous and confined environments. Their versatile machines come with various attachments to handle diverse demolition tasks. The product line includes models like the Brokk 50 and Brokk 250, which have been refined to meet complex challenges. Brokk serves multiple industries, including construction, cement production, mining, processing, tunneling, and nuclear facilities. The company focuses on understanding customer needs and continuously develops its products to enhance safety and efficiency in demolition work.

Short Description:
Buzzi Unicem USA is a prominent cement manufacturing company based in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. As the fourth largest cement producer in the United States by capacity, it operates seven to eight cement plants across various states, including Missouri, Tennessee, Indiana, Texas, Oklahoma, and Pennsylvania. The company has a combined production capacity of approximately 9 to 10 million metric tons annually and manages 30 to 36 cement terminals, distributing products to over 30 states.

The company offers a diverse range of cement products, including Portland cement, masonry cements, slag cement, and oil well cements, among others. Its products serve a variety of customers in the construction industry, such as ready-mix concrete businesses and concrete block manufacturers. With a workforce of over 1,300 to 2,200 employees, Buzzi Unicem USA is well-equipped to meet the demands of its extensive customer base while also managing quarries that supply natural aggregates for its operations.

Short Description:
Carbon Limit is a climate technology company based in South Florida, founded in 2021. The company focuses on innovating advanced concrete solutions that reduce the carbon footprint of concrete production and enhance material performance. Their mission is to transform concrete into a carbon capture and storage solution, contributing to a reduction in global CO₂ emissions.

The company offers proprietary concrete additives, including CaptureCrete® and CoolCrete™. CaptureCrete® enhances concrete's ability to absorb and permanently sequester atmospheric CO₂, while also improving performance and enabling the generation of carbon credits. CoolCrete™ improves the solar reflectance and thermal emittance of concrete surfaces, helping to mitigate urban heat without requiring new machinery. Both technologies are designed for easy integration into existing manufacturing processes, promoting scalable decarbonization in the industry.

Carbon Limit also provides a range of services to support companies adopting their technology, including technical testing, customized value proposition development, and ongoing technical support. They collaborate with cement and concrete manufacturers, as well as construction industry stakeholders, to promote sustainable and profitable solutions.

Construction Robotics is a company based in Victor, New York, that specializes in robotic solutions for the construction and masonry industries. Founded in 2007, it is known for creating the Semi-Automated Mason (SAM), the first robotic bricklaying system that can lay bricks significantly faster than a human mason. SAM assists masons by enhancing efficiency and reducing physical strain on job sites.

The company also developed the MULE, a robotic device that helps workers lift heavy materials, making them feel weightless. This device is designed to improve safety and productivity by reducing the physical toll on workers. Construction Robotics targets builders, masons, and construction companies, providing solutions that complement human labor and address labor shortages while enhancing on-site safety. The company continues to innovate, focusing on expanding its robotic solutions across various construction trades.

Short Description:
DFP Safety Corporation is a subsidiary of DFP Impex Limited, based in the UK, and serves as the global licensee for DEWALT Fall Protection products. The company specializes in height safety solutions, focusing on fall protection and drop prevention products for the construction and general industry markets. With over 25 years of manufacturing experience, DFP Safety positions itself as a leading global manufacturer in this field.

The company offers a wide range of fall protection equipment under the DEWALT brand, including harnesses, lanyards, anchors, self-retracting lifelines, and lifeline systems. These products are designed for professional users working at height, emphasizing safety, durability, and ease of use. DFP Safety collaborates closely with DEWALT engineers to ensure high quality and reliability in their offerings.

In addition to product manufacturing, DFP Safety prioritizes training and support. They provide marketing and training resources to help users understand the proper use of fall protection equipment, enhancing workplace safety and compliance. Their primary customers include construction companies and industrial firms that require dependable height safety solutions.

Digga North America is a subsidiary of Digga Ltd, an Australian company founded in 1981. It specializes in manufacturing high-quality construction attachments and gearboxes for the earthmoving industry. The company is known for pioneering Pendulum Drilling technology and offers a wide range of compact, high-torque planetary drives used in various drilling applications.

Headquartered in Dyersville, Iowa, Digga North America operates a modern manufacturing facility that focuses on training and development. The company produces a variety of products, including augers, auger drives, trenchers, mounting frames, torque monitors, wear parts, extensions, and concrete mixers. Digga North America serves the earthmoving, foundation piling, and screw piling sectors, providing reliable equipment for drilling, anchoring, and trenching tasks.

Doka is an international company that specializes in formwork and scaffolding solutions for the construction industry. Founded in 1958 as part of the Umdasch Group AG, Doka has grown from a small woodworking shop in Austria to a global leader with around 8,000 employees and 160 branches across 58 countries.

Doka offers a wide range of products, including modular formwork panels, climbing formwork, slab formwork, and shoring towers. Their innovative product lines, such as DokaFit, focus on scalability, cost-efficiency, and durability. The company provides comprehensive project support, including engineering services and on-site logistics, to ensure efficient use of their materials. Short Description:
DripDrop Hydration, PBC is a Public Benefit Corporation based in Oakland, California, focused on providing a medically formulated oral rehydration solution (ORS) to effectively treat mild to moderate dehydration. Founded in 2008 by Dr. Eduardo Dolhun, the company aims to combat dehydration globally, with each purchase supporting life-saving donations and community aid programs.

The core product is a hydration powder mix that features a balanced blend of electrolytes, glucose, zinc, and vitamin C, designed to promote rapid fluid absorption. DripDrop's formula contains three times the sodium of traditional sports drinks while maintaining lower sugar levels, optimizing hydration. The convenient powder packets can be mixed with water and are suitable for various situations, including exercise, travel, and illness. The company offers a range of flavors made with natural colors, appealing to athletes, military personnel, and everyday consumers seeking effective hydration solutions. DripDrop is recognized for its growth and impact in the hydration market.

Ascentium Capital is a commercial lender and a division of Regions Bank, based in Kingwood, Texas. Founded in 2011, the company specializes in equipment and technology financing solutions for businesses. They provide fast and flexible financing and leasing options designed to meet the diverse needs of various industries.

The company offers a range of services, including equipment financing and leasing for manufacturers, distributors, and franchise organizations. They cater to small, mid-sized, and Fortune 500 companies with financing options that can reach up to $2 million. Ascentium Capital also features specialized financing programs, including 0% financing and deferred payment options, to support business cash flow and growth initiatives.

With a commitment to exceptional customer service, Ascentium Capital aims to foster opportunity and progress for its clients. They serve a wide customer base, including small to medium-sized businesses and large enterprises, demonstrating their ability to provide customized financing solutions across different sectors.

Short Description:
Milwaukee Tool, officially known as Milwaukee Electric Tool Corporation, is a prominent manufacturer of power tools and accessories, established in 1924 in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. With a rich history of innovation, the company focuses on creating durable, high-performance tools for professional tradespeople in various industries, including construction, plumbing, electrical, and metalworking.

The company offers a wide range of products, including power drills, reciprocating saws, grinders, and specialty tools. Milwaukee Tool was a pioneer in developing lightweight, portable power tools, starting with the Hole-Shooter drill in the 1930s. They have continued to innovate with products like the Sawzall reciprocating saw and various cordless tools that enhance job site efficiency. Milwaukee Tool prioritizes durability and user-focused design, often incorporating feedback from professionals to improve their offerings. 

Milwaukee Tool is dedicated to meeting the needs of skilled trades and industrial customers, providing solutions that enhance productivity and safety on the job.

3D Potter is a Florida-based company that designs and manufactures advanced 3D printers for ceramic and cementitious materials, particularly real clay. Founded by Dan Defelici, the company emerged from his experiments with robotics and 3D printing technology. Their printers utilize a cardinal axis system for precise control and high-quality results, with models like the Small Plus 50 and the Scara Elite, the latter designed for large-scale architectural projects.

The company serves a diverse customer base, including artists, educators, and professionals in architecture and construction. 3D Potter emphasizes the blend of traditional craftsmanship with modern technology, enabling the creation of complex ceramic and cement structures. They also collaborate with material manufacturers to develop specialized 3D printing materials, enhancing the capabilities of their printers for various applications. Overall, 3D Potter offers innovative solutions that cater to both artistic and architectural needs, focusing on precision and sustainability.

Short Description:
Asphalt Drum Mixers Inc. (ADM) is a family-owned company founded in 1974, based in Huntertown, Indiana. The company specializes in designing and manufacturing high-quality asphalt plants, drum mixers, and related components for contractors and asphalt producers around the world. ADM operates a modern manufacturing facility staffed by skilled engineers and technicians, focusing on reliable and efficient asphalt production equipment.

The product lineup includes portable, skid-mounted, and relocatable asphalt plants, catering to various production capacities. Notable series include the SPL Series, which offers compact plants for low-cost production; the RoadBuilder Series, designed for maximum heat transfer and fuel efficiency; and the MileMaker Series, featuring dual-drum counterflow technology for high-volume production. ADM's drum mixers are known for their durability and precision, equipped with advanced control systems to optimize the mixing process while minimizing energy consumption and emissions.

In addition to manufacturing, ADM provides expert installation, parts supply, and ongoing support to ensure the longevity and performance of their equipment, serving a global customer base in the asphalt industry.

Short Description:
Albion Engineering Company is a family-owned manufacturer specializing in handheld dispensing technologies. Founded in 1929 and headquartered in Moorestown, New Jersey, Albion has a long history of innovation, including the development of the first smooth rod caulking gun. This pioneering product transformed how caulking guns operate.

The company designs and manufactures a variety of dispensing tools and accessories for construction, industrial, roofing, and siding applications. Their products are engineered to access tight spaces, dispense thick materials, accurately mix two-component products, and hold large volumes of sealants and adhesives. Albion's offerings are widely distributed across North America through building supply, roofing, and industrial suppliers, as well as online platforms.

Albion serves professionals in the construction and industrial sectors, focusing on quality and efficiency. The company is led by the Schneider family, with Mark Schneider as CEO and Dean Hammel as President, continuing their commitment to excellence and customer service.

Beam AI is a technology company based in New York, founded in 2021. It specializes in agentic automation and self-learning AI agents that streamline complex workflows and business processes across various industries, including finance, healthcare, manufacturing, and construction. Their primary offering is the Agent Operating System (Agent OS), a cloud-based platform that integrates multiple AI agents to work autonomously and collaboratively, enhancing productivity and operational efficiency.

The self-learning AI agents adapt to changing business needs, automating tasks in areas such as customer service, finance operations, and human resources. Beam AI also provides tailored AI solutions for specific industries, demonstrating significant improvements in workflow optimization. With a customer base that includes Fortune 500 companies and over 800 construction businesses in the US and Canada, Beam AI is committed to delivering measurable efficiency and accuracy gains through its innovative automation technology.

BrandSafway is a global construction and civil engineering company that specializes in scaffolding, access solutions, and safety equipment. Founded in 1919 and headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, the company operates in 30 countries with over 350 locations and employs around 32,000 people. BrandSafway generates nearly $5 billion in annual revenue and has a strong presence in North America, Europe, and other global markets.

The company offers a wide range of services and products tailored to various sectors, including industrial, commercial, and infrastructure markets. Their offerings include the design, engineering, rental, sales, and installation of scaffolding systems, as well as safety equipment and services related to industrial insulation and protective coatings. BrandSafway also provides engineering and safety consulting services to enhance project safety and compliance. Notable projects include scaffolding for Milwaukee City Hall and safety equipment for the Space Needle in Seattle.

BusyBusy by AlignOps provides construction-focused time tracking and field management software. Founded in 2010 by Isaac Barlow, the company aims to enhance labor tracking, job costing, and project documentation for contractors. BusyBusy replaces traditional paper timecards with a mobile app that features real-time GPS labor tracking and jobsite monitoring, improving accuracy and productivity for construction projects globally.

The platform offers a range of features, including GPS-based labor tracking, jobsite management tools for documentation, compliance and safety access, cloud-based timesheet storage, and geofencing to ensure data integrity. In 2023, BusyBusy was acquired by AlignOps, which enhances its capabilities with additional tools for equipment status tracking, tool usage monitoring, and expanded job costing workflows. BusyBusy serves a diverse clientele of contractors and construction professionals, helping them improve payroll accuracy, streamline operations, and maintain safety compliance across multiple job sites.

Con Forms is a prominent company based in Port Washington, Wisconsin, specializing in engineered, abrasion-resistant piping systems and concrete pumping equipment. Founded in 1969, the company has over 50 years of experience and a strong reputation for quality and safety in the concrete pumping market. Con Forms serves a global customer base, including concrete-pumping service providers, original equipment manufacturers, engineering firms, and distributors, with additional locations in California, the United Kingdom, and Germany.

The company designs and manufactures a wide range of concrete pumping components, including pipes, boom kits, and laydown systems, all engineered for durability and performance. Their abrasion-resistant piping systems are utilized in various industrial applications, featuring advanced metallurgy for enhanced wear resistance. Con Forms also offers custom solutions, including turn-key components and on-site consultations to meet specific project needs. As a founding member of industry associations, Con Forms is committed to safety and compliance with industry standards.

The Concrete Foundations Association (CFA) is an international nonprofit trade association founded in 1975, dedicated to serving poured wall contractors in the residential concrete industry across the United States and Canada. Originally named the National Poured Wall Association, it evolved to include suppliers, manufacturers, and design professionals, adopting its current name in 1990.

CFA's mission is to advocate for cast-in-place contractors by promoting industry standards, education, and technological advancement. The association offers various services, including industry advocacy, a certification exam for contractors, and educational resources. Members benefit from networking opportunities, access to industry insights, and support for business needs. CFA fosters collaboration among its members, enhancing their professional growth and reputation within the concrete foundation industry. The association is headquartered in Farmington Hills, Michigan.

Short Description:
Corfix is a Canadian company based in Kanata, Ontario, that specializes in all-in-one construction management software tailored for the construction industry. Founded by former construction workers, Corfix utilizes extensive jobsite experience to create tools that address the real-world challenges faced by construction teams and management.

The software platform centralizes essential functions such as safety documentation, compliance tracking, timekeeping, and project records. This integration enhances operational efficiency by providing real-time access to critical documents and data for both field crews and office staff. Key features include real-time safety management, organized compliance tracking, accurate labor tracking, and centralized project documentation. Corfix aims to improve productivity, safety, and compliance for construction companies of all sizes.

With Series A funding from Reformation Partners, Corfix is focused on accelerating product development and expanding its presence in the US market. The company employs around 26 people and generates approximately $5.5 million in revenue.

Short Description:
Darda GmbH is a German company specializing in hydraulic demolition technology. They develop, produce, and sell environmentally friendly and high-performance demolition tools and equipment. Known for their expertise in concrete demolition and rock splitting, Darda focuses on providing solutions for complex deconstruction projects while prioritizing occupational safety and environmental protection.

Their product range includes hydraulic rock and concrete splitters, compact concrete crushers, demolition shears, and hydraulic power units. These tools are designed for effective use in confined spaces and sensitive environments, such as hospitals and schools, with features that minimize noise, vibrations, and dust emissions. Darda serves a diverse clientele in the demolition and construction industries, including contractors and specialists engaged in selective deconstruction. Their equipment is recognized for its reliability and efficiency, making it suitable for various challenging applications.

Short Description:
Glow Path Pavers develops and licenses self-illuminating concrete products in Keego Harbor, Michigan.  Holder of US and Canadian patents for self-illuminating paving stones and other concrete products, Glow Path Pavers offers production licenses using our patents, and also produces in standard and custom sizes upon request.

All Pathway products use a photoluminescent compound sourced from partners all over the world.  The material is inert,non-toxic, and resists chemical solvents, acids, and water-based solutions.

Glow Path Pavers self-illuminating products offer a soft, blue or blue-green nighttime glow that is ideal for unlit pedestrian walkways, stairs, docks, municipal spaces, landscaped backyard areas, outdoor kitchens, and other outdoor activity spaces.

Glow Path Pavers can be produced to order for your unique needs; custom sizing is welcomed, and standard sizes are widely available.  We work with a wide variety of production facilities throughout North America, and can produce near your facility or warehouse.

Give us a shout at www.glowpathpavers.com or call 248-230-1600

Short Description:
Hohmann & Barnard, Inc. is a leading manufacturer of construction materials focused on the building envelope, particularly in masonry anchoring and reinforcement systems. Founded in New York City in 1933, the company has evolved from producing window sash weights to providing essential masonry accessories and facade anchors for significant projects, including LeFrak City and the AT&T Headquarters.

The company offers a wide range of products, including innovative anchoring systems, masonry joint reinforcement, custom-engineered solutions, and moisture protection systems. Hohmann & Barnard also features several subsidiary brands, such as Diedrich Technologies, which specializes in masonry cleaning and restoration, and Dur-O-Wal, known for wire joint reinforcement. Primarily serving the non-residential construction market, Hohmann & Barnard supports mason contractors and building professionals with high-performance solutions for various commercial and international developments. Headquartered in Hauppauge, New York, the company is a subsidiary of MiTek Industries, part of Berkshire Hathaway, Inc.

Short Description:
IMER USA is the American branch of the IMER Group, a European manufacturer of construction machinery established in 1962. Operating since 1990 and headquartered in Southlake, Texas, IMER USA specializes in building machines and equipment for the construction industry. Their product range includes concrete mixers, pumps, cutting saws, and precast machinery, all designed to enhance efficiency and safety on job sites.

The company supports construction professionals and contractors through a network of dealers across the United States, offering sales, parts, and service support. IMER USA emphasizes innovation, safety, and strong customer relationships, positioning itself as a trusted partner in the construction sector. With a commitment to customer satisfaction and long-term support, IMER USA leverages its international expertise to meet the needs of the U.S. market.

Short Description:
Kraft Tool Company, founded in 1981 by Ron Meyer and Si Kraft, is a manufacturer and distributor of high-quality hand tools for the professional construction trades. Based in Shawnee, Kansas, the company has expanded significantly, operating from a 225,000-square-foot facility and serving customers in all 50 U.S. states and 63 countries.

The company focuses on producing durable tools for craftsmen such as cement finishers, brick masons, and drywall specialists. Kraft Tool is known for its “Hand Krafted” workmanship, emphasizing quality and innovation. Its product range includes tools for concrete, masonry, drywall, flooring, and tile cutting. Kraft Tool has also grown through strategic acquisitions of historic brands like W. Rose™, Superior Tile Cutter®, Sands® Level and Tool Co., and Gator Tools™, enhancing its offerings and commitment to American manufacturing. The company prioritizes exceptional customer service and maintains a comprehensive online catalog to support its professional clientele.

Short Description:
Ligchine International Corporation, founded in 2007 by Gary and Peter Ligman, specializes in designing, manufacturing, and marketing laser-guided boom screeds. These machines are engineered for precise floor leveling, catering to commercial concrete contractors. Ligchine's products are recognized for their accuracy, durability, versatility, and affordability, providing significant labor savings and improved floor flatness compared to traditional methods.

The company offers four distinct models of screeds, each tailored to various feature sets and applications, addressing the needs of both small and large-scale projects. Incorporating advanced laser-guided and 3D GPS/LPS technologies, Ligchine positions itself as a leader in automated concrete screeding equipment. The company sells its products directly to contractors in the U.S. and through a global distribution network, enhancing its reach in international markets. Ligchine has established itself as a key player in the concrete construction industry, focusing on innovation and customer value.

Short Description:
Lucid Bots Inc. is an AI robotics company based in Charlotte, North Carolina. Founded in 2018, the company designs, manufactures, and supports robots that tackle dangerous and labor-intensive tasks in the exterior cleaning, concrete, and construction sectors. With backing from Y Combinator and investors like Cubit Capital and Danu Ventures, Lucid Bots aims to improve safety, efficiency, and profitability for commercial cleaning and maintenance operations.

The company offers innovative products such as the Sherpa® Drone, a cleaning and window-washing drone that operates up to eight times faster than traditional methods, and the Lavo Bot™, a pressure-washing robot that enhances surface cleaning efficiency. Lucid Bots has integrated advanced AI capabilities, allowing their robots to understand human language and operate autonomously. They serve a diverse range of commercial clients, providing scalable training and support to boost productivity and reduce liability. Recognized for rapid growth, Lucid Bots is committed to automating hazardous jobs and democratizing access to robotics across various industries.

Short Description:
Nox-Crete, Inc. is an employee-owned company based in Omaha, Nebraska, specializing in chemical solutions for concrete construction. Founded in 1956, it is known for developing the world’s first chemically active form release agent. The company manufactures a wide range of products, including form release agents, bondbreakers, curing compounds, liquid floor hardeners, joint fillers, and decorative sealers. These products enhance the appearance, durability, and performance of concrete while extending the life of construction equipment.

Nox-Crete serves a diverse customer base, including concrete contractors, architects, engineers, and ready-mix producers. The company prioritizes innovation, driven by feedback from industry professionals, and has a dedicated research and development team focused on creating solutions for real-world concrete challenges. With a commitment to quality, Nox-Crete's products are manufactured on-site and distributed globally, backed by strong technical support and customer service.

Short Description:
PROSOCO, Inc. is an American manufacturer based in Lawrence, Kansas, specializing in specialty construction products. Founded in 1939, the company focuses on cleaning, protecting, and maintaining concrete and masonry surfaces, as well as ensuring building envelopes are air- and water-tight. 

The product range includes masonry cleaners and restoration products under the Sure Klean® line, concrete floor treatments from the Consolideck® brand, and air and water barrier systems through the R-Guard® product line. PROSOCO also offers masonry stabilization solutions to enhance the stability of buildings. The company has contributed to notable projects, including the restoration of the United States Capitol Building and conservation efforts at the Smithsonian Institution.

As a family-owned business, PROSOCO emphasizes high-quality products and innovation while maintaining a commitment to customer partnership. The company has a strong focus on sustainability and has been recognized for its contributions to the construction industry.

The QUIKRETE® Companies, founded in 1940 in Columbus, Ohio, is the largest manufacturer of packaged concrete and cement mixes in North America. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia since 1981, QUIKRETE operates around 250 manufacturing facilities across the U.S., Canada, Puerto Rico, and South America, allowing for rapid product distribution.

QUIKRETE offers a diverse range of over 200 professional-grade and consumer products, including concrete mixes, mortar mixes, repair products, and hardscapes. Notable projects featuring QUIKRETE products include the Statue of Liberty and the San Francisco Bay Bridge. The company also has several subsidiaries that enhance its product offerings and technical expertise, ensuring high-quality and reliable solutions for contractors, builders, and homeowners.

Short Description:
Conceived and built from the ground up by tenured construction owners and contractors determined to create better oversight for their inventory, Rooster will answer the questions, What do I own? Where is it? and When is it being used?

The innovative Rooster Asset Tracking System consists of Rooster Hubs and Rooster Activity Trackers. Rooster Hubs are robust data portals that connect to the Cloud using AWS through an LTE-M cellular connection to deliver highly accurate GPS location and activity data. Rooster Activity Trackers are small, rugged devices that, once installed on any piece of equipment, capture activity on a minute-by-minute basis, for up to 5 years, and relay that data to the nearest Rooster Hub. Activity Tracker data transmits through most concrete and metal to any Rooster Hub within and industry-leading ½ mile range using a long-range, low-power pairing design based on the LoRa® communications protocol and protected by more than a dozen patents issued and pending.

Proven in the field, Rooster makes finding, monitoring and reporting automatic, delivering real-time visibility into how, where, and when equipment is being used. Easy to order. Simple to setup. All leading to maximized equipment use—and ROI.

With more than two decades in the construction industry, the team at Rooster brings you its state-of-the-art toolset to track equipment and report activity so that humans don't have to.

Neo Composite Ltd
USA - NETHERLANDS - ISRAEL


Neo Composite develops and produces advanced Fiber-reinforced Composite products resourced from plastic waste for today's environmental & social challenges. 

Our full-scale mass production technologies, recycle and upgrade local plastic waste into high-performance, eco-friendly, durable, long life span products such as prefabricated houses, Lightweight cargo boxes for last-mile trucks.

Our elegant product life cycle solution combined with high volume production enables us to accomplish an outstanding environmental impact to build a better tomorrow.

 

Climate challenges that Neo Composite addresses: Novel Materials, Green construction, Clean Manufacturing

Southwire Company is a family-owned manufacturer of wire and cable products, founded in 1950 by Roy Richards Sr. in Carroll County, Georgia. Starting with just 12 employees and second-hand machinery, Southwire has grown to become one of the largest wire and cable manufacturers in the world, employing around 7,500 people across more than 40 U.S. cities and seven countries.

The company offers a diverse range of products, including building, utility, industrial power, and telecommunications cables, as well as copper and aluminum rods. In addition to manufacturing, Southwire provides engineering, fabrication, and inventory management services, catering to various industries. Their customers include building contractors, utility companies, and original equipment manufacturers in sectors such as automotive and industrial equipment. Southwire is committed to quality, innovation, and service, with core values centered on environmental responsibility, employee well-being, community engagement, ethical conduct, and creating lasting value.

STACK Construction Technologies, based in Cincinnati, Ohio, specializes in cloud-based takeoff and estimating software for professional construction contractors. Their platform enhances the pre-construction process by allowing users to measure digital plans, collaborate with team members, customize materials and pricing, and finalize project estimates efficiently. This software supports contractors throughout the project lifecycle, helping them operate more effectively and increase profitability.

The company provides a suite of cloud-based solutions that improve accuracy and collaboration from bid decision to project closeout. Their tools enable real-time teamwork and offer anytime, anywhere access, which is essential in today's construction environment. STACK’s user-friendly takeoff software helps contractors enhance client relationships and boost sales. Additionally, their project management and operations platform ensures clarity on-site during and after construction.

STACK Construction Technologies is committed to being a responsive partner in the construction industry, continuously refining its offerings based on customer feedback. With around 154 employees and $31.8 million in revenue, they focus on delivering efficient and collaborative software tools tailored to the needs of construction professionals.

SuperForm Products Ltd. is a family-owned company based in Pincher Creek, Alberta, Canada, with manufacturing facilities in both Canada and the USA. Established in 1998, the company specializes in high-quality, sustainable building products, particularly Insulated Concrete Forms (ICF). These forms are designed to enhance insulation, durability, and energy efficiency in construction projects, making SuperForm a recognized leader in ICF technology in North America.

The product range includes Insulated Concrete Forms with distinctive red ties, insulation products like EPS+ and Max+, concrete construction accessories, and various building systems. SuperForm caters to builders, contractors, and property owners who prioritize reliable and environmentally sustainable building solutions. The company focuses on effective communication and innovation, ensuring their products meet stringent building codes and perform well in extreme weather conditions. SuperForm Products Ltd. is committed to supporting greener building practices across North America.

Short Description:
TIMAB Magnesium is a specialized unit of Groupe Roullier, established in 1959, with over 50 years of expertise in magnesium-based products. The company operates integrated mines in Spain and Brazil, ensuring direct access to raw magnesium materials. It also collaborates with partners to source additional materials, allowing for comprehensive control over the entire value chain.

The company focuses on three main application areas: agricultural, industrial, and refractory uses. TIMAB Magnesium develops innovative products to address specific challenges in animal nutrition and agriculture. With a strong commitment to research and development, it has dedicated teams and 25 innovation specialists who utilize the resources of Groupe Roullier’s World Innovation Center. Its product portfolio includes solutions like pHix-up®, a magnesium buffer designed to enhance dairy cow health and productivity.

Supported by six certified production facilities, TIMAB Magnesium ensures quality control and traceability. Its global sales network, backed by strategic alliances, is responsive to customer needs, making it a leader in magnesium products for various markets.

Short Description:
US Federal Contractor Registration (USFCR) is a leading third-party registration firm that helps businesses, nonprofits, and government entities register and maintain compliance with the U.S. federal government's System for Award Management (SAM). Founded in 2010, USFCR has successfully completed over 300,000 SAM registrations, enabling clients to qualify for federal contracts and grants.

The company simplifies government contracting by managing federal registrations and certifications. Their services include SAM registration and renewal, small business certifications, contract bid training, and assistance with GSA schedule acquisition. USFCR also runs government marketing programs that have generated significant contract opportunities for clients. Their team consists of experts in contracting, marketing, and technology, all focused on client success.

USFCR serves a diverse clientele, including small businesses, nonprofits, and government agencies. The company is endorsed by various federal officials and has been featured in major publications, highlighting its authority in the federal contracting space.

Short Description:
Vector Corrosion Technologies is a leader in corrosion mitigation and preservation of reinforced concrete and masonry structures. Based in Manitoba, Canada, the company has expanded internationally, with offices in the UK, UAE, Indonesia, Australia, and the United States. Vector focuses on extending the service life of concrete infrastructure through advanced corrosion protection technologies.

The company offers a wide range of solutions, including Galvashield® galvanic anodes, Galvanode® distributed anode systems, and Post-Tech® solutions for post-tensioned concrete. They also provide Norcure® chloride extraction technologies and advanced cathodic protection systems like Ebonex® and ICCP. With a commitment to innovation, Vector has transitioned from a construction service provider to a manufacturer of corrosion mitigation technologies, emphasizing long-term structural preservation.

Vector serves a diverse clientele, including structural engineers, asset owners, and construction contractors across various sectors such as transportation and public infrastructure. With a dedicated team of over 70 professionals, the company is focused on delivering tailored, sustainable solutions that enhance the longevity of concrete structures worldwide.
