Vemaventuri is a Swedish company based in Göteborg, founded in 2007. It specializes in sensor technology and data acquisition solutions aimed at enhancing the construction industry, particularly in concrete monitoring and site efficiency. Since becoming a subsidiary of the PERI Group in 2016, Vemaventuri has expanded its technological capabilities significantly.

The company offers a range of sensor solutions designed to optimize construction processes. Key products include PREMO, a concrete pressure monitoring system; TEMO, which tracks concrete temperature and maturity; and PHONO, another integrated sensor solution. These products provide real-time data to improve safety, efficiency, and sustainability on construction sites. Vemaventuri emphasizes ease of use with an intuitive web application and supports sustainability through repairable hardware and cloud-based software updates. With a strong presence in Europe and recent expansion into the U.S. market, Vemaventuri serves construction companies and project managers focused on data-driven decision-making.

The Vince Hagan Company is a leading manufacturer of concrete batching equipment, recognized for inventing the first mobile concrete batch plant in 1956. Founded by Vince Hagan, the company has a strong legacy of innovation, now guided by his daughter Carol Hagan and third-generation leader Chris Hagan.

The company designs and manufactures a wide range of concrete batching plants and related equipment, including mobile and stationary batching plants, central mix plants, paving plants, and mixers. They also offer dust collectors, conveying systems, and retrofit services. Their equipment features advanced technology, such as containerized batch plants for efficient shipping and smart batching systems with remote diagnostics. 

Headquartered in Sunnyvale, Texas, Vince Hagan serves contractors and ready-mix concrete producers, focusing on solutions that enhance productivity and profitability. Short Description:
WaveCel Technology, based in Wilsonville, Oregon, specializes in advanced helmet safety technology aimed at reducing brain injuries from impacts. Founded in 2016 by orthopedic surgeon Dr. Steve Madey and biomechanical engineer Dr. Michael Bottlang, the company has developed a proprietary collapsible cellular liner that enhances helmet protection beyond traditional foam designs. This innovative technology has been recognized as one of TIME Magazine’s "Best Inventions of 2020."

The core product, the WaveCel liner, is integrated into helmets for cycling and snow sports, with plans to expand into other safety applications. The liner functions through three mechanisms: flexing to divert impact forces, crumpling to absorb energy, and gliding to reduce rotational forces, effectively mitigating the risk of concussions. WaveCel's technology has shown to absorb up to 73% more rotational force than standard helmet foam and has received a five-star safety rating from Virginia Tech University’s helmet testing facility. The company primarily licenses its technology to helmet manufacturers, partnering with brands like Trek Bicycle and Burton to enhance their helmet safety features.

Positec Deutschland GmbH is the German branch of Positec Group, a global leader in manufacturing robotic lawn mowers, battery-powered garden tools, and power tools. Founded in 1994 and headquartered in Suzhou, China, Positec has established itself as an innovator in the lawn and garden equipment industry, employing over 4,000 people worldwide. Positec offers a wide range of products under its flagship consumer brand, Worx, and the commercial brand, Kress. The product lineup includes the Worx Landroid series of robotic lawn mowers, cordless electric garden tools like trimmers and chainsaws, and power tools under the Rockwell Tools brand. Positec also provides commercial solutions for professional users, featuring advanced technology for efficient lawn care. The company emphasizes sustainability in its operations and has received numerous awards for its innovative and eco-friendly products.

Benjamin Moore is a well-established American manufacturer of high-quality paints, stains, and architectural coatings, founded in 1883 in Brooklyn, New York. The company has a rich history of innovation and resilience, having quickly built a reputation for durable paints and unique formulations. Headquartered in Montvale, New Jersey, Benjamin Moore operates major manufacturing and distribution facilities across the United States and Canada, with products available in over 75 countries.

The company offers a wide range of products, including interior and exterior latex and oil-based paints, stains, protective coatings, and industrial maintenance coatings. Benjamin Moore is known for its commitment to quality and environmental responsibility, having removed lead from its formulations by 1968 and developed eco-friendlier latex paints. Its products are primarily distributed through independently owned retailers, catering to professional painters, contractors, homeowners, and industrial clients. Acquired by Berkshire Hathaway in 2000, Benjamin Moore continues to emphasize consumer education and product innovation in the coatings industry.

Bidding Enterprise is a construction estimation services company with over 20 years of experience. They specialize in providing accurate quantity takeoffs and cost estimates for contractors, owners, suppliers, and cost consultants. Short Description:
Bigfoot Construction Equipment is a family-owned manufacturer based in Woodstock, Illinois, specializing in outrigger pads essential for stabilizing heavy equipment like cranes and concrete pumps. Founded in 1991 by Bill Steiner, the company has grown from a one-car garage operation to the longest in-house manufacturer of both wood and custom composite outrigger pads, utilizing American materials and veteran employees.

The company designs and manufactures standard, custom, and premium outrigger pads that prioritize strength, stability, and safety. Their composite pads are engineered with a proprietary blend to enhance compressive load capacity and come with a lifetime guarantee. Bigfoot collaborates with engineers to ensure their products meet strict compressive load ratings and ground bearing capacities. The Steiner family continues to lead the business, with Bill's two sons managing operations, drawing on their hands-on experience in related fields to inform product development and customer service.

In addition to manufacturing, Bigfoot Construction Equipment offers equipment rental, sales, and service, catering to construction companies and heavy equipment operators. Their commitment to safety, innovation, and quality craftsmanship has made them a trusted name in the industry.

Short Description:
The Concrete Masonry & Hardscapes Association (CMHA) is a trade association that represents producers, suppliers, and contractors in the concrete masonry and hardscape industry across the United States and Canada. Formed in 2023 through the unification of the Interlocking Concrete Pavement Institute and the National Concrete Masonry Association, CMHA consolidates expertise and resources to better serve the industry.

CMHA focuses on segmental concrete pavement, retaining walls, and other hardscape products. It advances research, develops technical standards, and provides education and design resources to promote durable and sustainable outdoor structures. The association offers a library of technical resources, networking opportunities, and workforce development initiatives, including a dedicated site to promote careers in hardscaping. CMHA also engages in partnerships to foster innovation in infrastructure.

As a nonprofit business league, CMHA is governed by a board of directors made up of industry leaders. It aims to improve business conditions for its members and reinvests revenue into industry advancement and member services.

Short Description:
Conjet Group is a Swedish company based in Stockholm, founded in 1984 and became independent in 1990. The company specializes in developing, producing, and selling robotic systems for automated concrete removal using hydrodemolition technology. With a turnover of approximately 60 million SEK as of 2020, Conjet operates globally, focusing on infrastructure maintenance, repair, and construction projects.

The company's hydrodemolition robots use high-pressure water jets to remove concrete efficiently and precisely, ensuring the underlying structure remains undamaged. This technology is particularly beneficial in sectors such as bridges, tunnels, and nuclear power plants, where selective concrete removal is essential. Conjet's solutions aim to improve safety, reduce labor costs, and enhance the quality and speed of concrete removal operations.

In 2019, Conjet underwent strategic changes after a majority share acquisition by Gulfstream Nordic Holdings AB, leading to a new CEO and a revitalized growth strategy. The company continues to strengthen its market presence with a focus on innovative, automated concrete removal technologies for infrastructure owners, construction companies, and maintenance contractors worldwide.

The magazine publishes a monthly issue featuring product evaluations, buying guides, and fleet management topics, including a regular column called Equipment Executive. Short Description:
Evergreen Solutions Corp. is a Canadian company based in Calgary, Alberta, that specializes in developing and supplying eco-safe chemical solutions for industrial sectors. Founded in 1993, the company focuses on delivering high-performance products that enhance operational efficiency while prioritizing health, safety, and environmental sustainability.

The product line includes industrial cleaning chemicals, detergents, biological products, and tailored cleaning systems designed for demanding applications. Evergreen Solutions is known for its custom-designed solutions that meet strict safety and effectiveness standards. The company values partnerships and community success, aiming to create real value for its clients through innovative and reliable chemical products. With a small team of fewer than 25 employees, Evergreen Solutions is dedicated to environmental preservation and improving lives through chemical innovation.

Short Description:
Sage Oil Vac, founded in 1993 by Gary Sage, is based in Amarillo, Texas. The company specializes in manufacturing patented mobile lube equipment that enables cleaner, faster, and spill-free oil changes. Their innovative systems utilize a vacuum and pressure process for 100% enclosed oil changes, minimizing spills and equipment downtime.

The product line includes various mobile lubrication systems such as lube skids, lube trailers, lube truck beds, and lube carts, catering to industries like agriculture, heavy equipment, wind energy, military, oil and gas, and mobile oil change services. Notably, Sage Oil Vac developed the wind gearbox oil exchange (GOEX) system, enhancing oil changes in wind turbines. The company has also formed significant partnerships, including one with the U.S. Army Reserve, to create custom mobile lube equipment.

With a team of around 60 employees, Sage Oil Vac is dedicated to innovation and customer collaboration, continuously improving their equipment to enhance productivity and operator experience. Their commitment to providing efficient oil and fluid exchange solutions supports preventive maintenance for a wide range of heavy machinery and equipment globally.

Short Description:
JVC, or Japan Victor Company, was founded in 1927 and has a long history in the electronics industry. Originally a subsidiary of the American Victor Talking Machine Company, JVC started by manufacturing phonographs and records. The company later expanded its offerings to include radios, televisions, and consumer audio equipment, becoming a pioneer in Japan's electronics sector. JVC is well-known for inventing the VHS video cassette system, which changed home video recording and playback.

The company's product range includes VCRs, camcorders, DVD players, televisions, audio equipment, video projectors, and computer peripherals. JVC also produces music CDs, video game and karaoke software, and movies. With a focus on both consumer and professional markets, JVC serves everyday users as well as specialized clients needing advanced audio and video equipment. The company has a legacy of innovation, including milestones like Japan’s first locally made television and advancements in widescreen TV technology.

Short Description:
PPG Industries, founded in 1883, is a global leader in paints, coatings, optical products, specialty materials, chemicals, glass, and fiberglass. Headquartered in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, the company operates over 140 manufacturing facilities in more than 60 countries, serving a wide range of industries.

Initially established as the Pittsburgh Plate Glass Company, PPG has evolved from producing high-quality flat glass to becoming a diversified supplier. Its product offerings include a variety of paints and coatings for automotive, aerospace, industrial, architectural, and packaging applications. PPG also manufactures optical materials, specialty chemicals, and fiberglass products, including solutions for renewable energy sectors. The company is known for its commitment to innovation, quality, and sustainability, making it a key player in the global market for advanced materials and coatings.

Short Description:
Henry Repeating Arms is an American firearms manufacturer established in 1996 by Louis and Anthony Imperato. Headquartered in Rice Lake, Wisconsin, the company also has manufacturing facilities in Bayonne, New Jersey, and Ladysmith, Wisconsin. With over 800 employees, Henry Repeating Arms produces more than 300,000 firearms each year, making it one of the top long gun manufacturers in the U.S.

The company specializes in lever-action rifles, shotguns, and lever-action pistols, offering a diverse catalog of over 200 models in various calibers and finishes. Their first product, the Henry H001 Classic Lever Action .22 rifle, has sold over one million units globally. The award-winning Henry Golden Boy rifle is a standout model, known for its distinctive design and quality craftsmanship. Henry Repeating Arms is dedicated to American manufacturing and provides reliable firearms for hunters, sport shooters, collectors, and enthusiasts.

Short Description:
alkus AG is a Liechtenstein-based company founded in 2000, specializing in the development and manufacturing of high-durability solid plastic formwork panels for the construction industry. The company emerged from research dating back to the 1980s, aiming to create a long-lasting, environmentally friendly alternative to traditional plywood formwork.

The flagship product, the alkus® solid plastic panel, is a wood-free formwork solution made from a plastic sandwich construction. These panels offer exceptional durability, lasting up to 30 times longer than wood, and are resistant to moisture, chemicals, and UV radiation. alkus AG also provides technical support to customers, helping them optimize the use of these panels in various construction projects. The panels are used in concrete construction, tunnel construction, and precast concrete manufacturing, showcasing their versatility and reliability.

Sustainability is a key focus for alkus AG, as they promote the use of recyclable plastic panels to reduce environmental impact. The company is committed to innovation and actively participates in industry trade fairs to showcase their advancements in construction materials.

Short Description: Adhesive Systems Technology (AST) Corp. is a leader in the design and manufacturing all types of simple, rugged and reliable single and plural component meter, mix and dispense equipment for the industrial and construction markets. AST builds gear, cylinder and rod metering pumps. AST manufactures equipment that can be used for extruding or spraying all types of urethanes, epoxies, polyureas, and silicones and can deliver materials ranging from 1 cc to over 5 gallons per minute in metered shots or continuous flow.  AST builds machines that have fewer moving parts, can be completely air or electrically operated and can pump viscous and abrasive materials up to 1,000,000 cps.  AST has a complete line of standard pumping equipment or we can design and build custom systems to your exact specifications. Typical equipment applications include: foam-in place, molding, potting, bonding, injection molding, anchoring, joint filling and sealing, crack injection, dowel bar placement, concrete restoration, and low pressure spraying.

Short Description:
Blynk is an Internet of Things (IoT) platform that helps businesses and developers prototype, deploy, and manage connected electronic devices at any scale. Founded in 2014, Blynk has developed a no-code and low-code approach to IoT app development, making it accessible to users without prior coding experience.

The platform offers a range of services, including mobile apps for controlling IoT devices, a web console for real-time device management, and a managed cloud infrastructure for data storage and processing. Blynk supports various communication protocols, ensuring seamless connectivity and integration with other systems. Its features include access controls, asset tracking, big data analytics, and secure data storage.

Blynk serves over 500,000 developers and business clients across 136 countries, catering to industries such as smart homes, agriculture, HVAC, and manufacturing. The platform enables users to build and manage custom IoT applications, enhancing operational efficiency and customer experience.

Short Description:
Coatings World is a prominent global media resource focused on the coatings industry, established in 1996. It serves as a specialized journal and information platform, providing business reports, technical papers, market research, and industry insights. Headquartered in Columbia, Maryland, the company has become the largest magazine in the coatings sector, reflecting the growth of a market valued at approximately $150 billion.

The company offers a range of services tailored to the coatings industry, including magazine publications, newsletters, and market research. It also covers industry events and provides advertising opportunities for companies looking to reach a global audience of coatings professionals. Coatings World targets a diverse audience, including manufacturers, suppliers, distributors, and technical personnel, ensuring its content supports informed decision-making and industry networking.

Short Description:
DEVELON North America is a prominent manufacturer and marketer of construction equipment, based in Suwanee, Georgia. As part of HD Hyundai and the Hyundai Genuine brand, DEVELON has a rich history that dates back to 1937. The company entered the North American market in 1991 and has since established over 200 dealer locations across the U.S. and Canada, supported by a dedicated team of approximately 120 employees.

DEVELON offers a diverse range of construction equipment, including crawler and wheel excavators, mini excavators, dozers, and articulated dump trucks, among others. The company also operates a customization facility to tailor equipment to customer specifications and maintains two parts distribution centers to ensure quick delivery and availability of parts. DEVELON is committed to innovation, exemplified by its development of autonomous construction equipment and efforts in sustainable technology, such as electric mini excavators. With a focus on customer support and reliable products, DEVELON aims to meet the evolving needs of various industries, including construction, logging, and agriculture.

Short Description:
DEWALT is a prominent American manufacturer of power tools, hand tools, and accessories, catering primarily to the construction, manufacturing, woodworking industries, and home craftspeople. Founded in 1924 by Raymond E. DeWalt, the company is known for its innovative spirit, starting with the invention of the radial arm saw, which significantly enhanced woodworking precision and efficiency.

As a brand under Stanley Black & Decker, DEWALT has established a global presence, offering a wide range of products including drills, saws, sanders, grinders, and cordless tools with advanced battery technology. Their hand tools encompass utility knives, pliers, wrenches, and more, while their extensive selection of accessories includes drill bits, blades, and tool storage solutions. DEWALT is recognized for its commitment to integrating new technologies and ergonomic designs, ensuring a superior user experience.

Targeting commercial contractors, manufacturing and woodworking professionals, as well as serious DIY enthusiasts, DEWALT is positioned as a premium brand known for its durability, reliability, and cutting-edge technology.

Short Description:
The company "Djofra-M" was founded in 2012 and within a few months managed to develop and consolidate its production process, becoming one of the largest producers and exporters of fiberglass mesh in the Republic of Moldova.

Constant investments in the most advanced technologies and equipment allow Djofra-M to provide a full production cycle at its own facilities: from warping and weaving to packaging of a finished branded product. The production capacity is over 30,000,000 m2 of certified fiberglass products per year.

The pride of the company is its highly qualified personnel, modern equipment and applied technologies that allow us to produce goods without harming the environment.

We offer such products as: fiberglass nets, self-adhesive fiberglass tapes, plastering corners made of PVC and aluminum, mats, cardboard tubes, construction tapes, composite materials. Our products are widely used in the construction industry and have enjoyed great popularity among customers for many years. The quality of our products allows "Djofra-M" to be a recognizable and desirable brand for Clients.

Sustainability, cost effectiveness, effective solutions, physical health and a safe working environment. We call it Healthy Business.

Dustcontrol product range consists of mobile dust extractors for industrial and construction applications, fluid extractors, pre-separators, air cleaners, central vacuum systems, peripheral equipment and accessories, for large and small companies in all types of industries. 

The parent company in Sweden was founded in 1972 and since 2006 we are a proud member of the Dustcontrol family. We continuously update our management system and we are certified according to ISO14001:2004 and ISO9001:2008, environmental and quality standards recognized and respected throughout the world.

Short Description:
EBS Ink-Jet Systems USA, Inc. is a manufacturer based in Libertyville, Illinois, specializing in industrial inkjet printing and coding solutions for North and Central America. Founded in 2008, the company offers a range of contact-free inkjet printers designed for product marking, labeling, and coding across various sectors, including packaging, logistics, manufacturing, and government.

The product lineup includes handheld inkjet printers for portable marking, continuous ink-jet printers for precise coding, and large character printers for larger texts. EBS also develops optimized inks and printing systems to ensure durability and cost efficiency. Their printers can print on diverse surfaces and accommodate various packaging types, making them suitable for a wide array of industrial applications. EBS Ink-Jet Systems USA is committed to delivering innovative and reliable printing solutions that meet the needs of its customers.

F. Walther Electric Corp is a U.S. subsidiary of WALTHER-WERKE, Ferdinand Walther GmbH, with over 100 years of experience in industrial electrical components and power distribution systems. Based in Somerset, New Jersey, the company is part of a global network that includes offices and distribution centers in several countries, supported by agents in over 70 countries.

The company manufactures a wide range of industrial electrical products, such as UL Listed IEC 60309 plugs and receptacles, mechanical interlocks, heavy-duty rectangular connectors, and portable power distribution units. F. Walther Electric Corp serves various industries, including OEMs, food and beverage processing, marine and shipbuilding, emergency preparedness, broadcasting, and alternative energy. They offer both standard and custom solutions, including transformer stations and charging infrastructures for electromobility, emphasizing safety, quality, and innovation in their designs.

FARO Technologies, Inc. is a global leader in advanced three-dimensional (3D) measurement, imaging, and realization solutions. Founded in 1981, the company initially focused on medical measurement devices before expanding into industrial manufacturing. Headquartered in Lake Mary, Florida, FARO operates over 25 offices worldwide and serves a diverse range of industries, including manufacturing, construction, law enforcement, and aerospace.

FARO offers a wide array of products, including laser trackers, laser scanners, coordinate measurement machines, and 3D software solutions. These tools enable precise 3D inspections, enhance quality control, and improve productivity. The company also provides repair and maintenance services, as well as inspection services utilizing its measurement technologies. FARO is committed to bridging the digital and physical worlds, helping customers make informed, data-driven decisions.

Short Description:
For more than forty years, GivenHansco has been building solid relationships with clients in the concrete, aggregate, and asphalt industries. Like our products, our philosophy is straightforward:

Make the customer our first priority and deliver reliable products that make business easier and more profitable for our customers. 

GivenHansco is built on relationships, and interacting with our customers is an important part of our product development process. We understand the real world challenges faced by our customers, and we are focused on providing the best automation and software solutions in the industry. GH pioneered industry specific accounting for ready mix producers in 1979. Guided by feedback from our customers, we have continued to build upon that innovative core by incorporating the latest technology into our products and services. Our employees have an average of 16 years experience in all phases of the ready mixed concrete industry and when you call GH, you will speak with a friendly, knowledgeable person, not an overseas call center or an impersonal machine.

Short Description:
Hard Hat Housing connects construction crews and project managers with fully furnished, midterm rental housing solutions across the continental United States. Founded by individuals with experience in construction management, the company focuses on providing affordable and comfortable housing tailored to the needs of construction workers.

The service simplifies the housing process by managing all planning, booking, and management details, allowing crews to concentrate on their work. Hard Hat Housing offers a range of fully furnished properties, including apartments, houses, and condos, all equipped with essential furniture and appliances. Their dedicated housing consultants work closely with clients to customize options based on project requirements, and clients benefit from simplified billing with a single monthly invoice.

Additionally, Hard Hat Housing emphasizes sustainability by incorporating energy-efficient appliances and eco-friendly practices into their housing solutions. With 24/7 customer support, the company ensures that crews have a comfortable and supportive living environment during their projects.

HardHat Workforce Solutions is a construction staffing company founded in 2002, offering flexible and customer-focused workforce solutions. With multiple regional offices, the company serves clients nationally, including dedicated divisions for National Accounts and the Renewable Energy sectors. HardHat emphasizes customized staffing solutions tailored to the unique needs of each project, prioritizing customer trust and employee loyalty.

The company provides skilled craftsmen and laborers for a variety of contractors, including those in traditional construction and renewable energy, such as solar energy. HardHat also emphasizes safety, employing a full-time Corporate Safety Manager and OSHA 500 Authorized trainers to ensure a safe working environment. Additionally, it integrates technology through a mobile app that allows employees to access assignment details, perform job searches, and communicate with staff efficiently.

HardHat's commitment to service quality, experienced management team, and strong employee loyalty contribute to its reputation as a reliable partner for contractors across the Atlantic and Southeast regions of the United States.

HCSS (Heavy Construction Systems Specialists Inc.) is a software development company located in Sugar Land, Texas. Founded in 1986, HCSS specializes in innovative software solutions tailored for the heavy civil, infrastructure, and utilities construction industries. The company serves a diverse range of contractors across North America, from small paving firms to large design-build and public-private partnership (P3) organizations.

HCSS offers a comprehensive suite of integrated software solutions designed to enhance construction operations. Their products include HeavyBid for estimating and bidding, HeavyJob for project management and operations, and Equipment360 for fleet management. These tools help contractors streamline processes, improve project tracking, and optimize asset utilization. HCSS also provides data reporting capabilities and cloud hosting services, ensuring reliable access to critical information. The company is committed to fostering a positive work environment and delivering exceptional customer service, making it a trusted partner for over 4,000 contractors.

The company offers over 1,100 safety products designed to save lives, prevent injuries, and reduce operational downtime. Short Description:
Knauf PFT GmbH & Co. KG is a German company based in Iphofen, Bavaria, that specializes in manufacturing advanced machine systems for the construction industry. Founded in 1964, the company is part of the Gebr. Knauf KG group and has over 50 years of experience. Knauf PFT produces more than 4,000 machines annually, with a global installed base exceeding 140,000 units.

The company offers a range of products, including conveying and mixing pumps, pneumatic conveying systems, horizontal continuous mixers, mortar pumps, and spray coating equipment. All machines are manufactured in Germany, emphasizing technical sophistication, reliability, and high-quality standards. Knauf PFT integrates digital technology into its products, enhancing operational efficiency on construction sites. The company serves a diverse customer base, including professionals in plastering, painting, and construction, providing solutions that meet various application needs in the industry.

Leader's Edge Magazine is an award-winning publication produced by The Council of Insurance Agents & Brokers, based in Washington, D.C. This monthly magazine serves as a leading trade resource in the commercial insurance and employee benefits brokerage industry, with a circulation of approximately 14,500 readers, including top brokers globally.

The magazine covers a wide range of topics relevant to its audience, such as business operations, technology, leadership development, sales skills, and industry trends. It also features special editions and digital content, including archived issues dating back to 2007. Additionally, Leader's Edge provides event-driven content, offering insights from industry events and interviews with key figures. The magazine supports brokerages and carriers through targeted advertising solutions, helping them connect with their audience effectively.

With a focus on delivering valuable content, Leader's Edge Magazine aims to inform and engage its readership, which consists primarily of experienced professionals in the insurance sector. The publication has received multiple accolades for its quality and influence, reinforcing its position as a trusted resource in the industry.

Short Description:
LIGHTYX is a technology company founded in 2018, focused on modernizing the construction industry through digital design integration with on-site implementation. The company offers the LightYX BeamerOne™, a laser projection system that accurately displays 2D and 3D digital drawings onto construction surfaces like floors and walls. This innovative solution allows construction workers to visualize and implement plans with millimeter-level precision, reducing errors and project delays while enhancing productivity and quality control.

The BeamerOne™ system combines laser-guided layout projection with advanced machine vision and a mobile app, enabling easy detection and alignment of digital plans with actual site conditions. This facilitates collaboration and real-time quality assurance, allowing managers to monitor progress remotely. LIGHTYX's technology addresses common construction challenges, streamlining the transfer of digital models to visible layouts and improving project delivery timelines and budget adherence. The solution has been adopted in 40 U.S. states and 4 European countries, covering over 22 million square feet of construction layout.

Mapei is a multinational company founded in 1937 in Milan, Italy, by Rodolfo Squinzi. It specializes in manufacturing chemical products for the building industry, including adhesives, sealants, and other materials for construction and renovation. With over 85 years of experience, Mapei has expanded from a small family business into a global leader, operating in 57 countries with 84 production plants and around 11,000 employees.

The company offers a wide range of products, including adhesives for various flooring types, interior and exterior paints, masonry repair products, and sealants. Mapei focuses on sustainable chemical solutions and continuously innovates to meet industry trends and customer needs. It serves a diverse customer base, including architects, designers, contractors, and building professionals, and emphasizes collaboration with local communities to tailor its offerings. Mapei is committed to sustainability and aims to advance eco-friendly building practices while maintaining its strong Italian heritage.

Metalinvest REMKO Ltd, founded in 2002 and located in Bulgaria, specializes in manufacturing and installing industrial metal components. The company produces a variety of products, including industrial air ducts, pipelines, steel structures, expansion joints, and pressure vessels. It serves diverse sectors such as energy, chemicals, pulp and paper, wood processing, and cement production.

The company focuses on high-quality manufacturing, utilizing premium raw materials and advanced techniques like precision laser cutting and professional welding. Metalinvest REMKO is committed to continuous improvement, investing in its facilities and machinery to meet customer needs effectively. Its clientele includes large industrial plants and manufacturers globally, known for balancing quality, competitive pricing, and timely delivery.

With a workforce of around 101-250 employees and annual revenues between 1 million and 10 million euros, Metalinvest REMKO plays a significant role in the Bulgarian industrial manufacturing landscape. The company also participates in international exhibitions to showcase its capabilities and expand its market presence.

Meyer Lab is a chemical manufacturer based in the United States, specializing in customized industrial cleaning programs. Founded in 1978 by Russ Meyer, the company has established itself as a leader in North America, known for its tailored solutions and expert service.

The company provides service-based cleaning solutions across various industries, including fire and safety, manufacturing, distribution, freight, food processing, and institutional sectors. Meyer Lab focuses on developing industrial cleaning chemicals and programs that meet specific customer needs. Headquartered in Blue Springs, Missouri, with additional locations in Kansas and Canada, Meyer Lab employs around 175 people and generates approximately $53 million in revenue.

Meyer Lab is dedicated to building strong customer relationships and maintaining high service standards. Their commitment to quality and excellence makes them a reliable partner for industrial cleaning solutions in the US and Canada.

Short Description:
MIFAB is a family-owned company founded in 1982 and based in Chicago, Illinois. It specializes in manufacturing commercial plumbing and drainage products for a wide market that includes the USA, Canada, Australia, and the Middle East. MIFAB is recognized for its high-quality plumbing solutions that save installers time and reduce material costs while ensuring durability and performance.

The company's product range features floor drains, roof drains, area drains, grease interceptors, couplings, pressure-reducing valves, and backflow preventers under the BEECO line. MIFAB has also experienced growth in plastic interceptors, reflecting a shift in market preferences. Their offerings include recycled rubber rooftop supports, siphonic drainage systems, quick hub couplings, and comprehensive GRP trench drain systems. MIFAB operates a modern manufacturing facility equipped for custom stainless-steel fabrication, emphasizing innovation and functionality in product design.

MIFAB serves commercial plumbing contractors, engineers, distributors, and wholesalers, maintaining strong relationships to meet customer needs and market trends. Their products are widely used in commercial construction projects, highlighting the company's commitment to quality and customer service.

Short Description:
ODISA Concrete Equipment is a Mexican company that specializes in designing, manufacturing, and supplying concrete production equipment and material handling machinery for the construction industry. Founded in 1976, ODISA has become a leading manufacturer in Mexico and exports to over 35 countries. The company operates three factories in Mexico to meet both national and international demand.

ODISA's product range includes concrete batch plants, truck mixers, storage silos, conveyor belts, and mobile concrete plants. The company is known for its innovative solutions, such as a new line of concrete batch plants that fit inside standard shipping containers for enhanced portability. ODISA's products are certified by the Concrete Plant Manufacturers Bureau and the Truck Mixer Manufacturers Bureau, ensuring they meet industry standards. With over 49 years of experience, ODISA focuses on quality, innovation, and customer satisfaction, serving a diverse customer base in the ready-mix concrete industry.

Pathfinder Systems, founded in 1998, specializes in providing advanced equipment and technology for the concrete products industry in the United States and Canada. The company offers a range of solutions, including concrete block, retaining wall, slab, and paver manufacturing equipment. They also design, build, and commission complete concrete manufacturing plants, as well as upgrade and retrofit existing facilities to enhance performance.

The company emphasizes sustainability by promoting the environmental benefits of concrete, such as its durability and carbon sequestration properties. Pathfinder Systems is committed to excellent after-sales service and support, ensuring customers have access to the latest technologies and innovations in concrete production. They actively participate in industry associations to stay connected with trends and advancements in the concrete sector.

Short Description:
The American Cement Association (ACA) is a non-profit organization established in 1916, representing the majority of U.S. cement manufacturers. Its mission is to advance the cement industry through research, education, policy advocacy, market intelligence, and sustainability initiatives. ACA promotes safety, innovation, and economic growth within the industry.

ACA conducts scientific research to enhance cement manufacturing processes and collaborates with academic institutions to advance knowledge in cement and concrete technologies. The association offers educational resources, including webinars and fellowships for graduate students. It actively engages with policymakers to advocate for supportive policies and tracks market trends to provide members with valuable data. ACA also leads sustainability efforts, aiming for a carbon-neutral cement industry by 2050.

Through networking events and conferences, ACA fosters collaboration among its members, which include leading cement producers and construction industry professionals. The association serves as a vital resource for the cement sector and the broader construction industry.

Short Description:
Power Curbers Companies is a family-owned manufacturer based in Salisbury, North Carolina, established in 1953. The company is recognized as a leader in concrete curbing and paving machines globally. They pioneered the first automatic curb machine, which mechanized the manual process of laying highway curbs and median islands, setting the stage for their expertise in slipform concrete equipment.

Their product line features a range of concrete slipform machines designed for various applications, including curb and gutter, highway barriers, sidewalks, and agricultural uses. The flagship 5700 series slipform machine is popular among contractors worldwide, with sales in over 100 countries. Power Curbers also includes Power Pavers, which manufactures concrete paving equipment for street, highway, and airport construction, offering a variety of machines such as texture/curing machines and placer-spreaders.

The company emphasizes lean manufacturing to enhance efficiency and customer satisfaction. With a focus on straightforward engineering and factory-direct sales, Power Curbers Companies supports a strong dealer network and continues to innovate in the slipform industry, serving contractors and construction professionals globally.

Short Description:
Right Weigh, Inc. is a privately owned company founded in 1998 that specializes in onboard load scale systems for the commercial transport industry in the United States. Established by Sid Campbell, a career trucker and fleet owner, the company aims to help operators monitor load weights easily and avoid fines associated with overweight loads.

Right Weigh designs and manufactures onboard load scales that can be installed on trucks and trailers, including air suspension vehicles. These scales provide real-time monitoring of load weights, helping drivers and fleet managers maximize payloads and ensure compliance with legal weight limits. The company is known for its commitment to customer service, affordability, and simplicity, making it a trusted supplier for owner/operators, fleet owners, and OEMs in the trucking sector. 

With an estimated revenue of around $6.7 million and a small team of fewer than 25 employees, Right Weigh focuses on delivering reliable and cost-effective solutions to enhance productivity and safety in commercial transport.

Short Description:
STRAUSS is a German family-owned company that designs and manufactures high-quality workwear, personal protective equipment (PPE), and safety footwear. Founded in 1948 by Engelbert Strauss, the company is based in Biebergemünd, Hesse, and reported revenues of approximately €1.4 billion in 2023. Initially starting with brooms and brushes, STRAUSS expanded into work protection clothing, including gloves, overalls, and safety boots, and embraced e-commerce in the early 1990s.

The company focuses on providing durable clothing and protective gear for professional workers such as builders, farmers, and craftsmen. Their product range includes workwear, safety footwear, and utility gear, all emphasizing comfort, durability, and functionality. STRAUSS has also engaged in notable collaborations, including partnerships with the US rock band Metallica, Nintendo for a Super Mario-themed collection, and the American Stuntmen’s Association. The company’s logo features an ostrich, reflecting its brand identity and heritage.

Short Description:
Tuff Built Products Inc. is a Canadian company based in Winnipeg, Manitoba, specializing in the design and manufacture of safety equipment. Founded in 2006, the company focuses on fall protection, confined space anchor systems, and industrial rescue solutions. With over 50 years of collective industry experience, Tuff Built develops safety products that meet high industry standards.

The company offers a variety of fall protection products, including fall arrest systems and temporary access solutions like Tuff Step and Parastair. These products are designed to ensure worker safety in hazardous environments across various sectors, including military, mining, oil and gas, and food processing. Additionally, Tuff Built manufactures Compressed Air Foam Systems (C.A.F.S.) for firefighting, known for their effectiveness and user-friendly controls.

Tuff Built emphasizes innovation and reliability in its product development, aiming to address the real-world challenges faced by workers in dangerous situations.

Short Description:
Wyndham Hotels & Resorts, Inc. is the largest hotel franchisor in the world, operating around 8,300 hotels with approximately 847,000 rooms in about 100 countries. Headquartered in Parsippany, New Jersey, the company offers a diverse portfolio of 25 hotel brands that cater to various travelers, from budget-conscious guests to those seeking upscale accommodations.

Founded in 2018 after a spin-off from Wyndham Worldwide, Wyndham has a rich history dating back to 1981. The company primarily operates as a hotel franchisor, providing franchise opportunities and support to hotel owners globally. This includes brand standards, marketing, reservation systems, and operational assistance, allowing Wyndham to expand its reach without owning most of its properties.

Wyndham's brand portfolio includes well-known names such as Days Inn, Super 8, and Wyndham Grand, enabling it to serve a wide customer base. The company targets everyday travelers, emphasizing accessibility and value, making it a preferred choice for both franchisees and guests seeking reliable accommodations worldwide.

Short Description:
Air-Weigh On-Board Scales is an American technology company based in Eugene, Oregon. It specializes in designing and manufacturing advanced on-board weighing systems for commercial trucks and trailers with air and mechanical suspensions. The company focuses on producing durable and reliable digital scales that provide real-time axle weight data, enhancing fleet efficiency, safety, and profitability.

The core products include on-board digital scales featuring a patented dual-point calibration system. These systems enable drivers and fleet operators to accurately measure axle weights at loading sites, helping to eliminate overweight fines and reduce fuel consumption. Air-Weigh offers various purchasing options, including factory installation through partnerships with major truck and trailer manufacturers, an extensive dealer network, and direct sales for self-installation. The company also provides comprehensive support, including fleet training and driver assistance.

Air-Weigh serves a diverse customer base in the transportation and trucking industries, with products integrated into many fleets worldwide. The company is committed to continuous improvement and innovation, aiming to enhance efficiency and reduce waste in transportation while contributing to environmental benefits.

Short Description:
Alcot Plastics Ltd.
Pioneering Polyethylene Foam Innovation Since 1983

Founded in Milton, Ontario, Alcot Plastics Ltd. is a trusted leader in extruded polyethylene foam products. Our founder, Jan Alac, revolutionized foam extrusion with a proprietary process that's faster, smarter, and more efficient than traditional methods — achieving full operation in 15 minutes, reducing waste, and delivering consistent, high-quality products.

We've earned our reputation through:

Innovative Technology: Proprietary extrusion systems for superior efficiency

Custom Solutions: Tailored products for diverse industrial needs

Continuous R&D: Expanding applications in foam sheets, custom stoppers, soft backer rod, and more

Today, with the next generation of leadership, Alcot Plastics continues to grow — operating from a state-of-the-art facility in Guelph, Ontario, and proudly serving customers across North America.

At Alcot, we combine cutting-edge engineering with a commitment to customer-specific excellence.

Short Description:
The Association for Materials Protection and Performance (AMPP) is a global professional organization focused on the protection of assets and the performance of industrial and natural materials, particularly in corrosion control and protective coatings. Formed in 2021 from the merger of NACE International and SSPC, AMPP has over 145 years of combined expertise and serves more than 40,000 members in 130 countries. The organization is headquartered in the United States, with additional offices in several countries including Brazil, Canada, China, and the United Kingdom.

AMPP's mission is to enhance materials performance to protect society and the environment. It offers a range of services, including training and certification programs, contractor accreditation, and the development of industry standards and publications. The association also organizes global conferences and networking events to promote innovation and collaboration among professionals in the field. Membership provides access to a vast professional network, resources for career advancement, and opportunities for advocacy in materials protection.

Short Description:
BarChip Inc. is a global leader in manufacturing high-performance macro synthetic fibre concrete reinforcement. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Hagihara Industries, a Japanese company with a strong background in flat yarn and plastic extrusion technologies, BarChip aims to enhance concrete performance and sustainability through innovative, corrosion-free synthetic fibre solutions.

The company offers a comprehensive concrete reinforcement system that replaces traditional steel reinforcement with synthetic fibres. Their products are designed to be cost-effective, non-corrosive, and easy to install, improving concrete durability and structural integrity. BarChip's fibre system is widely utilized in major infrastructure projects, recognized for reducing construction time, costs, and carbon footprint while enhancing safety and production speeds.

BarChip provides extensive technical and application support, assisting customers with fibre selection, batching, mixing, design methodologies, and testing requirements. Their solutions cater to a diverse range of clients in the construction and civil engineering sectors, including precast concrete manufacturers and infrastructure developers, ensuring optimal performance tailored to specific project needs.

Short Description:
Bartell Global is a prominent company specializing in concrete and construction equipment, with over 75 years of experience. Originally a family business, it expanded significantly in the 1990s and has a global presence, including markets in South America, Australia, and the Far East. After being acquired by Terex Corporation in 1999, it was later repurchased by its employees and rebranded as Bartell Global. The company has grown through strategic acquisitions, including Innovatech and SPE, enhancing its offerings in surface preparation.

The product range includes walk-behind and ride-on trowels, tampers, scarifiers, bull scrapers, and shot blasters. These tools are designed to support contractors in various concrete construction tasks. Bartell Global serves a diverse customer base of contractors who rely on high-quality equipment and services to complete their projects successfully. The company is committed to empowering its employees and continuously improving its products and services, ensuring it meets the evolving needs of the construction industry.

Short Description:
Brickeye is a Toronto-based company founded in 2014 that focuses on reducing risk and enhancing productivity in major construction projects worldwide. The company offers an end-to-end job site platform that combines ruggedized IoT-enabled sensors, reliable connectivity, and cloud-based software with advanced analytics. This platform provides real-time alerts and intelligent automations to improve construction risk management.

Brickeye's services include a purpose-built IoT job site platform, water mitigation solutions, concrete monitoring, and environmental risk management tools. Their BuildersRiskIQ™ Dashboard helps customers manage risks upfront, potentially leading to lower insurance costs. The company supports its clients with comprehensive turnkey deployment, including installation and 24/7 service, backed by over a decade of industry expertise.

Brickeye primarily serves owner/developers, general contractors, and insurance providers, helping them enhance site awareness and protect project margins. Their platform has been successfully deployed on over 2,000 projects in more than 20 countries, showcasing their impact and trust within the construction industry.

Short Description:
Groupe Canimex is a Canadian manufacturing and international trading company based in Drummondville, Quebec. Founded in 1969, it has built a strong reputation as a diversified industrial group. The company specializes in the design, fabrication, import, and export of mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and electronic components, as well as products related to access systems and garage doors.

With approximately 795 employees, Groupe Canimex operates through six business units, offering services such as aluminium die casting, tooling, precision machining, sheet metal fabrication, mechanical welding, and mould and die making. The company serves clients primarily in Quebec and Canada, with a presence in certain communities in the United States and Europe. Groupe Canimex emphasizes quality and comprehensive project support, contributing significantly to the industrial community with reported revenues around $215.6 million.

Short Description:
Center is a technology company based in Bellevue, Washington, that specializes in intelligent spend management solutions. The company provides a configurable platform that integrates a connected corporate card, expense management, and travel booking solutions. This unified system allows finance teams to monitor and optimize corporate spending in real time, streamlining the entire expense process from purchase to reconciliation.

Founded by industry veterans, Center aims to enhance operational efficiency for mid-sized businesses and enterprises. Their offerings include a connected corporate card for real-time spending visibility, automated expense management software, and an integrated travel solution that simplifies travel expense management. Center also provides dedicated customer support and self-service resources to help users maximize the platform's benefits. The company serves a diverse client base, including notable customers like AMAROK and the Museum of Glass, reflecting its commitment to transparency and efficiency in corporate spending.

Short Description:
Civ Robotics is a technology company that specializes in robotic construction layout and staking solutions. Founded in 2018, the company has its R&D center in Tel Aviv, Israel, and a U.S. operational subsidiary in San Francisco, California. Civ Robotics develops autonomous unmanned ground and air systems that utilize GNSS technology to automate the marking and staking process on construction sites, enhancing precision and efficiency.

Their flagship products include the CivDot series of ground spraying robots, which can mark thousands of points per day with sub-inch accuracy, and CivMove, aimed at improving construction layout efficiency. The company also offers drone and ground rover-mounted devices for autonomous marking and staking. Civ Robotics' solutions are designed to be user-friendly, allowing individuals without prior surveying experience to operate them. Their technology has been deployed in various sectors, including solar farms, airports, and road construction, across over 19 U.S. states and internationally. The company has secured significant funding to support its growth and has more than 100 robots deployed worldwide.

Short Description:
IMRAE is a specialty coatings manufacturer and professional installer of advanced protective coatings for various types of surface materials for the general building industry. We are a major coatings supplier in the precast concrete market,for both architectural and structural segments of the industry. The company has more than 20-years of combined experiences in trade and research, and we understand the need for delivering quality products that meet or exceed customers' expectations.

We also provide additional service in the installation of our products to both private and public work jobs, under the CoatMasters Coatings Installation Group (C-CIG) a division of IMRAE. 

Our products are marketed under the CoatMasters brand name, a registered trademark of IMRAE.  
We pride ourselves with new technologies that are environmentally friendly, and the ability to provide custom formulations to meet your specific needs. IMRAE's philosophy is to maintain absolute customer satisfaction by providing you with our highest quality products that are extensively researched, practically tested, and qualified according to current industry standards. 

Our customer service and technical service support assures you of our commitment in maintaining an exceptional business relationship that is based on our belief of good product stewardship, uncompromising product quality, and total care for our environment.

From our team at IMRAE, we greatly look forward to servicing your coating needs. 
For questions and assistance, please call us at (951) 413-0240, or vial email at info@imrae.com

Short Description:
Plus Delta Partners is a consulting firm established in 2004 that specializes in professional development programs for non-profit organizations, including higher education institutions and healthcare providers. The firm focuses on enhancing fundraising performance through a combination of group training, individual skill assessments, coaching, and ongoing performance measurement. 

Their comprehensive suite of fundraising training solutions is designed for frontline fundraisers and key stakeholders, promoting integrated advancement models and a disciplined fundraising culture. Plus Delta Partners employs a cohort model for delivering its curriculum, which includes workshops and individual coaching sessions, ensuring that best practices are embedded over time. The firm serves over 400 clients in the U.S. and internationally, emphasizing strategic coaching that leads to increased major gift fundraising and donor contributions.

The company values clear communication, collaborative coaching, and skill development, aiming to generate more resources for its clients. Plus Delta Partners has received investment from Northlane Capital Partners, highlighting its leadership in fundraising training for mission-driven organizations.

Short Description:
DICA USA is a family-owned American manufacturer that specializes in high-performance engineered products for heavy equipment operations. Founded in 1988 by Dick and Carolyn Koberg, the company focuses on creating innovative solutions such as outrigger pads, crane pads, cribbing blocks, magnetic sling protectors, ground protection mats, and temporary roadway solutions. Their products are designed to enhance safety and stability, using durable engineered thermoplastics instead of traditional materials.

DICA's offerings are widely used in industries like construction, utilities, and heavy machinery operations, providing reliable foundations for equipment setups. The company is committed to quality and safety, ensuring that all products comply with ASME B30.5 safety standards. With a global presence, DICA's products are utilized by operators in over 50 countries. Headquartered in Iowa, DICA maintains a strong focus on customer needs and continuous product development.

Short Description:
Dover Fueling Solutions (DFS) is a global leader in energy dispensing equipment and automation systems for the fuel and convenience retail industries. As part of Dover Corporation, DFS provides a wide range of products, including fuel dispensers, pumps, and advanced electronic systems for payment processing. Their offerings support various fuels, such as gasoline, diesel, and clean energy alternatives like LNG, hydrogen, and electric vehicle chargers.

DFS operates under several well-known brands, including Wayne Fueling Systems and Tokheim, catering to diverse fueling environments from large forecourts to smaller installations. The company focuses on enhancing the consumer fueling experience through innovation and operational excellence. Their services encompass sales consultation, delivery, installation, and support from authorized technicians.

With a global presence, DFS has manufacturing and technology facilities in multiple countries, including the United States, Brazil, and China. They serve gas station owners, convenience retailers, and operators looking to upgrade their fueling infrastructure, positioning themselves as partners in the evolution of fueling and charging experiences worldwide.

Short Description:
Electroelsa Srl is an Italian company founded in 1982, specializing in the design and manufacture of rack and pinion construction hoists, material hoists, mast climbing work platforms, and transport platforms for construction sites. With over 40 years of experience, Electroelsa serves customers in more than 90 countries across Asia, North America, Europe, Africa, and Oceania.

The company produces all its products in-house, including mechanical parts and electrical control panels, utilizing advanced technologies like robotic welding and automatic wire numbering systems. This allows Electroelsa to offer customized solutions for various construction projects, ranging from small to large-scale developments. Their product range includes material hoists with load capacities from 400 kg to 5,000 kg, mast climbing work platforms, and transport platforms for personnel and materials.

Electroelsa emphasizes safety, versatility, and innovation in its designs, supported by a dedicated technical office. The company also provides comprehensive services, including on-site training, after-sales support, and technical assistance, ensuring a strong global customer service network.

Short Description:
Polytek Development Corp., established in 1984, is a prominent manufacturer of specialty polymers used in mold making, casting, and coating applications. Their diverse product range includes polyurethane elastomers, silicones, epoxies, latex, thermoplastic elastomers, and tooling board, catering to various industries such as industrial, construction, entertainment, fine arts, and technology.

The company is dedicated to designing high-performance liquid rubbers and related casting products, while also providing exceptional technical support and customer service. Polytek operates through two divisions: an Industrial Division focused on high-performance polymers for commercial sectors, and a Consumer Division that offers user-friendly products for DIY enthusiasts and small businesses. Their recent acquisition of Incredible Solutions in 2020 expanded their consumer product offerings, enhancing their presence in e-commerce and retail markets. With a network of manufacturing and bottling facilities across the U.S., Polytek ensures efficient service and quick delivery to its customers.

Short Description:
Evolv Technology, based in Waltham, Massachusetts, specializes in AI-based physical security solutions aimed at enhancing safety in public spaces. Founded in 2013, the company focuses on innovative weapons detection technology that ensures accurate threat identification while providing a positive experience for visitors. 

The flagship product, Evolv Express®, is an AI-powered platform that screens visitors quickly and non-intrusively for firearms, knives, and other prohibited items. This technology is widely used in various sectors, including sports stadiums, theme parks, schools, and hospitals. As of 2023, Evolv's systems have screened over 500 million people and detected hundreds of weapons daily. The company serves more than 500 venues across 45 U.S. states and Puerto Rico, with a customer base that includes notable organizations such as the CIA, FBI, and TSA. 

Evolv Technology went public in July 2021 and has shown significant financial growth, reporting $76.1 million in revenue for 2024, a 48% increase from the previous year. The company continues to seek partnerships to enhance its security offerings.

Short Description:
Adrian Steel is a prominent company specializing in commercial vehicle upfitting solutions. Founded in 1953 in Michigan, it has evolved from a small structural steel warehouse into a leading enterprise in van and truck equipment, having fitted over one million vehicles. The company manufactures and supplies contractor-grade products designed to optimize commercial vehicles, including shelving, drawers, cabinets, partitions, ladder racks, aluminum toolboxes, and various accessories.

Adrian Steel offers flexible upfitting services that can be performed at the factory, dealer stock, customer locations, or through a bailment pool. This adaptability ensures convenience for its customers. The company focuses on understanding the specific challenges and operational needs of its clients, developing customized solutions that enhance vehicle functionality and efficiency. With a commitment to teamwork and innovation, Adrian Steel continues to serve a wide range of industries, providing effective cargo management and vehicle organization solutions.

Short Description:
Nathan and his wife Amanda started Anchored Threads late Spring 2013. With Nathan's passion for graphic design, the couple decided to start a company selling t-shirts. They soon realized what started off as a dream was becoming a successful endeavor. With a year in the books, Amanda and Nathan had the itch to grow the business. They started asking "what kind of products are people needing?" They soon realized the need to craft products that were functional, aesthetically pleasing, and built to last. 
      Today the couple along with their 6 year old daughter Amariah, craft handmade items in their home using the finest leathers and other materials to ensure longevity and a product you will be proud to pass down for generations.

Allen Engineering Corporation (AEC) is a family-owned company based in Paragould, Arkansas, specializing in the design, engineering, manufacturing, and marketing of concrete and related equipment. Founded in 1964, AEC has grown from a small concrete business into a leading manufacturer with five plants in Northeast Arkansas and nearly 200 employees. The company emphasizes family values and community stewardship, reflecting its deep roots in the region.

AEC offers a wide range of concrete placement, finishing, polishing, and paving equipment. Their notable products include the Razorback® Truss Screed, oscillating bridge deck finishers, walk-behind trowels, and riding trowels. The company serves various sectors, including ready-mix concrete operations and commercial contracting, and distributes its equipment through a global network of dealers and rental centers. With a revenue of approximately $39 million, AEC has established a significant presence in the concrete equipment industry, catering to both domestic and international customers.

Short Description:
Cemen Tech is the largest manufacturer of volumetric concrete mixers, providing innovative on-demand concrete mixing solutions. Founded in the 1960s, the company has evolved into a leader in volumetric proportioning and continuous concrete mixing technology. Their core products include mobile and stationary mixers that store, proportion, mix, and dispense concrete on-site in precise quantities, eliminating the need for traditional batch plants and reducing waste and emissions.

As a 100% employee-owned company, Cemen Tech fosters a culture of innovation, with employees contributing ideas for continuous product improvements. Their mixers are customizable to meet various business needs, serving applications from small repairs to large infrastructure projects. Headquartered in Indianola, Iowa, Cemen Tech serves customers in over 60 countries, including municipalities and contractors, offering cost-effective and environmentally responsible concrete solutions.

Short Description:
Chryso North America specializes in sustainable construction chemicals and fibers, operating under the Saint-Gobain Construction Chemicals group. The company develops advanced chemical solutions, admixtures, and additives that enhance the performance, durability, and sustainability of concrete and cement products across North America.

Chryso North America offers a range of products, including customized cement additives like the EnviroAdd™ portfolio, which optimizes blended cements. Their admixtures, such as Quad™ and Chryso®Convert C, support sustainable construction by enabling the use of locally sourced aggregates. The company promotes circular economy practices through its Circular Economy Program and provides technical support to help customers innovate in the concrete and cement industry.

With a commitment to sustainability and operational efficiency, Chryso North America serves a diverse clientele in the construction sector, including concrete producers and construction companies focused on environmentally responsible practices. Short Description:
Cratos Equipment is a company based in Pompano Beach, Florida, specializing in battery-powered construction and demolition equipment. Founded in 2013, the company focuses on providing safer, cleaner, and more energy-efficient tools for the construction industry. Their product line includes electric skid steers, excavators, dumpers, and wheelbarrows, all designed to operate with zero emissions, making them suitable for indoor and environmentally sensitive job sites.

The equipment from Cratos meets OSHA standards and is engineered to enhance job site safety and worker health. Key benefits include eco-friendly operation, cost-effectiveness with low maintenance needs, and improved efficiency by reducing manual labor. Cratos aims to lead the transition to green power technology in construction, helping contractors meet regulatory requirements and market demands for sustainable equipment. Their primary customers are construction and demolition contractors looking for advanced, eco-responsible solutions to improve project timelines and maintain safer work environments.

Short Description:
Founded in 2003, DuroMax Power Equipment is headquartered in Ontario, California, and leads the market in home power backup solutions. Our Tri Fuel and Dual Fuel portable generators give homeowners the ability to keep critical systems running and stay connected during outages — with the flexibility to handle everything from powering an entire home to running tools and equipment outdoors.

Our product line includes portable generators, high-performance engines, water pumps, and accessories — all built for dependable performance and ease of use. Through advanced engineering, durable construction, and a focus on user needs, we deliver solutions that perform when it matters most.

At DuroMax, we combine the stability of a proven industry leader with the drive of a modern growth company. We move quickly, innovate with purpose, and stay connected to our customers to anticipate the future of portable power. Our vision is clear: Powering Everyone… Anywhere — and redefining what's possible for home energy independence in the years ahead.

Short Description:
The East Montgomery County Improvement District (EMCID) is a political subdivision of Texas, established in 1997 to promote economic, community, and educational development in a 158-square-mile area northeast of Houston. It serves over 80,000 residents across several communities, including New Caney and Porter. EMCID operates as a taxing authority, collecting local sales tax to fund its initiatives and is governed by an elected Board of Directors.

EMCID focuses on stimulating economic growth by attracting retail, commercial, and industrial businesses. It offers various financial incentives, such as cash grants, land incentives, tax rebates, and infrastructure support. The organization also provides low-interest loans through its non-profit subsidiary to qualifying businesses. In addition to economic development, EMCID invests in community projects, grants for local services, and educational scholarships, aiming to enhance the quality of life for residents and build a skilled workforce for the future.

At Eclipse Surface Technologies, we design and manufacture high-performance abrasive blasting equipment built for real-world jobs in restoration, surface prep and industrial maintenance. 

Our lineup includes the ECO-Flex and ClearBlast brands—trusted by contractors, rental houses and facilities teams across the country.

Whether you're cleaning fire-damaged structures, prepping concrete for coatings or removing corrosion from steel, our systems are built to deliver results without the guesswork. Simple controls, clear labeling and rugged construction make our machines easy to operate, maintain and service.

From our custom ECO-X tow-behind systems to our portable units, every piece of equipment we make is proudly manufactured in the USA and supported by real people who know blasting.

We don't just build equipment—we back it up with service, rentals, parts and honest support from people who understand the work.

Looking for a smarter way to blast? Let's talk.

Short Description:
FIORI GROUP S.p.A. is an Italian company established in 1942, based in Finale Emilia, Modena. It specializes in designing, developing, and manufacturing off-road concrete batching vehicles, self-loading concrete mixers, dump trucks, and silos for the construction industry. The company is known for pioneering the self-loading concrete mixer in 1965, which allows for the simultaneous production, transportation, and casting of concrete.

The product lineup includes advanced self-loading mixers featuring the proprietary CBV 2.0 system, which acts as a mobile batching plant. This system ensures precise weighing of mix ingredients, recipe management, and remote connectivity with cement silos for automatic loading. FIORI GROUP also offers front loaders, site dumpers, and cement dispensers, providing comprehensive solutions for on-site concrete production and transportation. The company is dedicated to customer support, offering assistance, consultancy, and tailored solutions to enhance efficiency and reduce environmental impact.

With a global presence, FIORI GROUP operates direct offices in Singapore and Brazil and has a distribution network in over 60 countries. The company is expanding into strategic markets like India to better serve local construction companies and contractors.

Short Description:
Flores Automation & Machine Control (FAMC) is a specialized company based in Muskego, Wisconsin, focused on advanced automation and machine control solutions for the industrial and construction sectors. With over 12 years in business and an A+ rating from the BBB since 2021, FAMC is dedicated to delivering tailored solutions that enhance production efficiency and quality.

The company operates in two main areas. First, it provides industrial automation and custom machine building services, designing and delivering turnkey automation systems, robotic cells, and complete automation lines. FAMC is a Fanuc-authorized robotic system integrator, offering services that include machine control, process automation, and project management. Second, FAMC specializes in 3D stringless machine control systems for construction, improving accuracy and efficiency in road construction applications by eliminating traditional string lines.

Led by Frank Flores, the company serves a diverse clientele across various markets, emphasizing collaboration, service, and innovation to help clients optimize their operations.

Short Description:
Ford Pro is a business unit of Ford Motor Company that specializes in comprehensive commercial vehicle solutions. It focuses on assisting commercial customers, including businesses and local governments, in transitioning to electric and connected vehicle technologies. Ford Pro combines physical vehicle services with digital software systems tailored for business use, enabling fleet managers to track vehicles, enhance safety, and improve service delivery.

The company offers a range of services, including commercial vehicles like trucks and vans, many of which are being electrified as part of Ford's broader strategy. Ford Pro provides a digital fleet management system designed to monitor vehicle status and optimize operations, addressing specific needs for electric vehicles such as battery management. Additionally, it supports customers in navigating the shift to electric vehicles and offers integrated service solutions to maintain vehicle efficiency and productivity.

Grizzly Coolers is a U.S.-based company that designs and manufactures high-quality outdoor coolers and related products. Founded in 1983 and headquartered in Decorah, Iowa, the company is recognized for its durable, bear-proof coolers that are rotationally molded and made in the USA. Grizzly Coolers emphasizes superior quality and performance, offering a Lifetime Warranty and certification from the Interagency Grizzly Bear Committee for their products.

In addition to coolers, Grizzly Coolers provides insulated water bottles and travel mugs, catering to outdoor enthusiasts engaged in activities like fishing, hunting, camping, and boating. The company focuses on using eco-friendly materials, such as Ecomate insulation, and promotes American manufacturing, appealing to customers who value sustainability and domestic production. Grizzly Coolers is dedicated to serving those who are passionate about outdoor adventures with reliable and long-lasting products.
