Short Description:
Hiab USA is the American division of Hiab, a global leader in the load handling industry. Established in 1944 in Sweden, Hiab is known for inventing the first hydraulic loader crane, which transformed load handling. Hiab USA provides a wide range of load handling equipment, including knuckle boom cranes, demountable container handlers, forestry cranes, truck-mounted forklifts, and tail lifts. Their products are engineered for various lifting and material handling needs across multiple industries.

The company focuses on precision, performance, reliability, and safety, incorporating advanced features like the SPACE control system and functions such as Crane Tip Control and Smart Automation. Hiab USA serves diverse customers in construction, industrial logistics, forestry, and general haulage, facilitating tasks like delivering steel fabrications, moving heavy items, and handling specialized loads. With a rich history of innovation and a global service network, Hiab USA is dedicated to helping customers optimize their operations while ensuring safety.

Short Description:
Justrite Safety Group is a global leader in industrial safety solutions, established in 1906. The company specializes in creating safer storage and handling products for flammable and hazardous materials. It operates 11 facilities across North America and worldwide, offering a wide range of safety products designed to protect people, property, and the environment.

The product lineup includes safety cans, safety cabinets, outdoor safety storage, spill containment systems, and gas cylinder storage equipment. Justrite's products are designed to meet or exceed regulatory standards from OSHA, EPA, and NFPA, ensuring workplace safety and compliance. The company has expanded its expertise through strategic acquisitions, enhancing its offerings in industrial safety and environmental protection.

Justrite Safety Group serves a diverse range of industrial customers, providing reliable safety solutions and expert technical support. The company is committed to quality, with many products made from domestically sourced materials, reflecting its dedication to American manufacturing. Overall, Justrite Safety Group focuses on innovation and compliance to help create safer work environments.

Short Description:
Magid, also known as Magid Glove & Safety, is a family-owned manufacturer and distributor of personal protective equipment (PPE) based in Romeoville, Illinois. Founded in 1946, the company initially specialized in leather work gloves for the steel industry and has since expanded its offerings to include a wide range of industrial safety gear. Magid operates a large facility and distributes over 700 safety brands, employing more than 1,300 people globally.

The company provides various services, including OSHA-ready safety assessments and modernized business solutions that enhance manufacturing and ordering processes. Magid serves a diverse customer base, including industrial workers, healthcare professionals, and government agencies. During the COVID-19 pandemic, the company played a vital role in ensuring the availability of reliable PPE. Committed to sustainability, Magid incorporates eco-friendly practices and supports community initiatives, reflecting its dedication to safety innovation and social responsibility.

Short Description:
MAI International GmbH is an Austrian company with over 50 years of experience in plaster and grouting technology, as well as 3D concrete printing applications. Founded in 1965 and headquartered in Austria, the company is a global leader in manufacturing reliable machinery for the construction and civil engineering sectors.

The company specializes in machines for mixing, pumping, and conveying construction materials, with a strong focus on plaster and injection technology. MAI International is also recognized for its advanced 3D concrete printing technology, which allows for the precise layer-by-layer construction of concrete structures. Their user-friendly 3D printing machines are designed to deliver efficient results for modern building projects.

MAI International serves a diverse range of customers, including construction companies and civil engineering firms worldwide. The company is dedicated to providing innovative solutions tailored to the unique needs of its clients, reinforcing its commitment to advancing construction technology.

Short Description:
Multiquip Inc., established in 1973 and based in Cypress, California, is a leading manufacturer and supplier of high-quality products and solutions. The company caters to various markets, including construction, industrial, telecom, government, aerospace, and entertainment.

Multiquip's product offerings include light to medium construction equipment, power generators, and lighting solutions. Their construction equipment features rammers, rollers, vibratory plate compactors, and concrete pumping tools. In power generation, they provide a range of diesel, gasoline, and natural gas-powered generators from 2.3 kW to 2,000 kW. The company also manufactures and distributes several brands, including MQ Power, Whiteman, Mayco, and Essick, along with other recognized brands like Mikasa and Denyo.

With a global presence, Multiquip distributes its products in over 70 countries through a vast network of authorized partners, serving a diverse clientele that includes construction firms, industrial companies, and government agencies.

Short Description:
Nomaco is a U.S.-based manufacturer founded in 1979, originally as a subsidiary of the Belgian company NMC. Headquartered in Zebulon, North Carolina, Nomaco is recognized for its expertise in designing and extruding custom-engineered foam products. The company pioneered direct extruded, flexible pipe insulation in the U.S. market and has since expanded its product offerings.

Nomaco's portfolio includes mechanical plumbing insulation for residential and light commercial applications, backer rod for heavy construction, and various custom foam items. Its products cater to a wide range of markets, including construction, insulation, home furnishings, packaging, fitness, and recreation. The company emphasizes domestic manufacturing and has received multiple Gold Safety Awards for workplace safety from the North Carolina Department of Labor. 

With a strong focus on quality and energy efficiency, Nomaco serves industries that require reliable foam insulation and components, positioning itself as a leader in the foam manufacturing sector.

Short Description:
Parts ASAP, formerly known as All States Ag Parts, is a prominent supplier of agricultural and construction equipment parts in North America. Founded in 1998 by David Dyke and his sons, the company has expanded into a robust network with over 700 employees and 30 locations across the United States and Canada. They offer an extensive inventory of more than 850,000 parts, including new, used, and remanufactured components for various major equipment brands.

The company operates multiple facilities, including salvage yards, rebuild centers, and a large distribution center in Lake Mills, Iowa. Parts ASAP provides same-day shipping on over 50,000 parts, ensuring fast service for customers. They also emphasize convenience with online accounts for quicker checkout and order tracking. Headquartered in Downing, Wisconsin, Parts ASAP continues to grow under the leadership of President and CEO John Dyke, supported by private equity firm Kinderhook Industries.

Short Description:
PierTech Systems, LLC is a U.S.-based manufacturer specializing in helical piers, high capacity helical piles, anchors, and foundation construction and repair equipment. Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Chesterfield, Missouri, the company serves both residential and commercial construction markets with innovative foundation stabilization products. Their manufacturing takes place in St. Louis, Missouri, supported by an in-house engineering team that provides solutions nationwide.

The product lineup includes round and square shaft helical piers, the patented Hercules™ large diameter pipe pile, push piers, and various connection accessories. PierTech's helical piers and piles are versatile, used for applications such as sealing cracked walls, supporting industrial towers, and underpinning existing buildings. Notable products include the PierTech Helical Deck Pier System, which offers a fast, cost-effective alternative to traditional concrete foundations for decks. PierTech Systems is committed to superior customer service and technical expertise, offering free monthly installer certification seminars to support contractors.

Short Description:
The Post-Tensioning Institute (PTI) is a nonprofit organization focused on advancing post-tensioned, prestressed concrete design and construction. Established in 1976, PTI serves as a leading authority in the post-tensioning industry, offering valuable resources such as design and construction information, education, research, and code development.

PTI represents a diverse community of over 500 members, including engineers, architects, contractors, and material fabricators from North America, Asia, and Europe. The organization publishes a technical journal, hosts annual engineering conferences, and develops industry standards that guide best practices in post-tensioned concrete. PTI promotes the use of post-tensioning through various initiatives, addressing technical challenges and enhancing the quality of construction in this field.

Short Description:
Robert Bosch Tool Corporation NA is a prominent manufacturer and supplier of power tools, rotary and oscillating tools, and power tool accessories. It is part of the Bosch Group, a well-established German engineering and technology company. The North American division was formed in 2003, consolidating Bosch’s power tool operations in the region.

The company offers a variety of well-known brands, including Bosch, Dremel, CST Berger, Rotozip, and Vermont American. These brands are recognized for their innovation and high performance, catering to construction professionals, home improvement enthusiasts, and tool specialists. Products are distributed through various channels, including hardware stores and home improvement centers.

Headquartered in Mount Prospect, Illinois, Robert Bosch Tool Corporation employs over 10,000 people in the U.S. and generates significant revenues in the power tools market. As part of a global network, the company benefits from extensive research, development, and manufacturing capabilities, reinforcing its commitment to quality and engineering excellence.

Short Description:
RubbleCrusher is a UK-based company that designs and manufactures compact crushing and screening equipment for the construction and demolition (C&D) industry. Established in 1996 as a division of CMB International Limited, RubbleCrusher focuses on providing on-site recycling solutions that promote a zero-waste approach and contribute to a circular economy by enabling the reuse of C&D waste materials.

The company offers a range of products, including compact crushers that process construction waste on-site, high-quality screeners for separating materials, and portable mobile crushing units that support flexible recycling operations. RubbleCrusher's equipment is designed to be durable and user-friendly, catering to the needs of small to medium-sized construction projects. The company serves construction and demolition firms, contractors, and businesses committed to sustainability and resource efficiency within the construction sector.

Short Description:
Samsara is a technology company founded in 2015 by Sanjit Biswas and John Bicket, who previously co-founded Meraki. The company specializes in digitizing and optimizing physical operations for industrial businesses by integrating hardware, software, and cloud computing.

Samsara offers a Connected Operations Platform that combines IoT sensors, AI-powered dash cameras, GPS tracking, and cloud-based software. This platform provides real-time visibility and analytics for fleet management, equipment monitoring, and worksite operations. Key products include AI dash cameras that enhance safety, vehicle gateways, and sensors that monitor various operational variables, along with software solutions for route optimization and predictive maintenance.

With over 19,000 core customers, including small businesses and large enterprises across various industries, Samsara generates revenue through subscription-based services and hardware sales. The company has a global presence with offices in multiple countries and went public in December 2021, achieving significant annual recurring revenue milestones.

SASE Company, LLC is a manufacturer and supplier specializing in concrete preparation and polishing equipment, tooling, and chemicals. Founded in 1985, the company has expanded from a small team to over 60 employees, bringing more than 100 years of combined experience in the concrete grinding and polishing industry. With multiple offices across the United States and Canada, SASE emphasizes strong customer service and long-term relationships.

SASE engineers and manufactures its own equipment, ensuring high product quality. The company is recognized for its diamond tooling technology and concrete polishing machinery. Their product range includes concrete grinders and polishers, available in various sizes and power options, designed for tasks from coating removal to achieving high-gloss finishes. Additionally, SASE offers a full lineup of concrete chemicals, including repair products, densifiers, sealers, and cleaners, all aimed at enhancing floor performance and durability. SASE targets contractors and professionals in the industry, providing exceptional customer service and technical support to foster lasting partnerships.

Short Description:
Soudal USA is the American branch of Soudal Group, a global leader in sealants, foams, and adhesives. Founded in 1966 in Belgium, Soudal has grown from a small family business into a multinational corporation with a presence in over 100 countries. Soudal USA operates a manufacturing and distribution facility in Elizabethtown, Kentucky, serving the North American market.

The company offers a wide range of products, including high-quality silicone sealants, polyurethane foams for insulation and bonding, and various adhesives for construction and industrial applications. Soudal USA also markets products under associated brands like Dynatex and BOSS. Its customer base includes construction professionals, industrial manufacturers, automotive repair shops, and retail customers, all benefiting from the company's commitment to quality and innovation.

Short Description:
StaalX is an independent online e-commerce platform based in Chicago, Illinois, specializing in concrete reinforcements and a variety of steel products. Their offerings include reinforcing bars (rebar), wire mesh, post-tensioning materials, and both structural and ornamental steel products. StaalX serves customers across the United States, with a strong focus on the Chicago and Northwest Indiana regions.

The company aims to simplify transactions in the steel and metals industry by connecting contractors and buyers with trusted suppliers through a streamlined online marketplace. StaalX provides competitive pricing, multiple seller listings, and fast delivery options, sometimes as early as the next day. They cater primarily to contractors, construction companies, and steel buyers involved in commercial, industrial, energy, and infrastructure projects. Founded in 2021, StaalX is committed to innovation, accountability, and customer service, with plans to expand its product offerings in the future.

Short Description:
Please visit our website at www.stephensmfg.com for more!

Our factory has been located in Tompkinsville, KY, since its beginning in 1957. By some standards, it's a small town, but we have a lot of good, hardworking employees who take a lot of pride in their work.

We would be delighted to have you visit our factory. You and your family can also find a lot of points of interest in our part of the USA. Music City, USA, Nashville, TN, the Grand Ol' Opry in Nashville (90 miles), and the National Corvette Museum in Bowling Green, KY (60 miles), are among our featured attractions. The national park, Mammoth Cave (50 miles), is a true natural wonder. Also, the Great Hills and "hollers" have plenty of hunting, fishing, and boating available.

Tompkinsville has an airport with a 4,000 x 75 ft. runway, latitude 36o 43' 30"; longitude 85 o 39' 15" W, NDB 384.

Short Description:
SubBase is a procurement software platform designed for commercial specialty contractors and self-performing general contractors in the construction industry. It streamlines the material purchasing and procurement workflow by connecting field teams, office staff, and vendors in a centralized hub. The platform enhances visibility, reduces manual data entry, and automates key processes to improve efficiency and cost control in material management.

Developed by construction professionals, SubBase integrates seamlessly with existing systems like FOUNDATION® accounting software. It simplifies procurement management by allowing users to send multiple Requests for Quotes (RFQs) with a single click and provides real-time budget tracking to maintain financial control. The software also features automated invoice reconciliation, communication tools, and customizable material database management, all accessible via mobile devices. SubBase aims to help contractors reduce material spend and gain better control over their supply chains through its comprehensive, web-based solution.

Terrazzo & Marble Supply Companies is a manufacturer and distributor based in Wheeling, Illinois, specializing in terrazzo, marble, resinous solutions, and natural stone products. With over 75 years of experience, the company is recognized as a leading supplier in its industry. As a 100% employee-owned business, it prioritizes strong customer relationships and a commitment to quality and service.

The company serves architects, designers, and contractors by providing expert guidance and customized product solutions tailored to specific project needs. Their extensive product range includes terrazzo, marble, natural stone, and resinous flooring solutions, with options for various colors and textures. Terrazzo & Marble Supply Companies also offers sample requests and operates showrooms staffed with design teams to assist clients with project challenges. Their focus is on delivering high-quality materials and professional support for commercial, institutional, and residential projects.

Short Description:
The Secure Everything Tension Strap

Welcome! From construction to adventure to everyday life, Titan Straps has offered a simpler, safer and more secure strapping solution since 2010. Highly durable and utilitarian, our tension straps serve multiple purposes. Lash your ladder or steel pipes to your truck rack. Secure gear to your motorcycle or bicycle for off-road adventures. Or bind your skis together for backcountry trips. Use them with one hand, in freezing temps or with gloves on. The possibilities are infinite! 

The first wide, stronger polyurethane tension strap on the market made in a variety of colors, we took the traditional ski strap to the next level. It wasn't until years later that other companies followed suit with varied colors and industrial-strength straps.

Bungees stretch out and break. And face it, ratchet straps serve a purpose, but are heavy, get stuck and are difficult to use when wet and frozen. Titan Straps couldn't be easier to use. And on this Facebook page we'll show you the hundreds of ways you can simplify your life with Titan Straps. Have questions or comments? Please message us or post in the comments section.

1% For the Planet: We commit to creating a healthier planet by contributing 1% of our annual pre-tax revenue to environmental causes.

Short Description:
Trimble Inc. is a global technology company founded in 1978 and headquartered in Westminster, Colorado. It specializes in integrated hardware, software, and services that connect the physical and digital worlds, enhancing workflows and productivity across various industries. Trimble holds over 1,000 patents and serves a diverse customer base in construction, agriculture, geospatial, transportation, and the public sector.

The company offers a wide range of products and services, including construction solutions for site positioning and project management, precision agriculture systems that utilize GPS technology, geospatial tools for surveying and mapping, and transportation solutions for fleet management and supply chain optimization. Trimble's technology combines advanced hardware with software platforms to facilitate data integration and workflow automation. Its commitment to innovation, customer focus, and sustainability drives its mission to transform how industries operate.

Short Description:
Volanti Displays, founded in 2013-2014 and based in California, specializes in designing and manufacturing high-quality touchscreen display solutions for the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industries. Their products aim to enhance efficiency and productivity during plan reviews and project collaboration by offering large, responsive digital displays that replace traditional paper plans and small screens.

The company’s main offerings include Plan Review Tables and custom digital touchscreen displays, all designed and assembled in California. These displays feature ergonomic adjustments such as tilt and height options, providing a full view of detailed plans without the need for pinching or zooming. Volanti's rugged hardware is built to endure challenging job site conditions, making it suitable for subcontractors, general contractors, and other AEC professionals.

Volanti Displays is committed to delivering adaptable solutions tailored to the unique needs of each project, with a focus on customer productivity and support. Their experienced team ensures strong industry partnerships and top-tier client assistance.

Short Description:
Wacker Neuson Group is a prominent global manufacturer of light and compact construction equipment, based in Munich, Germany. Established in 1848, the company has grown from a blacksmith workshop into an international group with brands like Wacker Neuson, Kramer, Weidemann, and Enar. It operates production sites in Germany, Austria, the United States, China, and Serbia.

The company offers a diverse range of products, including soil and asphalt compaction machines, concrete technology, demolition tools, and utility equipment. Wacker Neuson is recognized for its innovation, holding over 300 patents and continuously developing new technologies, such as the first electric rammer and recent zero-emission solutions. It serves various sectors, including construction, agriculture, landscaping, and municipal services, providing value-added services and digital solutions to enhance efficiency on job sites. With approximately 6,000 employees, Wacker Neuson is committed to delivering reliable and advanced equipment to its customers worldwide.

We are truly a family business that started when company founders George F. Wagman, Sr., and his son George F. Our inventory and our way of operating our business is designed to meet the needs of the heavy construction trades.    We ship in stock orders the same day if the order is placed by 9 AM, and we do not charge a delivery fee if the order meets our $75.00 minimum. Short Description:
Established in 1987 and located in Houston, Texas, Accumulators, Inc.® is the technological leader for all types of accumulators. Why do our customers rate us so highly? We consistently deliver the correct product quickly and on-time, and we will do the same for you! We are your accumulator specialists. We are an ISO 9001-2008 certified company.

Our accumulators and related products are useful in many industries including but not limited to:
Oil Field and Petro-Chemical
Ground Support and Agriculture
Entertainment Simulators
Manufacturing
Renewable Energy Generation
Defense and Maritime
Aerospace and Transport
Machine Tools
Rubber and Plastics Manufacturing
Mining

We hold Type Approvals with DNV, ABS, CE, and many other agencies and code requirements.  We are an ASME approved facility and all our bladder accumulators are ASME code stamped (U stamp).   We can provide Piston Accumulators from 1 Quart to 140 Gallons and bladder accumulators from 1 quart up to 15 gallon up to 10,000 psi with an endless choice of options, etc.  We also manufacture an all 316 stainless steel model rated up to 2000 psi.  ALL of our products are seamless, no welding.
 
We provide a complete program of options for our products:  special ID coatings, OD paints to customer specifications; all stainless steel component parts for the gas and fluid ends, and a wide variety of fluid port options. We have shipped thousands of bladder accumulators for surface and subsea operations up to 10,000 foot depth that have been DNV, ABS, NR13, AS1210 approved.
 
Our company has very impressive inventories, and our service and response time is second to none.  Please don't hesitate to contact us at any time.

Acrow Bridge is a design and engineering company based in Parsippany, New Jersey, specializing in prefabricated modular steel bridging solutions. Founded in 1951, Acrow has over 70 years of experience serving the transportation and construction industries globally. The company designs and manufactures modular steel bridges for various applications, including permanent infrastructure, temporary crossings, military operations, and emergency responses. Their projects span more than 150 countries across Africa, Asia, the Americas, Europe, and the Middle East.

In addition to bridge solutions, Acrow offers full-service engineering and design support tailored to specific project needs. They also engage in training programs to develop local skills in assembly, installation, and maintenance of their bridges. Acrow works with a diverse customer base, including transportation departments, military organizations, and construction firms, ensuring rapid deployment of bridging solutions to meet urgent infrastructure demands. The company is committed to quality and innovation, supported by a dedicated team of over 300 employees.

AGTEK Development Company, Inc. is a software company founded in 1981 and based in Livermore, California. It specializes in high-tech surveying, analysis, and control solutions for the heavy construction industry. AGTEK aims to provide practical and user-friendly productivity tools that help construction professionals improve accuracy, efficiency, and project management in earthwork and construction processes.

As part of Hexagon’s Geosystems Division, AGTEK offers a range of construction software solutions. These include estimating and takeoff tools, machine control modeling, drone survey simplification, machine motion logging, and project tracking and management. Their platform enhances collaboration and visualization, enabling data-driven decision-making and supporting sustainable construction practices. AGTEK serves over 3,500 customers, including notable firms like PCL Construction and Ford Civil Engineering, with a focus on improving digital construction workflows and earthwork estimation.

Atlas Roofing Corporation is a prominent North American manufacturer and distributor of premium building materials, focusing on roofing products and insulation. Established in 1982 in Meridian, Mississippi, the company has grown to operate 36 manufacturing and distribution locations across the United States, Canada, and Mexico.

The company’s offerings are organized into four main divisions: Polyiso Roof & Wall Insulation, which produces rigid insulation products; Shingles & Underlayments, which manufactures asphalt shingles and roof underlayments; Molded Products, providing architectural and industrial components; and Web Technologies, developing specialized coated and paper facers. Atlas Roofing is dedicated to quality, innovation, and customer service, supporting roofing contractors and builders with resources like the AtlasPRO Portal for consultation and training. The company also engages in sustainable projects, showcasing its technical expertise and commitment to long-term roofing performance.

BETONSTAR Concrete Pumps is a Turkish company founded in 2008, specializing in the production, sale, and export of concrete pumps. With over 30 years of manufacturing experience, the company employs around 300 staff and has established itself as a leading player in the concrete pump industry, exporting to more than 50 countries.

The company operates a large production facility in Torbalı, İzmir, where it designs and manufactures a variety of concrete pumping equipment. BETONSTAR's product lineup includes truck-mounted concrete pumps with boom lengths from 20 to 58 meters, mixer pumps, stationary concrete pumps for high-rise buildings, and hydraulic concrete placing booms. The company emphasizes innovation, having developed its own software, Smartstar, to enhance pump functionality. BETONSTAR is committed to quality and has a strong global presence, with active markets in the United States, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and Australia.

Short Description:
Bounce Back Surfaces provides in-depth industry and product knowledge with over 50 years of combined experience in the surfacing sector. Servicing both Canada & the USA, we believe there is a lot to offer the surfacing industry. From industry leading materials, and first hand knowledge of surfacing and customer service, Bounce Back Surfaces has the ability to service contractors with much more in depth product knowledge and is better suited to be a well rounded supplier. We want to see our contractors succeed in their businesses, and we believe we are the partners to help make that happen. 

Stargum has been manufacturing various types of rubber products and mixtures for over 40 years. They are always implementing the latest technologies and adhere to ISO 9001 and 14001. 

There mission has always been to provide high quality products that meet their customers expectations. Their vastness of knowledge and experience they are able to develop products tailored to customer's needs and meeting the high standard of both quality and environment. 

They are a trusted supplier of granules for sport and leisurely surfaces in Europe, Canada, and the USA. 

Polytech binders are known for their exceptional strength and flexibility, making them ideal for high-impact areas like playgrounds, sports fields, and recreational spaces. When applied to Stargum rubber granules, the binders create a strong, yet cushioned surface that offers excellent shock absorption and impact resistance. This helps minimize the risk of injuries from falls, making it a vital component of recreational safety surfacing.

With extensive 3rd party testing, as well as years of tracking insitu installations, we believe we are offering our clients the best available binders on the market.

Central Data, established in 1973 and headquartered in Farmington, Michigan, is a strategic software and services provider dedicated to wholesale distributors across North America. The company focuses on enhancing productivity, profitability, and growth through cloud-based technology solutions, particularly with its partnership with Infor CloudSuite Distribution, a tailored cloud ERP platform for distributors.

Central Data offers a wide range of services, including cloud ERP implementation and support, cloud hosting, business consulting, and specialized consulting for automated tax compliance. The company also provides data analytics and business intelligence solutions to help distributors with budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting. Its proprietary products include the Infor CloudSuite Distribution and CD Rental, an equipment rental platform that integrates seamlessly with its ERP solutions.

With a commitment to being a trusted technology partner, Central Data serves wholesale distributors of all sizes, focusing on those transitioning to cloud-based ERP systems and seeking to optimize their operations in a competitive B2B marketplace.

Centurion Safety Products Ltd is a UK-based company that designs and manufactures personal protective equipment (PPE), focusing on above-the-neck protection. Founded in 1879 and headquartered in Thetford, Norfolk, the company has over 140 years of experience in safeguarding workers across various industries.

Centurion specializes in a range of products, including safety helmets, bump caps, respiratory protection systems, face protection, and hearing protection. Notable innovations include the lightweight Concept Helmet, the versatile Nexus Helmet, and the environmentally sustainable E:Protect Nexus helmet made from renewable materials. The company serves a diverse customer base, including heavy industries like coal mining, construction, and manufacturing, ensuring its products meet stringent safety standards.

With a commitment to innovation and sustainability, Centurion Safety Products is recognized as a trusted partner in workplace safety. It is a founding member of the British Safety Industry Federation and actively participates in shaping head protection legislation in the EU.

Short Description:
ChemGrout, Inc. is a prominent manufacturer of grouting equipment, based in LaGrange Park, Illinois, with over 60 years of experience in the industry. Founded in 1963, the company initially provided field services for cement and chemical grouting before shifting its focus entirely to the design and production of grouting equipment. ChemGrout now offers the largest selection of grouting equipment globally, including colloidal and paddle-type grout mixers, as well as various grout pumps.

The company’s equipment is designed for high performance, supporting outputs up to 45 gallons per minute and pressures up to 2000 PSI. Their popular CG680 High-Pressure Series is widely used in underground construction for water cut-offs and contact grouting. ChemGrout serves a diverse range of industries, including mining, tunneling, highways, and environmental remediation, and is known for its durable and reliable products. Led by Ben Schatz and his son Joe, ChemGrout continues to innovate and maintain a strong reputation in the grouting equipment market.

Short Description:
Reading Truck is a prominent American manufacturer and distributor of work truck bodies, established in 1955 in Reading, Pennsylvania. Originally a small body works shop, the company has evolved into one of the largest truck equipment manufacturers in the U.S., focusing on durable and efficient truck bodies for contractors. 

The company offers a diverse range of precision-crafted work truck bodies, including service bodies, enclosed service bodies, crane bodies, dump and landscape bodies, and hauler and platform bodies. All products are made in America and can be customized to meet specific customer requirements. In addition to manufacturing, Reading Truck provides expert installation and a variety of technical and mechanical services through its nationwide network of Reading Truck Centers. These services include preventative maintenance, equipment inspections, on-site repairs, and emergency repairs.

With a workforce of over 2,100 employees, Reading Truck is dedicated to craftsmanship and customer service. The company supports contractors and fleet operators across the country, with reported annual revenue of approximately $512.8 million.

Target Freight Management, Inc. (TFM) is a technology-driven third-party logistics company based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. Founded in 2008, TFM specializes in transportation management systems across North America, focusing on Less Than Truckload (LTL), Full Truckload, Parcel, and International freight services. The company utilizes patented technology and innovative solutions to deliver comprehensive freight management.

TFM provides a variety of services, including end-to-end freight management, mode optimization, and transportation consulting. They offer specialized logistics solutions tailored to meet unique customer needs, handle transportation claims, and conduct freight audits to ensure accuracy and cost control. With a commitment to excellent customer service and continuous technological enhancements, TFM supports businesses in achieving efficient and cost-effective freight transportation and logistics management.

With around 80 employees and annual revenues of approximately $26.1 million, Target Freight Management has positioned itself as a leader in the logistics industry, recognized for its dedication to innovation and customer satisfaction.

MTN OPS LLC is an American performance-lifestyle company based in Fruit Heights, Utah. Founded in 2014, it specializes in developing and distributing outdoor energy and nutritional products. The company offers a wide range of supplements designed to enhance endurance, energy, muscle recovery, and overall physical performance for outdoor activities and workouts.

The product lineup includes energy supplements like *Ignite* and *Enduro*, hydration products such as *Hydrate*, and protein bars like *Performance Bars* and *Venture Bars*. Additionally, MTN OPS provides muscle and recovery supplements, including *Magnum* and *Ammo*. The brand targets outdoorsmen, athletes, and fitness enthusiasts, promoting a community-driven lifestyle and social responsibility by donating a meal for every purchase. With a commitment to quality and customer well-being, MTN OPS has built a trusted community of over 100,000 users who benefit from its products.

North American Rescue, LLC (NAR) is dedicated to reducing preventable deaths by providing high-quality medical products designed for challenging casualty care situations. Headquartered in Greer, South Carolina, NAR employs a team of experts, including former Special Operations medics and military medical officers, to develop innovative lifesaving solutions. Their products are based on Tactical Combat Casualty Care (TCCC) guidelines and evidence-based medicine.

NAR offers a wide range of medical products for tactical and emergency care, such as tourniquets, emergency trauma dressings, junctional treatment tools, and hypothermic treatment sacks. These products are designed to empower responders to act quickly in life-threatening emergencies, enhancing survivability in unpredictable environments. NAR serves a diverse customer base, including military forces, federal agencies, civilian law enforcement, and emergency medical services, with a commitment to American-made quality and innovation.

Short Description:
BinMaster Level Controls is a U.S.-based industrial automation company that specializes in bulk material monitoring solutions. Founded in 1953 in Lincoln, Nebraska, the company has grown from a small tool and die shop into a prominent manufacturer of point and continuous level indicators and inventory management systems. Their products are designed for monitoring bulk solids and liquids in various containers, including bins, tanks, silos, and hoppers.

The company offers a wide range of level control technologies, including rotary paddle indicators, capacitance probes, vibrating rods, and advanced radar and ultrasonic sensors. BinMaster also provides inventory management systems that integrate wireless devices and web applications for real-time data transmission. Their BinTrac® weighing systems and the BinCloud IoT platform further enhance inventory tracking and management across multiple industries, including agriculture, animal feed, chemicals, microbreweries, and more. BinMaster's solutions are scalable, catering to both single-site installations and complex, networked systems for multinational operations.

Short Description:
Bullard is a historic American company recognized for its pioneering role in industrial safety equipment, particularly hard hats. Founded in the late 19th century, Bullard introduced the first commercially available industrial hard hat, known as the "Hard Boiled Hat," in 1919. This innovation set new standards for worker head protection and has been widely adopted across various industries, including construction, mining, and emergency response.

Today, Bullard's product portfolio includes hard hats and helmets, fire helmets for emergency responders, supplied-air respirators, and other personal protective equipment designed to enhance worker safety in high-risk environments. The company has a strong legacy of innovation, contributing significantly to workplace safety advancements and reducing injuries and fatalities. Bullard serves a diverse range of customers, including workers and employers in construction, industrial manufacturing, and emergency services.

Short Description:
The Concrete Sawing & Drilling Association (CSDA) is a nonprofit trade association established in 1972. It represents contractors, manufacturers, and affiliated members in the concrete construction and renovation industry. CSDA's mission is to promote professional specialty cutting, polishing, and imaging methods, focusing on safety, quality, and integrity.

With around 500 international member companies, CSDA provides a platform for networking and sharing ideas. The association offers training programs, including Sawing & Drilling 101 and Operator Certification, to enhance industry skills. CSDA advocates for safety in the workplace through partnerships, providing guidance on issues like electrical safety and hearing protection. It also publishes *Concrete Openings* magazine, which features industry news and insights for concrete cutting professionals.

CSDA serves contractors, general contractors, specifiers, and other professionals involved in concrete projects, promoting efficient and safe concrete cutting and drilling services. The association is dedicated to advancing the profession through education, safety advocacy, and the promotion of best practices.

The magazine's mission is to inform and inspire construction business leaders by providing valuable insights on achieving peak performance. The company focuses on delivering comprehensive technology services that drive successful business outcomes. The company utilizes a proprietary AIM methodology—Advise, Implement, and Manage—to guide clients through architecture planning, strategic transformation, and ongoing managed services. CTS Cement Manufacturing Corporation, based in California, specializes in high-performance cement products for construction professionals, homeowners, and do-it-yourself customers. Founded in 1960 by civil engineer Edward K. Rice, the company is known for pioneering Type-K shrinkage-compensating cement and introducing Rapid Set® calcium sulfoaluminate (CSA) cement technology in 1980, which provides faster hardening and durability compared to traditional portland cement.

The company offers over 70 products for various applications, including architectural projects, bridges, flooring, and waterproofing. Key products include Rapid Set® Cement, which is recognized for its quick strength gain, and Komponent®, a shrinkage-compensating additive that enhances concrete performance. CTS Cement controls its production process from raw material mining to distribution, ensuring quality and traceability. With multiple blending and packaging plants across North America, including a major facility in Georgia, the company serves a diverse customer base, including transportation departments and municipalities. Headquartered in Garden Grove, California, CTS Cement employs around 210 people and generates approximately $87.6 million in revenue.

Short Description:
Dope Marketing is a direct print and mail marketing company dedicated to helping local and home service businesses grow through automated marketing solutions. Founded by CEO Dave Carroll, the company offers a comprehensive platform that integrates real-time CRM data, hyperlocal targeting, and zero-minimum direct mail services. This allows businesses to manage their marketing efforts from software to printing and shipping seamlessly.

The company provides a range of services, including direct mail marketing with options like postcards, yard signs, and custom gift boxes. Their marketing automation features enable businesses to trigger campaigns based on customer actions, ensuring timely and targeted outreach. With a focus on local industries such as roofing, lawn care, and HVAC, Dope Marketing aims to make marketing predictable and data-driven, supporting businesses in generating leads and enhancing customer loyalty. The in-house printing and fulfillment capabilities ensure quality control and quick turnaround times.

Short Description:
Eaton Corporation plc is a global power management company founded in 1911. Initially established as the Eaton Spring and Axle Company in New Jersey, it became the largest truck axle manufacturer after moving to Cleveland, Ohio, in 1923. Over the years, Eaton has diversified its offerings through acquisitions, expanding into automotive transmissions, fluid power, electrical components, aerospace, and materials handling.

Today, Eaton focuses on intelligent power management solutions that enhance energy reliability, efficiency, and safety across various industries. Its product range includes electrical products and systems for power distribution and automation, hydraulic components for mobile and industrial equipment, aerospace systems for aircraft, vehicle products like transmissions and clutches, and industrial solutions such as valves and pumps. Eaton serves a wide array of sectors, including automotive, aerospace, construction, and utilities, contributing to energy-efficient buildings and sustainable power management initiatives. Headquartered in Dublin, Ireland, Eaton emphasizes innovation, ethics, and sustainability in its corporate culture.

Short Description:
Erie Strayer Company is a family-owned industrial machinery manufacturer with over 100 years of experience, specializing in concrete batch plants and related equipment. Founded in 1912 in Erie, Pennsylvania, the company shifted its focus from steel fabrication to concrete batching by 1950, adopting the Erie Strayer name to reflect this change. It operates from a large manufacturing facility of over 175,000 square feet and is currently led by President and CEO Kyle Strayer.

The company offers a comprehensive range of products, including custom ready-mix plants, central mix plants, mobile paving plants, heavy-duty tilt drum mixers, and advanced batching control systems. Erie Strayer also provides services such as plant setup, configuration of batching control systems, and international installation support. Its equipment is utilized by concrete providers, ready mix companies, and construction firms for various projects worldwide, including some of the largest central mix and mobile plants.

Short Description:
FallTech is a company that specializes in designing, manufacturing, and innovating fall protection equipment. Established in 1991 and based in Compton, California, FallTech is recognized for its high-quality safety products that comply with ANSI, OSHA, and CSA standards. The company operates an ISO 17025 accredited test laboratory and follows an ISO 9001:2015 Quality Management System.

The product range includes full-body harnesses, shock-absorbing lanyards, guardrails, roof anchors, self-retracting lifelines (SRLs), and lifelines. Notable innovations include the DuraTech® line of SRLs and the FT-R+, which is the first field-repairable Class 2 SRL. FallTech also offers expert consultation, training programs like FT-Xpert™, and customer support to help clients navigate safety regulations. The company serves industries with high fall risks, such as construction and utilities, catering to both individual workers and large organizations. FallTech is committed to developing effective and user-friendly fall protection solutions.

Short Description:
Formulated Materials, LLC is a developer of technologies and provider of innovative systems designed to elevate and advance the construction industry.  Our system innovation is achieved through partnerships with component experts, adding the latest scientific technologies and decades of field expertise.

Simply put, our mission is to develop systems for the construction industry that solve problems by combining the best technologies and methods under one brand with one warranty.  We support our customers and stakeholders by providing hands on training, on-call technical advice, an enduring spirit of innovation and devotion to excellence.

TREADSTONE™ - FIRE-RATED SELF LEVELING UNDERLAYMENTS & SOUND ATTENUATION
 Treadstone™ Underlayment and Acoustical Products provide systems ready to meet the growing demands of today's market. From ever changing floor covering options and tolerances to increased sound reduction, Treadstone™ is quickly becoming the new choice among the building community.

ELEVATION™ - EXTERIOR WATERPROOFING SOLUTIONS
Water infiltration is one of the most damaging and costly problems facing the construction industry.  Formulated Materials is proud to offer Elevation™, the first complete elevated balcony and breezeway waterproofing system.  From patented termination pockets to complete component and installation methodology, Elevation™ is becoming the new standard for elevated waterproofing.

Short Description:
Getac is a global leader in rugged mobile computing and intelligent video solutions, founded in 1989 in Taipei, Taiwan. The company designs and manufactures rugged electronics primarily for defense and other demanding industries. With over 10,000 employees and 22 operational sites worldwide, Getac holds more than 1,375 patents and is listed on the Taiwan Stock Exchange.

Getac offers a range of products, including rugged notebooks, tablets, handheld devices, and intelligent video solutions such as body-worn cameras and in-car video systems. Their products meet strict military and industrial standards, ensuring durability and reliability in challenging environments. Getac also provides customized solutions through Getac Select® and a comprehensive warranty program, including a pioneering bumper-to-bumper warranty. The company serves various industries, including defense, public safety, law enforcement, and manufacturing, helping customers increase productivity and reduce downtime.

Short Description:
Gray Fox Collective was established with the vision of bringing together the collective minds of curious, resourceful and forward-thinking individuals with a shared drive to see business owners in the overlooked small to mid-market sector achieve their dreams and impact their communities. Business owners and leaders such as yourself possess incredible passions and drive that have led you to create your business. But let me ask you something. When was the last time you stopped and asked yourself, "am I getting everything I want from my business?". 

Gray Fox has one primary goal, to see you succeed at your dream and empower you to use that to impact your community. Success looks different for everyone and part of our process is to help you discover what that success looks like. Once that is established, we partner with your team to become a part of the solution to moving your Company forward. That could look different depending on your needs, but one thing holds true, and that is that we will strive to become your right-hand in business.

Short Description:
Green Rhino® is a UK-based private limited company founded in 2019 and headquartered in Ipswich, Suffolk. The company specializes in innovative pollution prevention solutions, focusing on effective spill control and waste reduction. Green Rhino® aims to reduce environmental impact by providing practical, high-performance products that are user-friendly, encouraging widespread adoption for lasting benefits.

The company's flagship product, EnviroPad®, has received recognition for its breakthrough in spill control technology, winning the Best Product Innovation award at the UK Construction News Awards 2024. Green Rhino® invests in product development and collaborates with companies in the construction and utility sectors to ensure their solutions meet real-world usability and performance standards. Their product range includes items like the EnviroHorn™ drain filter, reflecting their commitment to affordable environmental solutions.

Green Rhino® serves organizations in various industries, including construction and utilities, that seek to minimize their environmental footprint. The company invites collaboration with businesses facing pollution challenges to develop tailored solutions for a cleaner future.

Short Description:
HAVER & BOECKER USA, INC. is a prominent manufacturer of material handling, weighing, filling, packing, and palletizing solutions. Founded in 1977 and based in Conyers, Georgia, it operates as the North American subsidiary of the German company Haver & Boecker OHG. The company specializes in processing and packaging solid dry bulk materials, liquids, and pasty products.

The product portfolio includes weighing units, valve bag packers, open-mouth bag packers, form-fill-seal bag packers, big bag packers, and palletizing solutions. These offerings cater to various industries such as cement, building materials, food and animal feed, chemicals, and mining. HAVER & BOECKER USA focuses on delivering customized, high-quality solutions through close collaboration with customers, supported by a global network and 24/7 technical support.

The company is part of a larger group that includes specialized brands like IBAU HAMBURG and AML Anlagentechnik GmbH & Co. KG, enhancing its capabilities in bulk material handling and packaging. Overall, HAVER & BOECKER USA is dedicated to providing innovative machinery and systems tailored to meet the needs of diverse industrial sectors.

Short Description:
Hultafors Group is a Swedish company founded in 1883, specializing in workwear, tools, and protective equipment for professional craftsmen and industrial users. Headquartered in Bollebygd, Sweden, the company operates globally, with sales and marketing teams across Europe and North America. Hultafors Group emphasizes innovation, quality, and user involvement in product development, ensuring that its offerings meet the real-world needs of its customers.

The company provides a diverse range of products, including durable workwear under the Snickers Workwear brand, safety equipment like gloves and helmets, precision hand tools, and various other equipment designed to enhance safety and efficiency. Hultafors Group is dedicated to sustainability, focusing on minimizing environmental impact and fostering good working conditions throughout its operations and supply chain. With a commitment to long-term partnerships and continuous innovation, Hultafors Group positions itself as a reliable partner for craftsmen and industrial professionals worldwide.

Short Description:
Humboldt Mfg. Co. is an employee-owned American manufacturer that specializes in construction materials testing equipment. Founded in 1909 in Chicago, Illinois, the company has a strong reputation for producing high-quality products designed to meet ASTM and AASHTO standards. Its headquarters in Elgin, Illinois, features a 70,000 square foot manufacturing and warehouse facility, along with a 15,000 square foot technical center in Raleigh, North Carolina, focused on electronics and software development.

The company offers a wide range of equipment for testing soil, concrete, cement, asphalt, and aggregate materials. Their product lineup includes geotechnical testing equipment, nuclear gauges, and general laboratory equipment. Humboldt serves a diverse customer base, including road contractors, governmental agencies, and universities, providing support through an e-commerce platform and a knowledgeable sales team that assists with equipment selection and technical services. Humboldt Mfg. Co. is committed to ensuring the quality and reliability of infrastructure projects worldwide.

Short Description:
ICS® Diamond Tools specializes in precision cutting tools and equipment for concrete and pipe cutting applications. Founded in the 1990s as part of Oregon Tool, Inc., the company has established a strong reputation for innovation and quality over its 35 years in the industry. Headquartered in Portland, Oregon, ICS operates globally, with sales and distribution offices in Belgium and a network of authorized dealers and service centers in over 70 countries.

The company offers a wide range of products, including diamond chainsaws, diamond blades, wire saws, wall saws, core drills, and flat saws. Notable among these is the FORCE3® Speedster™ Diamond Chain, which enhances cutting speed and performance. ICS is committed to research and development, continuously advancing its patented Diamond Chain Technology to improve efficiency and safety for professionals in construction, mining, and demolition. Recently, ICS announced a rebranding to unify under the Oregon® brand, reflecting its heritage and expanding its market presence while maintaining its focus on innovation.

Since our inception in 1982, Industrial Diesel Incorporated has been known for reliable workmanship and dependable service in this competitive market. We are dedicated to supplying the off-highway industry with remanufactured high-horsepower Caterpillar, Cummins, Detroit Diesel/MTU engines. Improving our staff enables us to achieve our number-one priority of customer satisfaction in our products and service.

Short Description:
The International Concrete Repair Institute (ICRI) is a non-profit organization dedicated to enhancing the quality of concrete repair, restoration, and protection. Founded in 1988 and renamed in 1993, ICRI serves as a central resource in the concrete repair industry, promoting best practices and technical knowledge to ensure durable and safe concrete structures.

ICRI offers a range of educational programs, including seminars, workshops, and certification courses like the Concrete Slab Moisture Testing and Concrete Surface Repair Technician certifications. The organization also facilitates networking opportunities through local chapter meetings and events, allowing professionals to connect and share insights. Additionally, ICRI develops industry standards and provides technical resources, including publications and best practice guides, to support professionals in the field.

With members that include concrete repair specialists, engineers, and contractors, ICRI is committed to improving industry standards and client satisfaction in concrete repair and restoration.

Short Description:
Easy-to-use operations software built for heavy civil construction.

A Wisconsin-based company founded in 2019, IVO Systems is a comprehensive operations software solution – specifically built for construction companies looking to streamline their business. IVO Systems has demonstrated its ability to assist clients at both the local and nationwide levels, along with expanding globally. 

With over a decade of experience in heavy civil construction, Eric Christensen started IVO Systems as a reliable, and easy-to-use solution with the goal of connecting the information gap between the field and the office. IVO Systems features a comprehensive set of modules that address: 

• Equipment and Project Tracking
• Auto-Populated Field Employee Timecards
• Preventative Maintenance and Work Orders 
• Equipment Inspection Forms 
• Employee Project Scheduling
• Dispatch Ticket Management 
• Field Reporting 
• Rental Equipment Information 
• Utility Locate (811) Information and Documentation

Short Description:
KHL Group, founded in 1989 and based in Wadhurst, UK, is a prominent international supplier of information for the construction industry. The company has established a strong reputation for its editorial quality and independence, which has fostered a loyal readership. KHL Group offers a diverse range of media products, including well-known magazines such as Construction Europe, International Construction, and International Cranes, along with digital publications, newsletters, mobile apps, and various industry events.

In addition to its publishing activities, KHL Group acquired Off-Highway Research in 2015, enhancing its capabilities in market research and consultancy for construction and agricultural equipment. The company serves a wide array of clients, including construction professionals, equipment manufacturers, and rental companies, providing them with accurate and timely market information. With around 90 employees and reported revenues of approximately $13.9 million, KHL Group continues to be a key player in the global construction information sector.

Short Description:
Knapheide Manufacturing Company is a leading American manufacturer of commercial truck bodies and related vehicle equipment. Founded in 1848 by Heinrich Knapheide, the company has a rich history that began with producing high-quality wagons for various industries during the westward expansion of the United States. Today, Knapheide remains family-owned and is recognized as the oldest truck equipment manufacturer still operated by the founding family.

The company offers a wide range of products, including steel service bodies, platform and stake truck bodies, truck beds, van interior organization equipment, and pickup accessories. Knapheide's solutions cater to a variety of commercial vehicles, from light-duty trucks to heavy-duty trucks, ensuring that they meet the diverse needs of their customers across multiple industries. With a focus on durability and functionality, Knapheide supports its products through a robust distribution network that provides excellent sales, service, and support.

Kuriyama of America, Inc. is a prominent manufacturer and marketer of a wide range of commercial and industrial hoses, including thermoplastic, rubber, and metal products. Founded in 1968 and based in Schaumburg, Illinois, the company is part of Kuriyama Holdings Corporation, which operates globally with subsidiaries and distribution centers across multiple continents.

The extensive product portfolio includes various hose types such as air, hydraulic, steam, and water hoses, along with fittings and couplings like hydraulic, quick connect, and adapter fittings. Kuriyama of America also offers additional products such as pipe, elbows, and swaging tools. With eight subsidiaries and six distribution centers in North America, the company effectively serves a diverse array of industrial and commercial customers, ensuring high-performance solutions for fluid transfer and material handling. Kuriyama of America is committed to quality and environmental management, holding ISO 14000 registration.

Short Description:
LaborMAX Staffing is a staffing agency based in Kearney, Missouri, with over 40 branches across 14 states. Founded in 2002, the company employs between 1,001 and 5,000 people and generates around $126 million in revenue. LaborMAX Staffing specializes in providing pre-screened contingent workers to a diverse clientele, servicing more than 10,000 clients annually and placing approximately 20,000 workers in various roles.

The agency offers a wide range of staffing services, including temporary, contract, direct hire, and payroll services. Their approach utilizes advanced software and AI-driven platforms to enhance workforce management, significantly reducing administrative tasks. LaborMAX Staffing's process includes understanding client needs, defining roles, AI-driven candidate matching, and providing curated shortlists of candidates. They also offer flexible interview scheduling options and maintain engagement with applicants through chatbots and self-service portals. This technology-driven approach helps businesses efficiently scale their workforce while managing costs.

Short Description: Nitroset, LLC, based in Houston, Texas, U.S.A., is a well-established company specialized in top quality fastening systems. Nitroset solid propellant fastening system is an innovative fastening solution that offers superior performance into normal to hard aggregate concrete surfaces. The tool is powered by plasticized nitrocellulose charges rather than traditional primer or gunpowder. The lead-free, primer-free, non-explosive, and non-toxic system allows for standard shipping and storage. And it can be used in security-sensitive locations such as schools, airports, prisons, hospitals and military bases. Overall, not only does Nitroset delivers a complete enhanced fastening solution in the industry, but safety, reliability, and stability are also guaranteed in operating the Nitroset tool.

Short Description:
Plastixx FFS Technologies, founded in 2008 and based in Terrebonne, Quebec, specializes in innovative packaging solutions within the packaging and containers industry. The company manufactures tubular Form-Fill-Seal (FFS) films and plastic valve bags, catering to sectors such as building materials, chemicals, fertilizers, pet food, food ingredients, beverages, and home goods.

The company operates a 200,000 square foot manufacturing facility and employs between 10 to 50 people. It is SQF Level 2 certified, demonstrating a strong commitment to food safety and quality standards. Their product offerings include multi-layer FFS films that are 100% recyclable, plastic valve bags designed for efficient filling of powdery materials, pallet protection films for transit, and shrink films for product bundles. Plexxis Software is a technology development company based in Brampton, Ontario, specializing in software solutions for subcontractors in the construction industry. Founded in 1999 by Chris Loranger and Jason Fraser, the company has grown to nearly 100 employees. Plexxis offers an all-in-one platform that integrates estimating, digital takeoff, construction management, accounting, project management, and mobile field operations, enhancing collaboration and operational efficiency.

The platform is available as both cloud-based and on-premise solutions, designed to streamline various subcontractor workflows without the need for customizations. Key features include project planning, budget management, resource allocation, and document management. Plexxis focuses on serving specialty subcontractors in commercial, residential, high-rise, and industrial construction sectors, aiming to improve productivity and team cohesion through its integrated technology solutions. The company also provides continuous in-house support and development, reflecting its commitment to customer satisfaction and innovation in the construction technology sector.

PressurePro Inc. is a U.S.-based company that specializes in Tire Performance Management Systems (TPMS) for trucks and fleets. Founded in 1991, it has established itself as a global leader in providing real-time tire performance data and analytics. The company focuses on enhancing safety, fuel efficiency, tire longevity, and compliance for its customers. PressurePro designs and manufactures its products in the USA, ensuring high-quality standards and full ownership of its intellectual property.

The product range includes both stand-alone and integrated TPMS solutions, which support various integration protocols like RS232 and CAN bus. These systems help users maintain optimal tire pressure, reduce maintenance costs, and improve safety standards. PressurePro serves a diverse global customer base through a network of partners in over 40 countries, making it a trusted choice for fleet operators and Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) worldwide.

Progressive Foam Technologies, Inc. is a manufacturer based in Beach City, Ohio, specializing in foam insulation products for home exterior siding applications. Founded in 1992, the company is known for inventing insulated vinyl siding, which enhances energy efficiency and comfort in residential and light commercial buildings.

Their product range includes insulated siding materials, backing materials for vinyl sidings, and various trim accessories. These products offer thermal support and include items like corner post fillers, underlayment starter strips, and insulated J-channel bases. The company also produces foam insulation for interior and foundation applications, broadening their offerings beyond exterior siding.

Progressive Foam Technologies serves homeowners, builders, contractors, and construction professionals through direct sales and licensing arrangements. They collaborate with partners like Castle Building Centres to provide resources for installation and renovation projects. With around 104 employees and annual revenues of approximately $32 million, the company is committed to innovation, quality, and customer satisfaction, led by the third generation of the Culpepper family.

QuakeWrap, Inc. is a leader in the development and application of Fiber Reinforced Polymer (FRP) products for infrastructure repair and renewal. Founded in 1994 by Dr. Mo Ehsani, the company specializes in innovative solutions that enhance the strength and durability of infrastructure elements, particularly in seismic retrofitting and corrosion protection. QuakeWrap's patented technologies are recognized globally for their effectiveness in improving construction quality and reducing costs.

The company's product offerings include a variety of FRP systems designed to address specific infrastructure challenges. Notable products include PileMedic® for repairing columns and submerged piles, PipeMedic® for pipeline rehabilitation, and InfinitPipe®, an onsite-manufactured pipe system. QuakeWrap also provides comprehensive turnkey solutions, including design, materials, and installation services, supported by a skilled team of engineers and technicians.

QuakeWrap serves a diverse clientele in both public and private sectors, focusing on critical structures such as bridges and seawalls. With over 20 patents and numerous awards, the company is recognized for its innovation and expertise in structural strengthening and disaster resilience.

Ram Jack is a family-owned foundation repair company based in Ada, Oklahoma, with a history dating back to 1968. Founded by Bill Gregory, the company shifted its focus to foundation repair in the 1970s under the leadership of his son, Steven D. Gregory. Now in its third generation, Ram Jack is committed to honesty, integrity, and professionalism.

The company specializes in advanced foundation repair solutions for both residential and commercial buildings. Its flagship product is the Ram Jack Steel Pile system, which utilizes patented dual-cylinder driving methods and high-quality American steel to stabilize structures without heavy excavation. Ram Jack also offers underpinning solutions, engineering support, and foundation solutions for alternative energy projects. Operating in 38 U.S. states and internationally, Ram Jack has a network of franchises and dealerships, serving a diverse customer base that includes homeowners, contractors, and engineers. With over 255,000 piers installed, Ram Jack is recognized as an industry leader known for its innovative technology and commitment to quality.

ScaffSource is a prominent provider of scaffolding and shoring equipment, established in 1992 and based in Deer Park, Texas. The company serves various industries, including petrochemical, refining, offshore, manufacturing, power generation, commercial, and marine sectors. With over 17 million pieces of scaffold inventory and a growing shoring inventory, ScaffSource offers tailored material rental programs to meet diverse contractual needs across the nation.

ScaffSource's extensive product range includes various scaffolding systems such as Ringlock and Cuplock modular scaffolding, tube and clamp scaffolds, and a variety of universal accessories. Additionally, they provide value-added services like 3D scaffold modeling and design, ensuring projects start on time and within budget. Their experienced project management team oversees all aspects of projects, focusing on timeframe, budget, quality, and safety.

The SCHWING Group is a global leader in manufacturing eco-friendly thermal cleaning systems for tools and machine parts contaminated with plastic and fiber. Founded in 1969 by Ewald Schwing in Duisburg, Germany, the company has grown from a small operation to an international business with around 100 employees. Its headquarters are located in Neukirchen-Vluyn, Germany, where it has expanded its production facilities to 5,500 square meters.

The SCHWING Group offers complete cleaning solutions, including thermal cleaning equipment and related services. Solomon Colors is an employee-owned company based in Springfield, Illinois, founded in 1927. Originally named Solomon Grinding Service, it has grown into a leading manufacturer of coloring and decorative products for architectural concrete. The company is the largest U.S.-owned producer of iron oxide pigments and is known for its innovative liquid and granular pigment technologies.

The product range includes a variety of pigments for concrete, such as liquid pigments (ColorFlo), dry pigments, and granular pigments. Solomon Colors also offers automated pigment metering systems called ColorSelect, which help ensure consistent color formulations for ready-mix producers. Additionally, the company provides decorative concrete products, including sealers, stains, overlays, and stamping tools, following its acquisition of Brickform Products. Solomon Colors serves a diverse clientele, including concrete suppliers, contractors, architects, and homeowners, and is actively involved in several industry associations to promote best practices in the concrete sector.

Short Description:
Splice Sleeve North America, Inc. is a manufacturer and supplier of mechanical grout-filled rebar couplers, primarily for the precast and cast-in-place concrete construction industries. Founded in 1977 and based in Birmingham, Michigan, the company is known for its NMB Splice Sleeve®, a patented system developed by Dr. Alfred A. Yee in the late 1960s.

The NMB Splice Sleeve® is a ductile iron sleeve filled with a high-strength, non-shrink grout called SS Mortar. This system connects reinforcing bars by inserting them into the sleeve and filling it with grout, creating a splice that acts as a continuous bar. It offers excellent seismic resistance and meets global building code requirements for rebar splicing. Splice Sleeve North America's products have been utilized in various construction projects, including high-rise buildings and infrastructure, demonstrating durability and safety in strong earthquakes.

The company serves clients across the United States and Canada, providing the NMB Splice Sleeve system, related grout products, and technical support through industry associations. Splice Sleeve North America is committed to safety, quality, and seismic resilience in concrete construction.

Sysdyne Technologies is a software company that specializes in cloud-native business solutions for the ready-mix concrete industry. Founded in 1976 in Stamford, Connecticut, by Craig Hung, the company has developed from early concrete batching control systems to advanced, fully integrated cloud software platforms.

Sysdyne offers a comprehensive SaaS suite that includes tools for batching control, dispatch and delivery management, sales quoting and invoicing, business intelligence and analytics, and customer relationship management. Their products, such as CloudBatch®, ConcreteGo, DeliveryGo, QuickLink, and InsightGo, are designed to modernize concrete production processes, improve operational efficiency, and enhance customer satisfaction. Sysdyne serves ready-mix concrete producers, contractors, and inspectors worldwide, focusing on maximizing plant volume and reducing waste. The company has also secured strategic investments from industry leaders to support its ongoing innovation and growth.

The Godwin Group is a leading family-owned truck equipment manufacturer based in Dunn, North Carolina. Established in 2004, the company operates from a 250,000 square foot facility and includes nine subsidiaries, such as Godwin Manufacturing Company and Champion Hoist and Equipment. These subsidiaries specialize in a wide array of truck equipment products, including steel and aluminum dump bodies, truck hoists, snow removal equipment, and rollback car carriers.

Short Description:
The Tilt-Up Concrete Association (TCA) is an international nonprofit trade association established in 1986. It focuses on enhancing the quality and acceptance of tilt-up concrete construction worldwide. With over 450 members across 44 U.S. states and 13 countries, TCA serves as a key resource for the global tilt-up concrete industry.

TCA's mission is to promote tilt-up as a preferred building system through education, technical resources, advocacy, and networking opportunities. The association offers seminars, workshops, and symposiums to educate industry professionals on tilt-up construction techniques. It also produces technical publications, including the magazine *Tilt-Up Today*, and actively participates in code development to support tilt-up construction in building regulations. TCA fosters a community of contractors, architects, engineers, and suppliers, facilitating collaboration and knowledge exchange within the industry.

W. R. MEADOWS, INC. is a family-owned company established in 1926, specializing in high-performance building materials and construction solutions for the concrete construction industry. It began with the SEALTIGHT Asphalt Expansion Joint, designed to manage concrete expansion and contraction. Over the years, the company has expanded its product offerings to include a wide range of premium-grade construction products used in various concrete applications.

The company operates twelve manufacturing and warehouse facilities and has a global network of authorized distributors. Its product line includes expansion joint materials, concrete construction chemicals, building envelope materials, concrete repair and restoration products, joint sealants, and pool deck materials. W. R. MEADOWS is committed to innovation, quality, and sustainability, aiming to be a valued supplier of specialty construction materials. Its products are trusted by architects, engineers, and contractors for their reliability and performance in diverse construction projects worldwide.

Aervoe LLC, also known as Aervoe Industries, Inc., is a manufacturer based in Gardnerville, Nevada, with over 50 years of experience. The company specializes in industrial-grade paints, specialty coatings, cleaners, lubricants, and safety products. Founded in 1972, Aervoe serves industrial, commercial, and construction professionals with high-quality chemical products that meet strict environmental and quality standards.

Aervoe's product offerings are categorized into industrial maintenance and construction chemicals, personal safety and traffic control products, and livestock marking solutions. The company also provides portable appliances for outdoor recreation and jobsite cooking, along with solar collection and storage devices. Aervoe is part of The Quintessential Group, which enhances its product portfolio and manufacturing capabilities while emphasizing sustainability and compliance with environmental regulations.
