Afinitas is a global leader in the precast concrete industry, providing advanced equipment and services for the production of concrete pipe, manholes, and other precast products. Headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri, the company unites several well-known brands, including HawkeyePedershaab and BFS Betonfertigteilesysteme GmbH, among others. Afinitas serves manufacturers worldwide, focusing on tailored production systems and ongoing support to ensure operational success. With a commitment to fostering strong relationships and a dynamic corporate culture, Afinitas aims to be a catalyst for success in the precast concrete sector.

Short Description:
Alchemco is a global leader in innovative concrete waterproofing systems and related cleaning and repair products. Established in 1975, the company has developed a strong reputation in the concrete protection industry, particularly with its flagship product line, TechCrete. This line includes the TechCrete 2500 Waterproofing System, which creates a self-healing barrier in concrete, and the BridgeDeck™ Waterproofing System, designed to protect bridge decks from water and chloride infiltration.

The company utilizes advanced technologies, such as biochemically-modified silicate technology and the Electrochemical Micro Silicate System (EMSS), to create durable waterproofing solutions. Alchemco's products are widely used in various infrastructure projects, including bridges, tunnels, and water treatment plants, as well as in sports arenas and public facilities. With a commitment to innovation and education, Alchemco partners with distributors and contractors globally to enhance the longevity and maintenance of concrete structures.

Allfasteners USA is a family-owned company established in 1994 in Victoria, Australia, and is now a leading supplier of fastening and anchoring solutions in the United States. Headquartered in Carlstadt, New Jersey, the company operates multiple branches and warehouses across the country, including locations in New York, Ohio, California, Illinois, Nebraska, Denver, Minnesota, and Texas. Allfasteners serves a variety of industries with a comprehensive range of products and professional customer service.

The company specializes in a wide array of fastening supplies, including anchors, screws, cutting wheels, and sealants. They also offer customized fabrication services, such as producing railings from recycled American steel. Allfasteners is committed to sourcing products that comply with U.S. manufacturing standards, including those labeled "Made in USA" for critical infrastructure projects. Their expertise extends to large-scale projects, showcasing their capability to support complex jobs across various sectors, including construction, telecommunications, and safety.

Short Description:
Alliant Power has a rich history that dates back to 1926 when it was founded as Central Motive Power (CMP) in Denver, Colorado. Initially known for its reliable diesel parts and services, CMP established a strong reputation in diesel engine solutions. In 2018, CMP was acquired by Diesel Forward, which expanded its market reach. The company rebranded as Alliant Power in 2022 to reflect its commitment to providing exceptional diesel products and services across the United States.

Alliant Power specializes in diesel engine parts, components, and related services. Its product offerings include a variety of diesel engine parts, fuel systems, turbochargers, and other essential components for maintaining and repairing diesel engines. The company serves a diverse customer base, including individual operators and large fleet owners in industries such as transportation, construction, agriculture, and industrial sectors. With nearly a century of experience, Alliant Power emphasizes customer service and technical expertise, aiming to deliver comprehensive diesel engine solutions nationwide.

ARCO MET 7 SL is a Spanish company based in La Muela, Zaragoza, specializing in the manufacture and installation of industrial machinery and plants. They serve various sectors, including concrete, precast, mortar, aggregate, chemical, and environmental industries. As part of Grupo Arco, the company is known for its engineering and project services, supported by a team of skilled professionals.

The company offers a range of products and services, including mechanical design, mixers, robotic bagging and palletizing lines, big-bag filling systems, and pneumatic conveying systems. They focus on industrial automation, particularly for mortar plants, providing software solutions that enhance process control and monitoring. Their automation systems align with Industry 4.0 standards, featuring cloud data storage, remote visualization, and predictive maintenance. ARCO MET 7 also provides electrical installation and commissioning services to ensure optimal plant operation.

Short Description:
Astec Industries, Inc., founded in 1972 in Chattanooga, Tennessee, is a leading manufacturer of heavy equipment for road building, aggregate processing, and concrete production. Established by Dr. J. Don Brock and his partners, the company aims to innovate traditional industries through advanced technology and creative engineering.

Astec operates in two main segments: Infrastructure Solutions, which includes equipment for asphalt road building and concrete plants, and Materials Solutions, focusing on aggregate processing machinery. The company offers a diverse product portfolio of over 100 items, featuring notable innovations like the Double Barrel Drum Asphalt Plant and the Shuttle Buggy Material Transfer Vehicle. Astec's equipment supports a variety of construction projects, enhancing material production and processing efficiency.

With a workforce of over 4,000 employees worldwide, Astec has expanded through strategic acquisitions and technological advancements, including the 2021 acquisition of MINDS Automation Group Inc. The company is committed to customer service, environmental responsibility, and operational efficiency, continually evolving to meet the needs of its clients in the construction and infrastructure sectors.

Short Description:
Atlantic Logistics is a family-owned third-party logistics (3PL) company based in Jacksonville, Florida, founded in 2001 by Evie and Bob Hooper. As a women-owned business, it has grown significantly, managing over 370,000 shipments through more than 40,000 qualified carriers. The company specializes in logistics and supply chain transportation services, emphasizing integrity and customer service.

The services offered by Atlantic Logistics include intermodal drayage, import/export services, freight forwarding, customs brokerage, and trucking services. They utilize advanced technology such as AI and automated tracking to enhance efficiency and security in the supply chain. The company also provides real-time shipment updates and live chat support for customer inquiries. Recognized for its rapid growth, Atlantic Logistics ranks among the fastest-growing private companies in America, reflecting a strong commitment to innovation and service excellence.

Short Description:
Smoke Guard is a manufacturer based in Boise, Idaho, specializing in fire and smoke protection systems for commercial buildings. Founded in 1991, the company focuses on innovative solutions that address fire and smoke safety challenges, particularly for elevator openings and other building openings.

Their product range includes flexible curtain systems designed for various applications. This includes elevator smoke curtains, vertical and horizontal fire and smoke curtains, perimeter curtains, and draft curtains. Smoke Guard also offers custom solutions for smaller openings and large theatrical proscenium curtains. Their systems are crafted to ensure safety and functionality while maintaining architectural design, allowing for stylish building concepts that comply with fire and smoke safety codes.

Smoke Guard serves a diverse clientele, including commercial building owners, architects, and designers, with installations in high-rises, theaters, hospitals, and shopping centers. The company provides extensive support through design tools, technical documentation, and product resources to assist in project planning and specification.

Short Description:
BigIron is a prominent online auction platform that specializes in the buying and selling of various assets, including farm equipment, construction machinery, transportation vehicles, livestock, industrial assets, real estate, and collector cars. Founded in 1984, the company transitioned from live onsite auctions to an online-only model in 2009, becoming North America's largest ag-focused auction company.

BigIron hosts weekly online unreserved auctions every Wednesday, providing a secure marketplace where items are sold to the highest bidder without reserve. The platform ensures fair market value for sellers and offers buyers the opportunity to communicate directly with sellers. BigIron's offerings include a wide range of products, such as tractors, excavators, trucks, and classic cars. The company connects a diverse audience, including farmers, ranchers, construction companies, and collectors, while emphasizing values like honesty and professionalism.

Short Description:
The Board of Certified Safety Professionals (BCSP) is a not-for-profit organization founded in 1969, dedicated to certifying practitioners in the safety profession. Based in Indianapolis, Indiana, BCSP is a globally accredited certification body that evaluates the qualifications of safety professionals, administers examinations, and issues credentials to those who meet its standards. With over 100,000 credentials awarded, BCSP is recognized as a leader in safety, health, and environmental certification.

BCSP's mission is to certify individuals who identify, evaluate, and control hazards that may cause injury, illness, or environmental harm. Certified safety professionals work across various industries, including manufacturing, construction, and government, performing roles such as program management, training, and auditing. The organization offers a range of certifications, including the Certified Safety Professional (CSP®) and Associate Safety Professional (ASP®), designed to support career development and enhance safety practices. BCSP's certifications are widely recognized and often required for compliance with safety standards in many job positions.

Short Description:
Caterpillar Inc. is a prominent American manufacturer of construction, mining, and heavy engineering equipment, recognized as the largest in its industry. Founded in 1925 through the merger of the Holt Manufacturing Company and the C.L. Best Tractor Company, Caterpillar has a long history of innovation in heavy machinery and diesel engines. The company is headquartered in Irving, Texas.

Caterpillar produces a diverse range of products, including tractors, trucks, loaders, excavators, and graders, which are utilized in agriculture, construction, mining, logging, and industrial warehousing. The company also manufactures diesel and gasoline engines for various applications, including trucks and power generation systems. Caterpillar's services encompass equipment financing, product support, and technology solutions to enhance operational efficiency for its customers. With a global presence, Caterpillar serves a wide array of clients, including construction companies, mining operations, and government agencies involved in infrastructure development.

Short Description:
Columbia Southern University (CSU) is a private, for-profit online university founded in 1993 by Dr. Robert G. Mayes Sr. The university aims to change lives through education by providing affordable and flexible academic opportunities. CSU offers a wide range of programs, including 26 degree programs and 21 certificate programs, spanning fields such as environmental management, business administration, computer science, and health administration.

CSU emphasizes a flexible learning format with open enrollment and maximum transfer credit, catering to working adults and military personnel. The university is accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) and the Distance Education Accrediting Commission (DEAC). With over 22,000 students worldwide, CSU is recognized for its commitment to quality education and has received awards for outstanding course design and community engagement. The university also partners with Waldorf University to expand its online degree offerings.

Short Description:
Concessions International is a family- and minority-owned airport food and beverage concession developer based in Atlanta, operating since 1979. It ranks among the top six largest airport concessionaires in the U.S., with around 40 locations across eight major airports, including the U.S. Virgin Islands. The company offers a wide range of services and products, featuring franchised, licensed, and proprietary concepts in quick service, casual dining, bars, delis, snacks, and grill formats.

The company serves over 30 national, regional, and proprietary brands, including well-known franchises like Starbucks and Chick-fil-A. Concessions International focuses on culinary excellence by employing skilled chefs and collaborating with executive and celebrity chefs to create innovative menus. It is dedicated to exceptional customer service, catering to various travelers, and enhancing the guest experience with advanced technology like tabletop iPad ordering and QR code menus. The company values inclusivity and fosters strong relationships within its corporate culture, supporting partnerships with diverse businesses and maintaining a commitment to integrity, respect, and hard work.

The Concrete Testing Adherence Collaboration (CTAC) program was developed in Colorado to minimize/eliminate the effects of false negative/positive concrete tests on producers, and the concrete construction industry. The CTAC program involves a continuous improvement cycle, and the outcome evaluates field concrete testing technicians on an individual basis to determine appropriate actions for training, resolutions, and to increase consistency with ASTM Standards.

Currently, many times it is not consistent with ASTM Standards, which ultimately falls back on the concrete producer. For any producers, contractors, municipality, or testing firm and their employees, the CTAC program can be viewed both positively and negatively. The purpose is to develop more consistency to meet ASTM Standards in concrete testing. In using the CTAC program, both Quality Control and Assurance entities can evaluate their own employees and company in comparison with the industry average. Through this information training, consistency, and the industry can be improved and reach the same goal of a completed and successful project(s).

Short Description:
Constrafor is a New York City-based SaaS and fintech company that provides financial and risk management software solutions specifically for the construction industry. The company aims to enhance productivity and cost-efficiency for general contractors and subcontractors by automating essential back-office tasks and financial transactions.

Founded to tackle the unique challenges of construction procurement and payments, Constrafor integrates advanced AI and fintech technologies to streamline workflows and improve cash flow management. Its cloud-based platform offers features such as contract management, invoice processing, and risk management tools, all designed to centralize operations. The Early Pay Program allows subcontractors to receive payments in 1-2 days, significantly reducing the typical payment cycle.

With a workforce of around 29 employees and reported revenue of approximately $6.1 million, Constrafor serves thousands of contractors across North America. The company has received over $370 million in funding, reflecting strong investor confidence. Recognized as a top innovator, Constrafor continues to address industry challenges with its integrated solutions and AI-driven tools.

For over 65 years, Cresset® Chemical Company has been an innovative leader in developing, distributing, and servicing site cast and precast Release Agents, Curing Compounds, Sealers, and other products for the concrete construction industry.  At the core of our competency are superior-looking surfaces − but we go beyond the surface to meet the complexity in today's environmental landscape.  Cresset is driven to continually evolve its New Chemistry "Green" array of products to responsibly and safely meet your production, environmental, and OSHA requirements. 

 Formulated from high grade materials to produce consistent, predictable results − each Cresset product excels in specific applications and comes with a limited warranty.  Cresset serves the concrete industry via an integrated distribution network spanning the USA, Canada, and selected locations worldwide.

From developing the industry standard Crete-Lease 880 VOC Xtra - a myriad of structural, architectural and specific purpose job applications rely on Cresset's advanced Crete-Lease line for the highest impact aesthetic results which include:

* Longer form life, easy stripping, non-staining, bughole-free surfaces
* Reduced clean-up time, no bonding interference
* Engineered with eco-friendly, virgin materials
* Exceeds environmental regulations, helps earn LEED points
* Produced in the U.S.A.

Quite simply, Cresset products release forms easily for a unique, eco-friendly, aesthetic advantage. Cresset is the most recommended release agent manufacturer in the country! Visit us at Cresset.com for more information.

Founded in 1888, Deslauriers Inc., is company that manufactures and distributes concrete forming and testing accessories. Our primary products include: steel and plastic column forms, construction shims, safety products, test cylinders and lids, beam molds and accessories, masonry testing products and much more.

Short Description:
Exhibitor Group is a prominent company focused on trade show and corporate event marketing education and resources. It is widely recognized for publishing **EXHIBITOR magazine**, a monthly publication that shares best practices, insights, and trends in the industry. With over three decades of experience, Exhibitor Group serves exhibit managers, marketing professionals, and experience architects by providing valuable educational content and industry news.

The company organizes **EXHIBITORLIVE**, a significant annual conference and trade show that brings together industry leaders to explore innovative ideas and strategies for trade show success. Exhibitor Group also offers various educational programs, including the Certified Trade Show Marketer (CTSM) program and accelerated learning conferences like EXHIBITOR FastTrak. Additionally, their online resources provide articles, news updates, and a marketplace directory for trade show-related services and products. Overall, Exhibitor Group is dedicated to helping marketers and exhibitors enhance their performance in the trade show and corporate event landscape.

Short Description:
Brady Corporation is a global manufacturer specializing in identification, safety, and compliance solutions for industrial and workplace environments. Founded in 1914 in Eau Claire, Wisconsin, the company has grown from a small sign-painting business to a publicly traded multinational headquartered in Milwaukee, employing around 6,600 people worldwide.

Brady offers a diverse range of products, including high-performance labels, safety signs, industrial printers, and software systems. Their solutions enhance safety, security, and regulatory compliance across various sectors such as manufacturing, healthcare, aerospace, and government. The company serves over one million customers globally, distributing products through direct sales, distribution partners, and e-commerce platforms. Brady is committed to innovation, investing approximately 4% of its annual revenue in research and development, and has a strong operational model that combines materials science expertise with a global distribution network.

Short Description:
We represent some of the world's biggest colloidal silica manufacturers in developing economies with the mission to find you a more cost effective solution in the field of colloidal silica. 

Our cost advantages are enabled by our manufacturers' scale. They produce up to 150,000 metric tons of colloidal silica annually with 25 years of experience dedicated to the field and 6 ISO-certified manufacturing plants (50 acres / 200,000 sqm). 

We offer over 20 standard products, with the added capability of customizing products to meet your specific requirements. These products vary by particle size/surface area, pH grade, silica weight, stabilizing ions, and surface modifications, designed to maximize effectiveness and compatibility with your applications.

Key applications include investment casting, CMP, coatings, constructions, refractories, catalysts support in oil refinery, paper manufacturing and more.

Short Description:
Arcoro ExakTime specializes in workforce management and time tracking solutions tailored for the construction and contracting industries. Founded in 1999, ExakTime began as a digital time tracking system designed to enhance labor tracking accuracy and efficiency on job sites. It is now part of Arcoro, which provides comprehensive human resources and people management solutions for construction and field services companies across North America.

ExakTime offers a range of products, including cloud-based time tracking solutions and a mobile app that allows for real-time labor tracking. Their JobClock devices are rugged and designed for harsh job site conditions, enabling employees to clock in and out easily. The platform integrates with major construction ERP systems, enhancing workforce management by connecting time tracking data with project and financial management tools. ExakTime is trusted by thousands of construction companies to improve job profitability, streamline payroll processes, and enhance overall workforce management.

Short Description:
AT-PAC is a global leader in scaffolding, shoring, and forming systems, founded in 1995 and headquartered in Roswell, Georgia. Initially a surplus dealer of used scaffolding, the company has grown into a direct manufacturer and broker of high-quality scaffolding equipment. With operations in Canada, the UK, Australia, Chile, and Europe, AT-PAC became fully integrated into Doka in 2023, enhancing its capabilities.

The company offers a wide range of scaffolding solutions designed for complex industrial and infrastructure projects. Their product lineup includes patented systems like the Ringlock MK2, aluminum beams, clamps, frames, barricades, castors, and ladders. In addition to equipment sales and rentals, AT-PAC provides engineering services, project design, estimating, product training, and digital solutions, including their Hi-Vis® scaffold management software, which improves project planning and safety.

AT-PAC serves various sectors, including oil and gas, mining, power, and commercial construction. Their extensive experience and strategic partnerships allow them to support customers throughout the entire lifecycle of building projects, ensuring safety and operational efficiency.

Short Description:
Autocar Trucks is an American manufacturer of severe-duty vocational trucks, focusing on Class 7 and Class 8 models. Founded in 1897 in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, it is the oldest surviving motor vehicle brand in the Western Hemisphere. The company transitioned to exclusive truck manufacturing in 1911, creating custom-engineered trucks tailored for demanding commercial and municipal applications.

Headquartered in Birmingham, Alabama, Autocar produces heavy-duty trucks designed for specialized uses, including construction, waste management, and heavy hauling. Their product lineup features four main models, available in both conventional and cab-over-engine designs. Autocar emphasizes durability, performance, and safety, incorporating innovations such as proprietary axles and advanced transmission systems to meet the needs of their customers in challenging environments.

Short Description: Binevir is a reputable manufacturing company that has been specializing in the production of composite materials for over two decades. With an extensive experience in the field of composite materials, Binevir has established itself as a trusted expert in providing high-quality composite solutions to various industries. Our commitment to excellence and innovation has made us a preferred choice among customers seeking reliable and durable solutions. Through advanced manufacturing processes and stringent quality control measures, we ensure that our products  meet the highest standards of performance and reliability. Furthermore, our team of skilled professionals remains up-to-date with the latest advancements in material engineering, allowing us to consistently deliver products that meet industry demands. With a proven track record of success, Binevir continues to be an industry leader in composite material manufacturing, serving as a reliable partner for businesses seeking top-notch materials for their projects. Our products are trusted by customers in 40 countries worldwide due to their consistent quality, reliability, and adherence to international standards. By meticulously designing and engineering our products, we ensure that they not only meet but exceed customer expectations. Our rigorous quality assurance processes and continuous improvement initiatives enable us to maintain consistent product standards throughout our global operations. Additionally, we closely collaborate with local partners in each country to tailor our offerings according to regional needs and requirements. This approach allows us to address specific market demands while ensuring that customers receive the same level of excellence no matter where they are located.

Short Description:
BLÅKLÄDER, founded in 1959 in Svenljunga, Sweden, specializes in the development, manufacturing, and distribution of high-quality workwear, safety shoes, and gloves. The company serves professionals in craftsmanship, transportation, industrial manufacturing, and service sectors. With a focus on quality, durability, functionality, and sustainability, BLÅKLÄDER ensures that its products meet the practical needs of workers.

As a family-run business with over 60 years of experience in the textile industry, BLÅKLÄDER maintains full control over its production processes. This commitment allows the company to uphold ethical working conditions and environmental responsibility. Operating globally in about 20 countries, BLÅKLÄDER has a manufacturing presence in Florida, USA, while its headquarters remain in Sweden.

The company offers a comprehensive range of workwear products designed to enhance the working lives of tradesmen and women. BLÅKLÄDER collaborates closely with end-users in product development, launching over 1,200 new products in recent years. Its mission is to make work easier and safer through innovative, high-quality workwear.

Short Description:
Blend Plants is an Italian company that specializes in automated mobile mixing plants for concrete, cold asphalt, and cementitious mixtures. Founded in 1983, the company has built a global distribution network and focuses on environmentally sustainable solutions in the construction equipment sector.

Their product lineup includes mobile mixing plants, horizontal silos for material storage, concrete agitators, pumping plants, and various construction machinery such as mixers, blenders, and pumps. Blend Plants emphasizes mobility and automation, allowing for efficient production in remote locations while reducing energy consumption and production costs. Their technology supports a circular economy by minimizing waste and promoting the use of recycled materials.

The company serves diverse applications in the construction industry, including recycling, railway and road construction, and logistics. As a member of the Italian Industrial Hub, Blend Plants is committed to innovation and environmental responsibility, providing solutions that benefit both the environment and the construction sector.

BlueVolt, founded in 2002 and based in Portland, Oregon, is a leader in the eLearning industry. The company offers online training solutions that aim to boost sales, enhance brand awareness, and improve knowledge among employees and partners. Its primary product is a learning management system (LMS) and a channel learning and readiness (CLR) SaaS platform, which connects suppliers, distributors, and sales channels to facilitate effective training and knowledge sharing.

The services provided by BlueVolt are designed to help manufacturers and distributors communicate the unique value of their offerings through customized online training programs. These programs support employee and partner training, driving sales growth and fostering brand loyalty. In addition to the LMS, BlueVolt provides strategic support, business intelligence, and tailored channel-training solutions, promoting continuous learning and sales enablement. The company’s network enhances business opportunities by connecting organizations to share knowledge and best practices.

Short Description:
Carhartt, Inc. is an American clothing company founded in 1889 by Hamilton Carhartt, specializing in durable workwear for manual laborers and industrial workers. Headquartered in Dearborn, Michigan, it remains family-owned and has a rich history of producing rugged clothing tailored to the needs of workers, starting with railroad employees. The company is known for innovations like reinforced rivets and the use of tough fabrics such as duck canvas and denim.

Carhartt offers a wide range of products, including jackets, overalls, vests, shirts, jeans, fire-resistant clothing, hunting apparel, and gloves. Its garments are designed to withstand the demands of construction sites, farms, and other labor-intensive environments, incorporating high-technology materials that resist flame, abrasion, stains, and water. The brand has also gained popularity in streetwear and fashion circles, appealing to a diverse customer base that includes both traditional workers and modern fashion enthusiasts. Carhartt's commitment to quality and authenticity is encapsulated in its slogan, "True to This."

Technologies: Route 53, Outlook, Amazon AWS, Barracuda Networks, Remote
Short Description:
ChemCo Systems manufactures high performance epoxy and polyurea based adhesive, coating, grout, primer and control joint filler products for concrete repair, restoration and protection.

Our products are designed for use by specialty contractors (and mro facility engineers) for structural concrete bonding, patching, crack repair, floor joint filler, spall repair, protective coating and surface restoration. We offer solutions for extreme environments including underwater, corrosive, abrasive and extreme temperatures. All of our products feature 0 or near 0 VOCs and can provide LEED credits. We manufacture 2-component liquid and paste metering pumps for epoxy crack injection, repair of shrinkage cracks, slab delamination, voids, placement of steel and FRP anchors and dowels for seismic retrofit or strength upgrades. 

We also manufacture Epoxy Asphalt, an extremely durable pavement, which is used on long span steel decked bridges. Epoxy Asphalt bridge deck pavements have exhibited proven durability as long as 49 years. Epoxy Asphalt has been found to increase the lifespan of open graded permeable pavements (pavement type also called OGFC). Epoxy Asphalt does not melt, has extremely high fatigue resistance, forms chemical bonds to aggregates and does not oxidize or embrittle. In dense graded pavements, Epoxy Asphalt is impermeable to oxygen, water and salts, forming a protective barrier against corrosive elements.

We make InsulPOX, a three component epoxy insulating polymer concrete (IPC) for use in lining concrete trenches and tunnels of LNG import and export terminals. InsulPOX reduces the concentration of LNG vapors in the local air due to an cryogenic liquid accidental spill and protects concrete and steel from embrittlement  and spalling.

We have staff who proficient in Spanish, German, Cantonese and Chinese languages. We are headquarted near San Francisco, CA and have China offices in Tianjin and Nanjing.

Short Description:
Commercial Metals Company (CMC) is a global leader in sustainable recycling, manufacturing, and fabrication of steel and construction solutions. Founded in 1915 and headquartered in Irving, Texas, CMC operates over 213 facilities worldwide, employing more than 13,000 people. The company is publicly traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol CMC.

CMC provides a wide range of products and services, including steel long products such as rebar, angles, channels, and wire rod, produced in ten advanced steel mills across the U.S. Their construction services offer high-quality materials and solutions for projects of any size, supported by technical expertise and engineering assistance. CMC emphasizes sustainability through energy-efficient steel production using electric arc furnace technology and a commitment to recycling. The company serves diverse markets, including infrastructure, commercial and residential construction, energy, manufacturing, and agriculture, fostering collaborative relationships with contractors and engineers to deliver innovative and effective solutions.

Short Description:
Concetti is an Italian-based international group that specializes in designing and manufacturing automatic packaging systems for dry bulk products. Founded in 1918, the company has grown from a small workshop into a global leader in customized packaging machinery, particularly for industries such as agriculture, chemicals, and construction. With a strong presence in North America since the 1990s, Concetti offers fully automated packaging lines that include weighing, bagging, and palletizing systems tailored to meet the specific needs of its clients.

The company operates from its facility in Umbria, Italy, where it centralizes design, development, and production to ensure high-quality standards. Concetti North America Corporation, established in 2012, serves as the regional hub for sales and technical support in the U.S. The company prides itself on its commitment to reliability, excellence, and sustainability, with a focus on transforming client challenges into effective packaging solutions. With over 1,600 systems installed worldwide and a loyal customer base, Concetti continues to emphasize innovation and customer collaboration in its operations.

Short Description:
ConstructConnect is a prominent provider of cloud-based construction project data and preconstruction software, primarily serving the non-residential commercial construction industry in North America. Established in 2017 through the merger of several companies, it has become a market leader, offering comprehensive project intelligence and digital tools to over 60,000 customers across the United States and Canada.

The company specializes in delivering detailed construction project leads and market intelligence, covering more than 400,000 projects annually. ConstructConnect also offers digital takeoff and estimating solutions tailored for various sectors, including mechanical and plumbing. Its bid management platforms enhance communication between general contractors and subcontractors, streamlining the bidding process. With a vertically integrated product portfolio, ConstructConnect combines project data with advanced software solutions to support the entire preconstruction workflow, helping construction professionals optimize their planning and bidding processes.

CoverME.gov is the home of Maine's Health Insurance Marketplace. It is designed to help Mainers find affordable health coverage, compare qualified health insurance plans, and apply for help to lower the cost of health coverage.

Short Description:
Dayton Superior Corporation is an American company based in Miamisburg, Ohio, that specializes in developing, manufacturing, and distributing engineered products for the concrete construction industry in North America. The company operates 30 additional locations across the United States, Canada, Colombia, and Panama.

The product portfolio includes four main lines: concrete accessories that support placement and reinforcement, chemicals such as admixtures and curing compounds, forming systems for shaping and supporting concrete, and paving products for concrete applications. Dayton Superior holds 117 patents, showcasing its commitment to innovation in concrete construction technology. With around 1,200 employees and annual revenues of approximately $338 million, Dayton Superior serves a diverse customer base, including contractors and construction firms, providing solutions that enhance efficiency, quality, and safety in concrete projects.

Diablo Tools is a premium brand that specializes in high-performance cutting tools and abrasives. Founded in 2000 and based in High Point, North Carolina, it operates as a division of the Robert Bosch Tool Corporation. The company offers a wide range of products, including saw blades, router bits, reciprocating blades, jigsaw blades, and various drilling tools, designed for trade professionals in woodworking, metalworking, and construction.

The tools are engineered for superior performance, durability, and precision, utilizing proprietary technologies like TiCo™ carbide and Cermet II for enhanced cutting efficiency. Diablo Tools maintains its manufacturing facilities in Udine, Italy, ensuring high standards of quality. The brand targets professional tradespeople and contractors, providing expert advice and a nationwide dealer network to support its customers.

Diamond Blade Warehouse (DBW) is a wholesale supplier based in Vernon Hills, Illinois, specializing in diamond cutting tools. With over 37 years of experience, DBW offers a wide range of products, including diamond blades, core bits, and cup wheels, designed for cutting materials such as concrete, asphalt, granite, and tile.

DBW partners with over 20 manufacturers to curate a diverse inventory of high-quality tools tailored for various applications. This unique distribution model allows the company to provide optimized solutions that enhance cost efficiency for contractors. Serving over 100,000 active clients globally, DBW emphasizes customer service and product innovation. They also offer same-day or next-day shipping to meet urgent project needs, ensuring that customers have access to the tools they require when they need them.

Short Description:
Founded in 1946, DDM CONCUT (f.k.a. Dixie Diamond Manufacturing and Concut) has become the largest American-owned manufacturer of high-quality diamond tools. Our knowledgeable team provides the highest quality products and industry-leading service. We help solve our Customer's needs with an extensive range of diamond products specifically engineered for cutting concrete, asphalt, masonry, stone / tile and other materials.

DDM CONCUT manufactures and distributes diamond tools at our locations in Georgia and Washington state. Our "family owned and operated heritage" is at the heart of our problem solving culture, and we treat every Customer with care and respect.

Reasons why DDM CONCUT should be your preferred service provider:

• We have two US manufacturing facilities that provide national coverage. This means greater production flexibility and capacity, which translates to even better product accessibility and delivery for our customers.

• The DDM CONCUT team includes some of the best metallurgists in the country. We continue to further build on our product engineering strengths and provide our customers with products of superior quality.

• DDM CONCUT customers have access to an extensive selection of diamond blades, core bits and accessories, as well as to the complete Rockstar product line.

• Our knowledgeable sales and customer service team are able to quickly respond to the needs of customers throughout the United States.

As DDM CONCUT, we are proud to constitute the largest American-owned diamond tool manufacturer in North America. We look forward to the opportunity to help you with your diamond cutting and drilling needs.

Short Description:
The State of Connecticut is the official government entity of Connecticut, operating as a sovereign state government. It has a structured framework that includes executive, legislative, and judicial branches. The executive branch is led by the Governor, who oversees state agencies and administration. The legislative branch, known as the General Assembly, consists of a Senate and House of Representatives that create laws and manage the state budget. The judicial branch interprets laws and administers justice through various courts.

Connecticut provides a wide range of public services through its departments and agencies. These services include public education, environmental protection, transportation infrastructure, public health, social services, and judicial support. The Governor's office coordinates these efforts with a cabinet of commissioners. The residents, businesses, local governments, and visitors of Connecticut benefit from these essential services and programs, which are designed to support the community and ensure effective governance.

Short Description:
Our company is committed to tool innovation, networking with people of all levels of experience, and fostering business relationships with companies worldwide.

We had humble beginnings in 1988.  Mike Loveless was a simple diesel mechanic who wanted to find a way to make cleaning his fireplace less dusty.  With an entrepreneurial spirit, Mike invented products with one goal in mind - dust control.

More than 30 years later, we continue that same goal - to control dust, slurry, and hazardous materials such as silica, asbestos, lead, and more.  Our line includes contractor and industrial level vacuums and dust shrouds to fit various tools for that purpose - to capture fine dust.

We perform internal research and design to keep up-to-date on the industry.  We seek to connect with people who can teach us - and our customers - insider tips on tools, home improvement, and construction.

We currently have an extensive dealer network across the United States and Canada, and work with customers in other countries.  While we have an online presence, our primary goal is to partner with brick and mortar dealers and send our customers to their stores.

We would love to connect with you - whether you would like to learn, have something to teach us and our customers, or would like to form a partnership between our businesses.

Follow our page and give us a call if you would like to connect!

Fenagh Engineering and Testing (FET) is an engineering consulting firm established in 2014, dedicated to ensuring the structural integrity of construction projects across the United States. The company offers special inspections, materials testing, and geotechnical engineering services to both private and public sector clients.

FET's team includes experienced engineers, project managers, inspectors, and laboratory staff who are well-versed in various markets and jurisdictions. They operate accredited third-party laboratories that conduct thorough materials testing to ensure compliance with code requirements. The firm emphasizes a proactive management style that helps clients monitor project costs and achieve successful outcomes.

With a commitment to quality, safety, and reliability, Fenagh Engineering and Testing serves a diverse clientele across regions such as Greater New England, New York, Las Vegas, and California. Their focus on customer service and adherence to safety and compliance standards distinguishes them in the field of inspection and testing consulting.

Short Description:
The Euclid Chemical Company, based in Cleveland, Ohio, is a prominent manufacturer and supplier of specialty chemical products for the concrete and masonry construction industry. Founded in 1910, the company has over a century of experience and operates as a subsidiary of RPM International. It serves a diverse customer base, including contractors, architects, engineers, and building materials suppliers, through its business groups in North America, Mexico, and Colombia, along with various international partnerships.

Euclid Chemical offers a wide range of products designed to enhance the performance and durability of concrete and masonry projects. Their portfolio includes admixtures, fibers, integral colors, shotcrete materials, grouts, bonding agents, coatings, waterproofing agents, and specialty repair products. The company is known for its commitment to quality and innovation, supported by ISO 9001 certification. In addition to products, Euclid Chemical provides extensive technical support, including research and development, training programs, and consultation services, ensuring customers achieve successful project outcomes.

FieldFlō is a technology company based in Denver, Colorado, founded by specialty subcontractors to tackle operational challenges in industries like asbestos abatement, demolition, and environmental remediation. With a small team of fewer than 25 employees, FieldFlō generates under $5 million in revenue.

The company offers a comprehensive software platform designed specifically for specialty subcontractors. This platform streamlines various tasks, including project management, time tracking, payroll, inventory management, training tracking, job costing, and scheduling. By automating repetitive administrative tasks, FieldFlō helps subcontractors increase productivity and reduce labor costs. The software is user-friendly, catering to diverse users regardless of age, language, or technical skills. FieldFlō markets its solution as an accessible, out-of-the-box option with no startup costs and free training, making it a practical choice for subcontractors seeking efficient management tools.

Short Description:
Fortress Investment Group is a global investment management firm based in New York City, founded in 1998. Initially established as a private equity firm, it has expanded its focus to include hedge funds, real estate, and debt securities. Fortress became the first large U.S. private equity firm to be publicly traded in 2007 and returned to private ownership after being acquired by SoftBank Group in 2017. In 2024, Mubadala acquired a majority stake, while Fortress management retains significant ownership and operational autonomy.

The firm manages approximately $48 billion in assets, serving a diverse range of sophisticated investors, including institutional clients and individuals. Fortress emphasizes delivering superior risk-adjusted returns through disciplined investing across multiple asset classes, including private equity, hedge funds, real estate, credit, and litigation finance. The company fosters a collaborative culture that values trust, integrity, and performance, aiming to create long-term value for its clients through innovative and disciplined investment strategies.

Short Description:
Foundation Software is a prominent American software company that specializes in accounting and management solutions tailored for the construction industry. Founded in 1985 by Fred Ode, the company initially launched its flagship product, FOUNDATION®, a construction accounting system that helps manage job costs and financials. Over the years, Foundation Software has expanded its offerings to include a range of integrated solutions such as Payroll4Construction, mobile time tracking, HR management, estimating and takeoff tools, safety management, and project management applications.

Headquartered in Strongsville, Ohio, Foundation Software emphasizes a collaborative work culture focused on customer success and technological advancement. The company serves over 12,000 construction businesses across the United States, from small contractors to large commercial firms. Its comprehensive suite of solutions enables clients to efficiently manage their operations, improve profitability, and maintain operational control. Under the leadership of CEO Mike Ode, Foundation Software continues to grow and innovate, enhancing its product suite and commitment to customer support.

Fraco Products Ltd is a Canadian manufacturer based in St-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec, specializing in mast guided access equipment and vertical transportation solutions. Founded in 1991, the company offers a range of products including work platforms, construction elevators, industrial lifts, material-only hoists, and transport platforms. Fraco has established a strong presence in the North American mast climbing industry and operates internationally in markets such as France, the UK, Germany, and India.

Fraco designs and manufactures access equipment tailored for various sectors, including residential, commercial, and industrial construction, as well as power generation and mining. Their personnel elevators are engineered for safe transport in hazardous environments. The company operates multiple branches in Canada and the United States, supported by a network of over 20 distributors. Fraco emphasizes innovation, engineering expertise, and customer support, providing unique solutions and comprehensive project assistance to ensure safety and efficiency in their operations.

Short Description: For more than 35 years, Franmar has been synonymous with green innovation. As a family-owned business based in Bloomington, Illinois we believe that people should be able to undertake cleaning and restoration projects without risking their health or harming the environment. Franmar products rely on the power of soybeans rather than harsh chemicals like methylene chloride, muriatic acid or trisodium phosphate. Soy-based solvents are an affordable, superior alternative because they can easily penetrate coatings, adhesives, grease, asphalt and more, without noxious odors or side effects. Franmar's innovations include nearly two dozen products that are part of the BLUE BEAR® retail and industrial lines, as well as a full range of screen-printing products.

Short Description:
Fiberglass Rebar Technology Ltd. offers state-of-the-art machine technology and unparalleled engineering support for fiberglass rebar production. We specialize in turnkey factory solutions, enabling manufacturers worldwide to produce high-quality, corrosion-resistant fiberglass rebar with unmatched efficiency and reliability.

Our machinery produces TUF-BAR® fiberglass rebar that meets the following codes and standards:
- ASTM
- CSA
- ACI
- AASHTO

The TUF-BAR® product is the result of our extensive research and our close coordination with Professor Brahim Benmokrane at the University of Sherbrooke, who is the world's leading expert in fiberglass rebar. For more details, please visit our website at www.frttuf-bar.com.

Short Description:
Giatec Scientific Inc. is a Canadian company based in Ottawa, Ontario, founded in 2010. It specializes in developing and manufacturing nondestructive testing (NDT) devices for the construction industry, focusing on concrete testing technologies. Giatec aims to enhance the construction sector by integrating smart concrete testing technologies and real-time data collection into job sites globally.

The company offers a range of products, including SmartRock Sensors for real-time monitoring of concrete conditions, the Giatec 360™ dashboard for remote management of concrete pours, and Roxi, an AI program that optimizes concrete mix designs. Additionally, Giatec provides SmartHub for continuous data access and SmartMix™ for predicting material performance. Giatec serves a global market of contractors, engineers, and concrete producers, supporting projects that require precise quality monitoring. The company also shares educational resources to promote best practices in concrete technology.

Short Description:
GOMACO International Limited is the European subsidiary of GOMACO Corporation, a leader in concrete construction equipment based in the USA. Established in 1983 in the UK, the company serves as the sales, service, and parts office for customers in the UK, Europe, Russia, Africa, and the Middle East.

The company specializes in manufacturing advanced concrete construction machinery for various applications, including slipforming concrete roads, highways, airport runways, and more. Their product range features concrete pavers, curb and gutter machines, grade trimmers, and equipment for finishing flat slabs and bridge decks. GOMACO International also provides tailored equipment solutions through customer consultations and distributes its products via a network of local distributors.

Operating from a facility in Witney, Oxfordshire, GOMACO International Limited enhances customer service and logistics with its office space, storage yard, and service shop. The company is recognized for its export excellence, having received notable awards for its international achievements.

Short Description:
The Guardian is a prominent British daily newspaper founded in 1821 in Manchester. Originally named *The Manchester Guardian*, it became a daily publication in 1855 and changed its name to reflect its national and international reach in 1959. The paper is known for its investigative journalism and liberal editorial stance, emphasizing editorial independence.

Owned by the Scott Trust Limited, The Guardian ensures that profits are reinvested into the publication, safeguarding it from commercial or political influence. The Guardian Media Group operates the newspaper along with other media assets, including *The Observer*. The Guardian publishes a daily newspaper and offers digital media through its website, providing news, opinion pieces, and multimedia content. It also offers print and digital subscriptions, including *The Guardian Weekly* for international readers.

The Guardian targets an audience interested in in-depth news analysis, politics, and culture, appealing to educated professionals and socially conscious individuals. Its commitment to quality reporting and diverse viewpoints has established it as a leading voice in independent journalism.

Short Description:
HBC-radiomatic, Inc. is a prominent supplier of industrial radio control systems in North America, established in 1998 as part of the global HBC-radiomatic group. The company focuses on developing, manufacturing, and distributing high-quality wireless control systems for various applications, including industrial machinery, mobile hydraulics, marine operations, and cranes. Its headquarters near the Northern Kentucky/Cincinnati Airport is designed for rapid delivery and comprehensive service.

With over 75 years of history, HBC-radiomatic is ISO 9001:2015 certified and employs skilled personnel to ensure quality support across North America. The company has multiple service and repair locations staffed by factory-trained technicians. HBC-radiomatic is known for its innovative products, including proportional radio controls and explosion-protected systems, and offers extensive customer support, including consulting, training, and maintenance services. Its global network supports a diverse range of industries, ensuring safe and reliable radio control solutions.

Short Description:
Hilti Group is a family-owned company founded in 1941 in Schaan, Liechtenstein. It has evolved from a small mechanical workshop into a leading provider of technology, software, and services for the professional construction industry, operating in over 120 countries with more than 30,000 employees.

Hilti specializes in designing and manufacturing innovative construction tools and systems. Its product range includes power tools, powder-actuated tools, drilling and anchoring systems, and mechanical and chemical anchors. The company is committed to research and development, investing about 6% of its sales annually to create new solutions based on customer feedback. In addition to its products, Hilti offers software solutions and on-site support to address unique construction challenges. 

Hilti serves professional construction workers and companies that require reliable, high-performance tools and systems for various applications. Its global presence and comprehensive offerings make it a trusted partner in the construction industry.

Short Description:
HJ3 Composite Technologies, based in Tucson, Arizona, was founded in 2002 and specializes in engineered composite repair systems. The company is a global leader in manufacturing durable carbon fiber repair solutions for various industrial applications. HJ3 serves multiple sectors, including food and agriculture, pulp and paper, oil and gas, water and wastewater, mining, and power generation.

The company's core offering is its Speed to Solution™ approach, which focuses on rapid engineering and delivery. HJ3 provides same-day engineering design for repairs involving tanks, concrete, silos, and pipes, and ships code-compliant composite repair kits the same day orders are received. This enables next-day implementation of long-lasting solutions. HJ3 also offers online training to help customers effectively use their repair technologies.

Led by CEO James Butler, HJ3 combines manufacturing expertise with a commitment to customer service, employing a team with over 200 years of combined experience in composite technologies and industrial repair. The company has approximately 30–39 employees and generates annual revenues around $5.8 million.

Short Description:
Instagrid is a European climate tech company based in Baden-Württemberg, Germany. It specializes in portable power supplies designed for professionals with off-grid energy needs. Founded by former Bosch executives Sebastian Berning and Andreas Sedlmayr, Instagrid focuses on innovative battery technology that offers a clean and silent alternative to traditional combustion generators. 

The company's flagship product, Instagrid GO, is a compact power system that delivers reliable performance without the noise and emissions associated with diesel generators. It is suitable for various sectors, including construction, film and media, events, and emergency response. Instagrid operates in several European countries, including Germany, France, Finland, and the United Kingdom, and emphasizes sustainability in its products and corporate culture. As a certified B Corporation, Instagrid is committed to reducing emissions and promoting safer workplaces while driving the clean energy transition.

Short Description:
Irongate is a leading provider of Safety Management and Compliance software, offering tailored solutions for a variety of industries, with a special focus on construction. The company's software enables clients to manage workplace safety and compliance efficiently, with features such as safety training, qualification tracking, safety meetings, and customizable documents. These tools help organizations maintain regulatory compliance, reduce risks, and boost operational efficiency.

Irongate's services are backed by decades of industry expertise, helping businesses stay ahead of safety regulations while managing tasks like compliance documentation, safety awareness & training and qualification management. The software is cloud-based, providing easy access to safety data and reports, while the field app ensures usability even without a network connection. These features allow clients to stay compliant, reduce accidents, and streamline their operations​.

With comprehensive on-site support, award-winning program management, and a user-friendly interface, Irongate Safety empowers organizations to prioritize safety while focusing on their core business needs​.

Our NSF 61 certified Earth Shield® line of chemical resistant waterstop is used throughout the world by major engineering firms and project owners for primary and secondary containment applications, as well as industrial wastewater treatment and ozone contactor structures. LIFT Safety is a premium brand specializing in safety products and personal protective equipment (PPE) with over 20 years of experience. The company offers a range of high-quality products, including carbon fiber hard hats and pro series gloves, designed to provide superior protection for industrial workers. LIFT Safety emphasizes innovation, performance, and style, ensuring that their gear meets the demanding needs of construction, manufacturing, and other industrial sectors.

Founded in 2004, LIFT Safety builds on a legacy of protection from its sister company, EVS Sports, which has a long history in motocross protective gear. The company is committed to "protection above all else," making it a recognized name in the industrial safety market. Headquartered in California, LIFT Safety operates with a focus on continuous innovation and quality, shipping products directly from their location to serve customers effectively.

Short Description:
MEKA Crushing & Screening and Concrete Batching Technologies is a global manufacturer based in Turkey, specializing in equipment for the aggregates, mining, and concrete industries since 1987. The company designs and produces a wide range of crushing, screening, washing, and concrete batching equipment tailored to meet diverse operational needs in various environments worldwide. With over 3,000 plants installed in more than 80 countries, MEKA has established itself as a trusted partner for major construction and materials companies.

MEKA offers a variety of concrete batching plants, including stationary, mobile, and compact options, as well as concrete mixers and recycling systems. Their crushing and screening equipment includes feeders, crushers, and washing systems, all engineered for durability and efficiency. The company also provides mobile aggregate feeding conveyor systems, enhancing flexibility in construction projects. MEKA is recognized for its commitment to quality, customization, and strong after-sales support, making it a preferred choice for professionals in the industry.

Short Description:
Agile Frameworks, LLC is a technology company that specializes in cloud-based operational workflow solutions for engineering firms, particularly in construction materials testing and geotechnical engineering. Their main product, MetaField, is an end-to-end Operational Workflow Platform that automates the lifecycle of field and lab operations, including project setup, scheduling, data collection, lab testing, reporting, and invoicing.

MetaField combines Field Information Management Systems (FIMS) and Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) into a single SaaS platform, enhancing efficiency and accuracy for over 150 customers and more than 10,000 daily users across North America. The platform offers over 500 customizable form templates, allowing firms to transition from manual processes to digital workflows. Key features include mobile data collection, scheduling management, quality control, and real-time integration of project operations with business administration.

Headquartered in Hickory, North Carolina, Agile Frameworks employs around 56 people and generates estimated annual revenues of approximately $7.3 million. The company is focused on expanding its team and evolving the MetaField solution to meet the needs of engineering firms.

Established in 1995, Nash Distribution is the supplier to over 600 foundation repair, basement, mold, pest, HVAC, restoration and crawl space contractors across the US and Canada. We are dedicated to providing quality products, marketing support, installation and sales training and rapid delivery of goods to our customers. We will strive to implement a long-term relationship with our customers, based on safety, quality, timely delivery and an anticipation of their needs. At Nash, we are proud to ship 99.9% of our orders the same day, and our great location in Central Ohio means orders arrive to you very quickly.
Nash Distribution Warehouse

Nash Distribution is also the exclusive Distributor for many of our products, including:

- Reinforcer Carbon Fiber Strap
- Terminator Foundation Support Bracket
- The Force Spring-Loaded I-Beam System
- Superior Sump Complete Pump Systems
- Cord Wrangler
- Freeze Relief Frozen Discharge Line Protection Device
- White Cap Vapor Barrier and Drainage Matting
- Power Post Crawl Space Stabilizer

In addition to meeting the demands of our customers with quality products, we also offer extensive training and marketing support to our dealers. This includes web site development and analytics, a variety of printed marketing materials, trade show displays, customized contracts, and much more. We have also built educational lead gathering websites that we provide to our customers. All of our efforts are aimed at helping you grow your business!

National Flooring Equipment Inc. is a family-owned company based in Minneapolis, Minnesota, established in 1968. It specializes in industrial-quality floor removal and surface preparation equipment, recognized as a market leader in this field. The company designs and manufactures its products in the United States, focusing on durable components for reliable performance. Their product range includes scrapers, grinders, and shot blasters, catering to various project sizes and applications.

The company offers rental options for its equipment through a global distribution network, making its products accessible internationally. National Flooring Equipment is committed to building long-term relationships with customers, emphasizing integrity, trust, and exceptional service. They provide expert advice and resources, including tips and training videos, to help customers effectively use their equipment. With a dedicated team and a focus on customer experience, National Flooring Equipment serves a diverse clientele in the flooring industry, including contractors and industrial clients.

Short Description:
Fujian South Highway Machinery Co., Ltd. (NFLG), founded in 1997 and based in Quanzhou, China, is a prominent enterprise in the construction and engineering machinery sector. The company specializes in the development, manufacturing, and service of mixing plants and integrated solutions. With over 1,200 employees and significant fixed assets, NFLG operates across three main areas: material processing, engineering mixing, and construction and demolition waste treatment.

NFLG offers a diverse range of products, including concrete mixing plants, asphalt mixing plants, dry mortar mixing plants, crushing and screening equipment, and construction waste treatment equipment. The company emphasizes research and development, holding over 300 patents and collaborating with international experts to enhance its technology. NFLG integrates hardware, software, and services, utilizing digital intelligence and IoT technologies to create efficient operational solutions. The company aims to be a trusted global supplier, serving construction companies and infrastructure developers both in China and internationally.

OVERTON Safety Training provides employers with solutions for OSHA compliance for crane, forklift, aerial, loader, and rigging professionals.

We designed, developed and authored 28 various hoisting and lifting training programs for industry professionals. Our training programs can be conducted on-site at your location or through our conveniently located and scheduled open-enrollment classes. Short Description:
PilieroMazza PLLC is a law firm based in Washington, D.C., founded in the early 1980s by Daniel J. Piliero II. The firm is dedicated to providing high-quality, personalized legal counsel, primarily serving government contractors and commercial businesses across various industries both nationally and internationally. With approximately 38 attorneys, including 16 partners, PilieroMazza operates with a boutique business model that emphasizes close client relationships and tailored legal services.

The firm offers a wide range of legal services, including business transactions, government contracts, labor and employment law, and litigation. They advise clients on entity formation, mergers and acquisitions, regulatory compliance, and contract disputes. PilieroMazza also has expertise in areas such as private equity, cybersecurity, intellectual property, and tribal advocacy. Short Description:
Founded in 1945 by the Poggi brothers, Poggi S.p.a. is a proud Italian company that specialises in manufacturing vertical silos, water clarifiers, and hoppers in a variety of sizes for diverse applications. We also produce metal structures and industrial carpentry. From the very beginning, the Poggi brothers have focused on diligence, flexibility, and a deep passion for our craft, always recognising the importance of customer satisfaction and long-term success.

At the heart of our approach is a commitment to embracing innovative technical solutions, investing in our people, and carefully listening to the needs of our customers. This dedication has yielded tangible results, proving our ongoing commitment to excellence. We face challenges with confidence, driven by these core principles.

Environmental responsibility is central to our operations. Since 2011, we've achieved total energy self-sufficiency with zero emissions, thanks to photovoltaic installations on the roofs of our facilities. This milestone highlights our dedication to environmental stewardship and continuous improvement.

Our ability to innovate, invest in our workforce, and understand and fulfil customer needs has been a key factor in our success. We've anchored our future on these principles, allowing us to face each new challenge with experience and assurance.

Above all, we continue to prioritise environmental care and improvement, ensuring that our operations remain sustainable for the long term.

Keywords: construction, civil engineering, concrete products, paving stone laying machines, material handling, truck crane attachments, gardening & landscaping, construction hardware manufacturing, mining & metals
Short Description:
Whether in structural or civil engineering, whether in the garden or on the street: We are at home on all construction sites. Our machines and tools make life easier for everyone who works with paving stones, pipes and other concrete products. Because we put efficiency and ergonomics first, we have become the world market leader in the field of gripping and laying technology through numerous innovations.

We offer customized and sustainable solutions, be it construction site equipment for all applications, for example paving stone laying machines, or machines for storage and material handling in building material plants. Our truck crane attachments facilitate transport and loading in the warehouse and on the construction site, while our professional hand tools for all purposes help with laying and inserting.

For more than 60 years we have been growing continuously and are reliably available for you worldwide with more than 1.700 sales partners. We are a german based company and have founded our own subsidiaries so far in Great Britain, France, Italy, Poland, China, Korea, Canada and the USA; worldwide, more than 190 Probst employees work daily to make your hard work easier.
Probst Australia Pty Ltd is our latest subsidiary. Follow us along our journey of #makinghardworkeasier in Australia.

Screening Eagle Technologies is a global leader in intelligent inspection solutions for the built environment. Formed by the merger of Dreamlab and Proceq, the company combines advanced software, sensors, and data analytics to provide reliable inspection data that supports construction, maintenance, and asset management decisions. Their mission is to protect infrastructure assets worldwide.

The company offers a full-stack technology platform that integrates intuitive software with portable sensors. Their products include advanced non-destructive testing (NDT) sensors for concrete and metal inspection, AI-powered software for asset management, and 3D subsurface mapping technology. Screening Eagle also provides calibration services to ensure sensor accuracy. Their solutions are utilized by a diverse range of professionals, including governmental agencies, construction firms, and engineers, to maintain the integrity of critical infrastructure efficiently.

Pyramex Safety Products is a family-owned company founded in 1991, specializing in the manufacturing and distribution of personal protective equipment (PPE). Pyramex is committed to providing innovative and reliable protection for workers across various industries, including construction, manufacturing, and welding. They emphasize exceptional customer service and uphold values that honor individuals and foster strong community relationships.

SBM Mineral Processing GmbH is an Austrian company recognized as a leading supplier of mobile and stationary processing and conveying plants for the raw materials and recycling industries. Founded in 1950, the company has built a strong reputation for quality and efficiency, particularly in challenging operational conditions.

The company offers a wide range of products, including mineral processing plants for ores and coal, recycling plants for used construction materials, and various concrete mixing plants. Their portfolio features mobile, semi-mobile, and stationary batching plants, as well as specialized technology for high-performance concrete and highway construction applications. SBM also provides modifications and expansions of existing plants to meet specific customer needs.

Headquartered in Oberweis, Upper Austria, SBM employs around 190 people and is part of the MFL Group, which enhances its global reach. The company serves a diverse international customer base in sectors such as raw material extraction, recycling, and construction, delivering efficient and flexible processing and concrete mixing solutions.

Short Description:
Skudo USA specializes in temporary surface protection systems for the construction industry. Founded in 2010 and based in Dallas, Texas, the company has established itself as a leader in safeguarding sensitive surfaces during construction projects across North America. Skudo's mission is to provide effective solutions that help contractors maintain clean and damage-free environments, ensuring projects are completed on time and within budget.

The company offers a variety of surface protection products, including SkudoBoard for floor protection, Column Guard for vertical columns, Corner Guard for vulnerable corners, and All-Terrain Mats for heavy machinery traffic. Many of these products are reusable, fire-retardant, slip-resistant, and designed with antibacterial properties, reflecting Skudo's commitment to safety and sustainability. Skudo's solutions are widely used in diverse construction projects, such as hospitals, schools, and airports, demonstrating their reliability in protecting surfaces throughout all phases of construction.

Short Description:
Stanley Tools is a well-established brand known for manufacturing hand tools and hardware for home improvement, industrial, and professional use. Founded in 1843 in New Britain, Connecticut, the company has evolved significantly over the years, becoming a leader in the hand tools market with a 20% share of a $12 billion global market. A key moment in its history was the 2010 merger with Black & Decker, forming Stanley Black & Decker, under which Stanley Tools operates.

The company offers a wide range of products, including hand tools like screwdrivers, hammers, and saws, as well as measuring tools, particularly tape measures known for their accuracy. Stanley is also recognized for its cutting tools, including innovative utility knives, and various hardware items such as door locks and hinges. Stanley Tools serves a diverse customer base, including professional contractors, homeowners, and industrial users, all of whom rely on the brand for quality and reliability. With a commitment to innovation and excellence, Stanley Tools continues to uphold its legacy in the hand tools industry.

Short Description:
Superabrasive Inc. is a manufacturer based in Hoschton, Georgia, specializing in diamond and CBN (cubic boron nitride) grinding and finishing products. Founded in 1977, the company serves various industries, including automotive, aerospace, medical, and construction. 

The company is recognized for its LAVINA line of concrete grinding and polishing machines, which includes burnishers, dust extractors, and diamond tools. Superabrasive uniquely manufactures both the machines and the diamond tools, catering to projects from residential floors to large industrial facilities. The LAVINA product line has evolved since its launch in 2004, focusing on productivity and user-friendliness.

In addition to concrete equipment, Superabrasive produces a range of abrasive products, including maintenance chemicals, cutting wheels, and optical equipment. With over 30 years of experience, the company has established itself as a leader in the concrete industry. Superabrasive also has a manufacturing facility in Bulgaria, enhancing its capacity to serve a global customer base with high-quality solutions for surface preparation and finishing tasks.

Short Description:
Taylor & Francis Group is a prominent international academic publisher based in the United Kingdom, established in 1852. It is a division of Informa plc and has a rich history that began with the publication of scientific journals. Over the years, the company has expanded its offerings to include a wide range of academic disciplines, such as agriculture, chemistry, education, engineering, geography, law, mathematics, medicine, and social sciences.

The company publishes over 2,400 academic journals and approximately 6,500 new books each year. Its imprints, including Routledge and CRC Press, focus on various fields, including humanities, social sciences, and STEM. Taylor & Francis has also embraced digital publishing, enhancing its resources through acquisitions like Colwiz and F1000. Serving the academic and research community, Taylor & Francis supports universities, research institutions, libraries, and individual scholars worldwide, facilitating the global dissemination of scholarly knowledge.

Founded in Sweden in 1955, the company has over 65 years of experience and is recognized for its robust and safety-centric solutions. With a strong presence in Europe and operations in North Miami, Florida, Tele Radio is committed to delivering reliable products that meet the demanding environments of heavy industry.
