Short Description:
Ferroglobe PLC is a global metallurgical producer headquartered in London, United Kingdom. Formed in December 2015 through the merger of Grupo FerroAtlántica and Globe Specialty Metals, the company specializes in producing silicon metal, manganese alloys, and ferrosilicon. Its products are essential for industries such as electric vehicle battery development and solar energy.

Ferroglobe is actively involved in innovative projects, including Carbon Capture and Storage (CCS), and has secured funding to support these initiatives. The company employs over 3,200 people and competes internationally with other firms in the metallurgical sector. With a commitment to sustainability and advanced industrial applications, Ferroglobe plays a significant role in the production of materials that support modern technologies.

Short Description:
Powerfleet, formerly known as Fleet Complete, is a global leader in fleet management and mobile workforce technology solutions. Founded in 2000 in Toronto, Canada, the company has grown to serve fleet-based organizations across North America, Europe, Mexico, and Australia.

Powerfleet offers a cloud-based platform that connects vehicles, mobile workers, cargo, and stationary assets to enhance fleet operations. Their services include GPS fleet management for real-time vehicle tracking and route optimization, as well as mobile workforce management solutions that improve productivity through customizable workflows. Additionally, Powerfleet has developed an AI-powered predictive maintenance platform in partnership with Pitstop, which monitors critical vehicle components to reduce downtime and enhance safety.

With a diverse customer base of over 5,000 organizations, Powerfleet caters to small and medium-sized businesses as well as large enterprises in industries such as logistics, transportation, and supply chain management. The company is committed to innovation and customer service, supported by a strong leadership team.

Short Description:
FleetSafe.Ai is a technology company focused on AI-powered video telematics and fleet management solutions. Their mission is to enhance fleet safety and simplify risk management through intelligent, connected technologies. The company aims to help fleets reduce incidents, insurance claims, and operational costs with their unified platform.

Founded by experts in telematics and logistics, FleetSafe.Ai offers a range of products, including the FleetLive Platform, which integrates AI, IoT, and video telematics for real-time data insights. They provide AI-powered driver behavior and fatigue monitoring, comprehensive fleet solutions for various fleet sizes, and customizable telematics for OEMs and dealerships. Additionally, their insurance solutions streamline claims processing and reduce fraud by leveraging accurate data and video evidence.

FleetSafe.Ai serves a diverse customer base, including fleet operators, telematics service providers, automotive manufacturers, and insurance companies. Their focus on scalable fleet safety solutions and global connectivity positions them as a key player in the telematics industry.

Short Description:
Groundworks is a national company based in Virginia Beach, Virginia, specializing in residential foundation and water management solutions. Founded in 1986, it operates over 50 offices and employs more than 4,400 people across 33 states. The company has assisted over 1.5 million homeowners in protecting and repairing their homes, establishing itself as a prominent provider in the foundation and waterproofing industry.

The services offered by Groundworks include foundation repair, basement waterproofing, crawl space repair and encapsulation, concrete lifting, plumbing repairs, gutter installation, and sump pump maintenance and installation. Groundworks is known for its quality workmanship and customer satisfaction, holding an A rating with the Better Business Bureau and a 4.5 out of 5-star customer rating. The company provides nationally-backed, transferable warranties that cover manufacturing defects and wear and tear, ensuring long-term protection for homeowners.

Groundworks is also dedicated to community support, contributing to organizations like Habitat for Humanity and St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital, highlighting its commitment to social responsibility.

Short Description:
HexArmor is a Michigan-based company founded in 2004 and headquartered in Grand Rapids. The company is dedicated to ensuring every worker returns home safe each day. It specializes in high-performance personal protective equipment (PPE), focusing on cut, puncture, needle resistance, and hand impact protection. HexArmor serves various industries, including oil and gas, construction, energy, lumber, pulp and paper, and transportation.

The product portfolio includes advanced safety gloves and protective gear designed for maximum protection while maintaining comfort and dexterity. HexArmor collaborates closely with its research and development team and end users to create application-specific solutions that address real-world safety challenges. The company has also partnered with the German-based UVEX SAFETY GROUP to expand its offerings to include safety eyewear and head protection in North America. With over 150 safety professionals, HexArmor is committed to continuous improvement and innovation, driven by customer feedback and a focus on safety excellence.

HIDE Skimmer Lids is a construction company based out of 26 Link Dr, Yatala, Australia.

Skimmer Lids Pty Ltd manufactures stainless steel Skimmer Lids, Access Covers and Drain Covers for external use in any patio, pool and landscape. HIDE Covers are a cosmetic hidden inlay cover that blends into your landscape.

The HIDE system incorporates your selected surface material into the lid, enabling the HIDE Lid to blend into the surrounding landscape, creating a superior, seamless finish.

HIDE's innovative lids for skimmer boxes, access points and drain covers provide a robust and safe solution to other traditional, less aesthetic covers. They protect your stone and your family for years to come.

A brief overview

Skimmer Lids

A HIDE Skimmer Lid Kit solves the problem of using more traditional covers that stand out on your poolside's coping. Used to replace the round yellow plastic skimmer covers, they allow your poolside to look its very best. Providing more than just aesthetics, HIDE Lids are a safe alternative, opening only with the safety key. They keep the powerful pool pump away from the reach of children. 

 Some benefits of the HIDE Skimmer Lid kit are:

• Matches the surrounding landscape
• Your choice to match grout lines and material through the lid
• Pool safe compliant
• Eliminates stone/tile chipping & cracking
• Sold as a complete kit
• Replaces a traditional plastic lid

Access Covers

HIDE Access Covers are the perfect choice when concealing service points in outdoor areas, as they blend seamlessly into your selected surface. 
HIDE Access Covers are available in a wide range of sizes and depths.
Access covers conceal entry to all service points:
• IO & Bolted trap screw (BTS) 
• Water table pipe 
• Water and balance tanks 
• Taps and irrigation 
• Valves and meters 
• Electrical junction box

Drain Covers

Seamlessly conceal the drain access by doing away with standard metal or plastic grates. These covers are suited to capture surface water.

Short Description:
The Hetrick-Martin Institute (HMI) is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting LGBTQIA+ youth aged 13 to 24 and their families. Founded in 1979, HMI is recognized as the oldest and largest LGBTQ youth services organization in the U.S. Its mission is to provide a safe and supportive environment that empowers queer and trans youth to reach their full potential while addressing systemic barriers in education, mental health, and social services.

HMI offers various services, including the Harvey Milk High School, the first public high school in the U.S. designed for LGBTQ and marginalized youth. The institute also provides youth support services such as counseling and community programs, along with the HMI Millieu Model, which shares best practices for supporting LGBTQ youth. Additionally, the PRYSM Scan tool helps organizations assess their readiness to serve LGBTQ individuals inclusively. HMI plays a vital role in advocating for the rights and safety of LGBTQ youth, marking significant milestones in its history.

Short Description:
Husqvarna Construction is a prominent manufacturer of equipment and diamond tools tailored for the light construction industry. As part of the Husqvarna Group, which has a rich history of over 325 years in innovation, the company focuses on delivering high-performance, user-friendly machines designed for cutting, sawing, drilling, demolishing, grinding, and polishing concrete and stone.

The product lineup includes various saws, drills, remote impact hammers, surface preparers, diamond tools, and protective equipment. Husqvarna Construction emphasizes safety and usability, ensuring that construction professionals can work efficiently and confidently. The company serves a diverse customer base of contractors and construction professionals who rely on durable and reliable tools for their projects. With its North American operations based in Olathe, Kansas, Husqvarna Construction is committed to supporting its customers with quality products and comprehensive service.

Short Description:
Ma'Aref Technologie - HYTORC Pakistan is a technology-focused company based in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, established in 2004. It specializes in advanced bolting solutions for the oil, gas, energy, and related industries. As the sole authorized dealer of HYTORC USA products in Pakistan, the company offers a wide range of precision torque and tension tools, including hydraulic and pneumatic torque wrenches, bolting tools, pumps, fasteners, and related software.

The company also operates as an Authorized Repair Center for HYTORC equipment, providing NIST-traceable calibrations and maintenance services. Ma'Aref Technologie's core services include bolting consultancy, audits, and on-site bolting services, all aimed at achieving precision and leak-free bolted joints. With a commitment to enhancing safety and productivity, the company serves clients in heavy industries where reliable bolting is essential.

Short Description:
IB Roof Systems is a U.S.-based company founded in 1978 by the Stanley family. It specializes in designing and manufacturing high-performance PVC roofing membranes and complete roofing systems for both commercial and residential buildings. The company focuses on providing durable, maintenance-free roofing solutions that ensure long-term asset protection, with many roofs still performing leak-free since their installation.

The core offering includes proprietary thermoplastic PVC roofing membranes as part of fully engineered roofing systems. IB Roof Systems limits product availability to authorized installers to maintain quality installation and performance. Their product line features membranes, flashings, and various roofing accessories designed for ease of installation, reflecting a contractor-centric philosophy. The company serves a diverse customer base, including commercial building owners, property managers, contractors, and design professionals across the United States, supported by exceptional technical expertise and customer service.

In 2023, IB Roof Systems was acquired by Kingspan Group, enhancing its presence in the U.S. single-ply roofing market and creating opportunities for growth and expanded product offerings.

Short Description:
IFS is a global enterprise software company that provides comprehensive business solutions through its unified cloud platform, IFS Cloud. Founded in 1983 and headquartered in Itasca, Illinois, IFS specializes in integrating Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), Enterprise Asset Management (EAM), and Field Service Management (FSM) to help organizations optimize their operations across various industries.

The company offers a range of products, including a cloud-native ERP solution that streamlines core business processes, EAM software for managing the lifecycle of physical assets, and FSM tools that enhance field service operations. IFS also incorporates artificial intelligence and machine learning through IFS.ai, enabling automation and predictive analytics. Additional offerings include process automation tools, remote assistance using augmented reality, and sustainability solutions that help organizations reduce emissions and innovate. IFS serves midsize to large enterprises in sectors such as aerospace, manufacturing, automotive, and energy, focusing on delivering user-friendly and flexible software solutions.

Short Description:
Isuzu Commercial Truck of America, Inc. (ICTA) is the North American subsidiary of Isuzu Motors Limited, based in Anaheim, California. Established in 1984, ICTA is the exclusive distributor of Isuzu commercial trucks in the United States and has been the top-selling low cab forward truck brand since 1986. The company focuses on medium-duty commercial trucks, offering a range of models designed for urban and regional delivery, utility, and service applications.

ICTA's product lineup includes the N-Series and F-Series trucks, both assembled in Michigan, as well as the Isuzu Reach delivery truck. The company has also introduced electric vehicles, such as the NRR-EV, reflecting its commitment to innovation. With a nationwide dealer network of over 300 dealers, ICTA provides comprehensive support services, including training, maintenance programs, and genuine parts. The company emphasizes quality, durability, and low cost of ownership, making it a preferred choice for commercial customers across various industries.

Short Description:
Liberty Safety is a U.S.-based company founded in 1987 that specializes in personal protective equipment (PPE) for workplace safety. Initially a manufacturer of safety gloves, the company has grown to offer over 5,000 products across 27 categories and 12 sub-brands, making it a comprehensive supplier of head-to-toe safety gear.

Their product range includes gloves, hard hats, high-visibility apparel, footwear, and other protective equipment tailored for industries such as construction, manufacturing, and logistics. Liberty Safety employs a “good, better, best” product model, allowing customers to choose PPE that fits their specific risk levels and budget. The company prioritizes product quality and reliability, ensuring that their offerings are durable and comfortable while providing essential protection.

Liberty Safety also provides expert customer support, with knowledgeable staff available to help clients select the right PPE and address safety challenges. With nearly four decades of experience, Liberty Safety is dedicated to delivering quality, variety, and customer-focused service in the PPE market.

Short Description:
Limble CMMS is a software company founded in 2015, based in Lehi, Utah. It specializes in cloud-based Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) and Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) solutions. The company aims to simplify and modernize maintenance operations for businesses of all sizes. Led by CEO Bryan Christiansen, Limble CMMS offers a user-friendly, subscription-based platform that helps organizations reduce downtime, lower maintenance costs, and enhance asset performance through data-driven management.

The core product is a comprehensive CMMS platform that allows users to assign, track, and complete work orders remotely, automate preventive maintenance, and manage equipment and inventory efficiently. The platform integrates with ERP, IoT, and other enterprise systems, ensuring operational efficiency and data security. Limble CMMS serves various industries, including manufacturing, brewing, and healthcare, and provides expert guidance, tailored success plans, and 24/7 customer support. The company also recognizes outstanding maintenance teams through initiatives like the Limble Maintenance Hero Awards, showcasing its commitment to the maintenance community.

Magni America LLC is the exclusive factory-owned importer and distributor of Magni Telescopic Handlers in the United States. Established in 2015, the company has expanded from a small rental operation to a significant presence with facilities in Roselle, New Jersey, and Pasadena, Texas. It specializes in the sale, rental, and support of a wide range of Magni telehandlers, including Rotating Telehandlers, Fixed Boom Telehandlers, and Heavy Lift Telehandlers, along with various attachments.

The telehandlers are designed for versatility and safety, featuring Load Moment Indicator systems to prevent overloading and tipping. Magni America serves a diverse customer base, including large rental companies and construction firms, focusing on operational efficiency and safety. Backed by the innovation of its parent company, Magni Telescopic Handlers, Magni America is recognized for its commitment to quality and customer service, supported by a robust dealer network and comprehensive parts inventory.

Short Description: MB BIM Solutions is a team of engineers located in the Denver Tech Center, and is a wholly-owned subsidiary of G.H. Phipps Construction Companies.  We use our design, software, and construction coordination backgrounds to offer BIM consulting services to GH Phipps, other general contractors, and specialty subcontractors.  Our main service offerings include fabrication modeling and shop drawings for various building systems (such as precast concrete, rebar, cast in place concrete, and MEP systems), 3D coordination and clash detection, construction sequencing and schedule simulations, construction visualization, reality capture, and structural engineering consulting.  We work on high-profile large commercial construction projects throughout the Rocky Mountain region.  Our service offerings continue to expand as we grow to include leading BIM/VDC technologies and project delivery methods.  We are a small, dynamic firm that drives and adapts to advances in BIM technology, workflows, and practices.  Our success is a direct result of having a team that is innovative, software-driven, and forward-thinking.  With our small company atmosphere and culture of innovation, each team member's ideas and contributions are highly valued.

Short Description:
The Mechanical Contractors Association of America (MCAA) is a prominent industry association representing over 3,000 firms in the mechanical contracting sector, including heating, air conditioning, refrigeration, plumbing, and HVACR services. With a history of more than 100 years, MCAA is committed to advancing member success through education, advocacy, safety, and networking.

MCAA empowers its members by offering a wide range of educational programs and events, such as the MCAA Annual Convention and the WiMI Conference, aimed at enhancing both managerial and technical skills. The association also emphasizes safety in the workplace and fosters partnerships that promote skilled labor and quality workmanship. MCAA collaborates closely with the United Association (UA) to benefit its members and the clients they serve. Headquartered in Rockville, Maryland, MCAA provides valuable resources, including a national staff directory and a contractor search tool, to connect clients with qualified mechanical contractors.

Short Description:
Metaltech Scaffolding specializes in the development, manufacturing, and distribution of scaffolding and construction equipment. The company focuses on enhancing safety, reliability, and efficiency on job sites through innovative products. Their offerings include a variety of scaffolding systems for both interior and exterior use, ladders, temporary fencing, and material handling equipment.

Notable products include the Jobsite Series™ 6′ Baker scaffolding, which supports up to 1,100 lbs and complies with safety standards, and the Climb-N-Go™ motorized scaffolding system that allows for safe movement without dismounting. Metaltech also provides custom fabrication services using durable materials like aluminum and copper. Their commitment to quality and safety is evident in their adherence to ANSI, CSA, and OSHA standards, making them a trusted choice for contractors, homeowners, and industrial clients alike.

Short Description:
MFM Building Products Corp, established in 1961, is a family-owned and employee-owned manufacturer based in Coshocton, Ohio. The company specializes in waterproofing and weather barrier products for residential, commercial construction, and HVAC markets. MFM is dedicated to product innovation, quality, and cost efficiency, with all products proudly manufactured in the United States.

The company offers a wide range of self-adhering waterproofing membranes and weather barrier solutions. Their product lineup includes low-slope roofing membranes, steep-slope roofing underlayments, roof flashing products, and specialty tapes. MFM also provides exterior waterproofing membranes, such as the NX Seal, and the FlexClad jacketing system for ductwork and pipes. These products are designed for ease of use and come with strong warranties, ensuring reliability for new construction, reroofing, and repair projects.

MFM Building Products serves a diverse customer base, including roofing contractors, building product distributors, and HVAC professionals across the United States, supported by an extensive distribution network. The company emphasizes employee ownership and benefits, reflecting its commitment to both product quality and workforce well-being.

Short Description:
Mi-T-M Corporation, founded in 1971 by A.J. Spiegel, is a prominent industrial equipment manufacturer based in Peosta, Iowa. The company started with the development of the first 1000 PSI self-contained, gas-powered pressure washer and has since expanded its product line to include pressure washers, air compressors, generators, vacuums, portable heaters, and water treatment systems. Mi-T-M serves various industries, including construction, manufacturing, agriculture, and government.

The company operates a nearly 1 million-square-foot facility equipped with advanced manufacturing technologies, ensuring high-quality production. Mi-T-M is recognized for its commitment to performance, quality, and dependability, and it maintains rigorous safety and performance standards through its certified testing facility. In 2021, Mi-T-M became an employee-owned company, promoting a culture of ownership and accountability among its workforce. With a diverse customer base, including major private-label clients and government contracts, Mi-T-M has built a strong reputation in the industrial sector.

Short Description:
Motive, formerly known as KeepTruckin, is a technology company founded in 2013 that develops integrated hardware and software solutions for businesses in the physical economy. This includes sectors such as trucking, construction, agriculture, field service, manufacturing, and energy. The company began with a focus on electronic logbooks for truck drivers and has since expanded to offer a comprehensive platform that connects vehicles, equipment, and facilities to the cloud using proprietary IoT hardware and AI-powered applications.

Motive serves over 120,000 businesses globally, managing data for more than 700,000 vehicles and assets. Their product offerings include rugged IoT devices for real-time data streaming and AI applications for fleet management, driver safety, compliance, dispatch, maintenance, and sustainability. The company emphasizes strong customer support, providing dedicated teams for professional services and 24/7 technical assistance. With a commitment to improving safety, efficiency, and sustainability, Motive continues to enhance operations across various industries.

Short Description:
Movex Innovation Inc. is a UK-based manufacturer that specializes in ultra-compact, remote-controlled electric material handling equipment. Their products are designed for challenging environments, including stairs, confined spaces, and rugged terrains. The company focuses on creating innovative and ergonomic solutions that enhance safety and efficiency in various industries such as construction, mining, railways, restoration, and utilities.

The product lineup includes stair climbers and stair crawlers for safely transporting heavy loads, all-terrain carriers for navigating rough surfaces, and mini loaders tailored for confined spaces. Movex Innovation emphasizes operator safety and environmental sustainability, as their equipment is carbon-free and electrically powered. With a mission to reduce manual handling injuries and improve productivity, Movex serves sectors that require effective solutions for heavy or awkward material handling.

Short Description:
Olmet Italy is a specialized company founded in 1961, focusing on the design and manufacture of custom-made machinery and industrial plants for precast concrete production. Recognized as a world leader in this niche, Olmet Italy provides advanced technological solutions that are fully automatic and tailored for various scales of industrial production.

The company offers a wide range of products, including formworks and machinery for creating concrete elements such as columns, walls, floors, prestressed elements, box culverts, 3D monolithic elements, and stairs. They also produce specialized equipment like tilting tables, long lines, vertical battery systems, and carousel plants, all adhering to high quality and safety standards in the construction industry. 

With a large manufacturing facility, Olmet Italy is equipped for comprehensive material processing and production. The company collaborates closely with clients in the civil, industrial, and infrastructure construction sectors, often partnering with prominent Italian architecture and engineering firms to deliver tailored precast concrete solutions.

PERI USA is the American subsidiary of PERI, a family-owned company established in 1969 in Germany. The company specializes in designing, manufacturing, and supplying formwork and scaffolding systems for the construction industry, catering to building, civil engineering, and industrial sectors globally.

The product range includes engineered formwork systems for concrete construction, industrial scaffolding solutions, and various accessories aimed at enhancing construction efficiency, speed, and safety. PERI USA supports complex construction projects by providing tailored equipment and expert services to contractors, builders, engineers, and architects. The company values reliability, customer service, innovation, and sustainability, and operates as part of a global network with over 60 subsidiaries and 120 logistics centers, employing around 9,500 people.

Short Description:
Peterbilt Motors Company is a prominent American manufacturer of medium- and heavy-duty trucks, founded in 1939 by T.A. "Al" Peterman. Initially focused on trucks for the logging industry, the company quickly shifted to producing vehicles for highway freight transport, earning a reputation for durable and high-quality trucks with unique styling. Peterbilt has a rich history, including contributions to the military during World War II with the production of reliable trucks.

The company offers a diverse range of trucks suitable for various applications, including long-haul freight, regional hauling, construction, and vocational uses. Their lineup features models known for durability, advanced engineering, and driver comfort, such as the long-production Model 351 and innovative designs like the lightweight aluminum cab. Peterbilt serves a wide customer base, including long-haul trucking companies, regional freight operators, and construction firms, providing premium vehicles tailored to meet the needs of professional drivers and fleet operators.

Polycoat Products is a family-owned company based in Santa Fe Springs, California, and is a division of American Polymers. Established in 1979, it has become the largest family-owned polyurethane system house in the United States, featuring over 1 million square feet of manufacturing and distribution facilities across the country.

The company specializes in high-performance protective coatings, including polyurethanes, polyureas, and hybrid chemistries, designed for waterproofing and protection in various environments. Polycoat Products serves the construction and waterproofing sectors, offering solutions for vehicular parking decks, pedestrian decks, and below-grade membranes. Their product range includes proprietary systems and elastomeric deck coatings with fire ratings, applied through various methods such as spray and roller.

Polycoat Products emphasizes innovation and quality, maintaining ISO 9001:2015 compliance and focusing on research and development. They are committed to delivering customized, high-performance solutions that enhance the durability of infrastructure and industrial assets while fostering long-term customer relationships.

Short Description:
Polymer Nation is a chemical company focused on the development of cutting-edge coating technology for the industrial coatings, lining and flooring marketplace.

While the Polymer Nation company may be new, its' founders and employees are not. With over 100 years of experience in our leadership ranks, we believe we have assembled one of the strongest teams in the coatings marketplace.

Polymer Nation manufactures a comprehensive line of state-of-the-art coatings for the concrete flooring industry exhibiting outstanding technical performance while respecting very strict environmental guidelines.

Polymer Nation invests significantly in R&D to offer the best technologies available in the marketplace. We also provide an unmatched level of service and technical support to our clients.

Polymer Nation focuses on providing world-class quality products at very competitive prices. Most of our product lines contain virtually no VOCs, making them suitable for green projects such as LEED.

Short Description:
Putzmeister America, Inc. is the North American division of Putzmeister Concrete Pumps GmbH, a well-known manufacturer of concrete and material placing equipment for the construction industry. Established in 1982, Putzmeister America has expanded its offerings significantly since acquiring Thomsen, Inc., a leading boom pump manufacturer.

The company provides a wide range of products, including truck-mounted boom pumps, trailer pumps, placing booms, shotcrete equipment, mortar machines, industrial pumps, and mining and tunneling equipment. They also offer water technology solutions and Telebelt telescopic belt conveyors for efficient material handling. Putzmeister America has contributed to major projects like the Hoover Dam Bypass and the Panama Canal Third Set of Locks, showcasing their equipment's reliability and performance in critical situations. Their clientele spans various sectors, including construction, mining, and tunneling, ensuring comprehensive support through a network of distributors and dealers.

Short Description:
Ripik.AI is a global industrial-AI SaaS startup founded in 2021, focused on applied artificial intelligence solutions for manufacturing. The company specializes in automating and optimizing decision-making processes in industries such as steel, cement, chemicals, pharmaceuticals, and FMCG. With a team of around 45-50 experts, including alumni from Google and MIT, Ripik.AI is led by Founder & CEO Pinak Dattaray and is backed by Accel and Y Combinator.

The company offers a range of products, including its Vision AI Platform, which deploys automated computer vision systems for real-time anomaly detection and monitoring. Other offerings include Ripik Vision for insights into manufacturing operations, Ripik Optimus for process efficiency, and Ripik Maintenance for predictive maintenance. Short Description:
Scanreco Group is a global leader in developing and supplying professional radio remote control systems for crane and heavy machinery manufacturers. Founded in 1984 in Södertälje, Sweden, the company has expanded into a multinational organization with offices and production facilities in several countries, including the USA, Canada, Germany, and Spain.

The company designs and manufactures rugged and user-friendly radio remote control systems tailored for various industries such as construction, forestry, mining, and agriculture. Their product portfolio features advanced transmitters and receivers that enhance safety and efficiency by allowing operators to control machinery from a distance. Scanreco emphasizes technological innovation, reliability, and ergonomic design, ensuring their systems are durable and easy to use in demanding environments. With a strong engineering culture and over 300 employees, Scanreco continues to serve a broad international customer base, including leading manufacturers like Palfinger and Hiab/Cargotec.

Skillit is a technology company based in New York, founded in 2021. It specializes in a data-driven recruiting platform tailored for the construction industry. The company aims to address the skilled labor shortage by connecting skilled tradespeople with construction companies through an AI-powered hiring platform designed by tradespeople for tradespeople.

Skillit offers an end-to-end recruiting platform that enhances recruitment and retention for leading contractors. Key features include a comprehensive craft labor marketplace, powerful search filters, data-rich worker profiles, and proprietary craft skill assessments. The platform adds around 2,000 new workers weekly and utilizes AI tools to optimize hiring processes. Skillit is trusted by top contractors in the civil, commercial, and industrial sectors, focusing on elevating skilled trades as respected and well-compensated careers.

Short Description:
Tremco Commercial Sealants & Waterproofing is a global supplier specializing in sealants, waterproofing, weatherproofing, and passive fire control solutions for the construction and restoration industries. Founded in 1928 in Cleveland, Ohio, the company is part of the Tremco Construction Products Group and is headquartered in Beachwood, Ohio. Tremco operates multiple facilities across North America and collaborates with international partners to deliver high-performance building envelope products and services.

The company offers a diverse range of products, including high-performance sealants, air barrier systems, waterproofing membranes, traffic coatings, and glazing system components. These products are designed for various applications, from new construction to restoration projects, and cater to a wide customer base, including architects, contractors, and building owners. Tremco is committed to sustainability and energy efficiency, ensuring that its products minimize life-cycle costs for buildings. The company maintains high standards in product quality and service, with its Quality Management System certified to ISO 9001 across its North American facilities.

Short Description:
White Cap is a prominent manufacturer and distributor of vacuum closures, with a history that dates back to 1926. Founded in Chicago by William P. White and his brothers, the company started as a family business and introduced the innovative "Side-seal" pry-off closure, which improved upon traditional screw tops. This product quickly gained popularity, particularly with early clients like Reid, Murdoch & Co.

The company made significant advancements in the food packaging industry with its "Vapor Vacuum®" high-speed sealing process, developed in 1929, which allowed for sealing at impressive speeds. White Cap's product offerings include vacuum closures that ensure airtight sealing for food packaging, side-seal pry-off caps, and lid-flippers co-developed with H.J. Heinz. The company serves a diverse customer base, primarily food packers and distributors, and has established itself as a global leader in the vacuum closure market, producing billions of closures annually.

Short Description:
Xtreme Manufacturing, LLC is a North American manufacturer based in Las Vegas, Nevada, specializing in heavy equipment, particularly high-capacity telehandlers and lifting machinery. Founded in 2003, the company has established itself as a leader in the industry, offering the largest range of telehandlers in North America, with 16 models that have lifting capacities from 5,900 lbs to 70,000 lbs. All products are built in North America and come with an industry-leading warranty program.

The company’s product portfolio includes a variety of rough terrain telescopic handlers, the Xtreme Cube modular building system, and additional equipment such as lift trucks, trailers, and accessories. Xtreme Manufacturing primarily serves the construction, industrial, and material handling sectors, focusing on delivering reliable and high-performance equipment. In 2013, the company became the majority shareholder in Snorkel, a global aerial work platform manufacturer, further expanding its product offerings and international reach.

Antraquip Corporation, founded in 1985 and based in Hagerstown, Maryland, is a leading manufacturer of specialized machinery for the tunneling, mining, and construction industries. With over 40 years of experience, the company is known for its innovative engineering and custom solutions for rock excavation and concrete demolition.

Antraquip's core products include hydraulic cutters for cutting rock and concrete, roadheaders designed for versatile excavation, tunnel support systems for enhanced safety, and rotary drum cutting attachments. Short Description:
Autodesk, Inc. is a global software company founded in January 1982 in Sausalito, California. It is known for its pioneering work in design automation, particularly through its flagship product, AutoCAD, which made computer-aided design (CAD) accessible on personal computers. The company has expanded its offerings to include a diverse range of software products for various industries, including architecture, engineering, construction, manufacturing, and media.

Headquartered in Sausalito, Autodesk operates worldwide with offices in multiple countries. Its product portfolio includes AutoCAD for 2D and 3D design, Revit for Building Information Modeling (BIM), Inventor for mechanical design, and Maya and 3ds Max for 3D modeling and animation. Autodesk also emphasizes cloud-based solutions with tools like Fusion 360 and Autodesk Construction Cloud, supporting modern workflows and collaboration. The company serves a wide array of customers, including professionals in design and engineering, manufacturing, and education, reflecting its commitment to empowering innovators and enhancing creativity and efficiency in design processes.

Short Description:
Brigade Electronics Group Plc is a UK-based public limited company that specializes in designing, manufacturing, and supplying vehicle safety systems for commercial vehicles and mobile machinery. Founded in 1976 and headquartered in South Darenth, Kent, the company employs over 250 people and generates annual revenues exceeding £54 million. Brigade Electronics is committed to preventing collisions and enhancing safety for drivers, groundworkers, pedestrians, and cyclists.

The company offers a wide range of safety products, including high-quality camera systems that provide live feeds to drivers, advanced detection sensors, and robust alarm systems. These solutions are designed to improve visibility and awareness for commercial vehicle operators across various industries, such as logistics, construction, and mobile machinery. Brigade Electronics emphasizes a customer-centric approach and fosters a culture of innovation and teamwork, aiming to continuously improve safety technologies and outcomes.

Cardoza Waste Parts Nation specializes in providing tailored product solutions for the waste management industry. They work closely with inventors and niche suppliers to develop innovative offerings that enhance operational efficiency and safety in waste handling.

Their product range includes rolling lid systems for roll-off containers, Gorilla Diapers™, USA-made wheel poly-o casters, container dogs, front load dumpster lock bars, baler wear parts, and cardboard event boxes. Many of their products are manufactured in the USA, emphasizing quality and durability. Cardoza Waste Parts Nation primarily serves commercial waste industry customers, focusing on delivering practical and efficient waste container solutions.

The company actively participates in major industry trade shows, showcasing its commitment to the waste management community. Their engagement in events like Waste Expo and ReMA highlights their dedication to innovation and collaboration within the sector.

Cemco is the premiere leader in mobile concrete batching and mixing equipment, Cemco Inc. offers products focused on helping contractors improve profitability by using self-contained, self-erecting, and modular mobile equipment.

Short Description:
ClearSpan Structures includes two distinct companies with unique offerings. 

Clear Span Structures, LLC, based in Florida, has over 33 years of experience in commercial and residential construction. Led by President Glen Blount, the company employs a small team with a combined experience of over 200 years. They focus on delivering high-quality construction projects, including notable buildings like the Cruzan Amphitheater and Christ Fellowship Church. Their clientele includes a variety of commercial, industrial, and community clients such as golf clubs, churches, and universities.

ClearSpan Fabric Structures Inc, located in Connecticut, specializes in energy-efficient fabric buildings. With a workforce of 100 to 249 employees, the company designs and builds structures like riding arenas and warehouses. Their products are engineered for durability and sustainability, capable of withstanding extreme weather conditions. Their customers typically come from sectors that require large, flexible building solutions, including agriculture and industrial storage.

Short Description:
Eco Material Technologies is a leading producer and supplier of sustainable cement alternatives in North America. The company specializes in transforming industrial waste into environmentally friendly substitutes for traditional cement products. Formed in February 2022 from the merger of Boral Resources and Green Cement Inc., Eco Material combines extensive experience in the supplementary cementitious materials (SCMs) industry.

The company utilizes proprietary Green Cement technology to create near-zero-carbon cement alternatives using fly ash and other pozzolanic materials. These sustainable substitutes typically replace about 20% of portland cement in concrete mixes, resulting in stronger and more economical concrete. Eco Material is the largest marketer and distributor of fly ash in the U.S., recycling approximately 10 million tons of material annually from over 100 sites across 45 states. Additionally, the company offers utility services, including operations support and environmental remediation, and operates a materials research laboratory in Atlanta to support its operations. Eco Material Technologies is committed to reducing carbon emissions in the cement and concrete industry. Its headquarters is in South Jordan, Utah.

Short Description:
We hereby would like to introduce our company ‘Ersoylar Metal' headquartered in Mersin, Turkey and operating since 1992. The company has been active in the steel production sector manufacturing mainly welded wire mesh, cold drawn bars & coils. With our 3 established factories in Osmaniye, Karabük and Trabzon, we have over 100 employees and the total production capacity of our company has reached 150,000 metric tons/year, which makes ‘Ersoylar Metal' the leading welded wire mesh manufacturer in Turkey. Currently, the company is also involved in the international investment project, which will enable us to start operations abroad.
Apart from manufacturing sector, the company is also dealing with the trade of cement and steel products, like: reinforcement steel bars, structural steel, hollow tubes, plates, profiles and many others, supplying leading Turkish and foreign construction companies doing business in Turkey and abroad. 
We have provided significant volumes of cement to many major projects all around the world, including Egypt, Libya and west Africa, Iran , Iraq, Turkmenistan, Georgia, Azerbaijan , Pakistan, Tunisia, Mauritania, Panama, Venezuela, Jordan, St.Vincent, St.Lucia, Gabon and Angola. 
    Ersoylar Metal is one of the main cement suppliers to Libya for local construction companies, traders and many international contractors. Our total cement export volume has exceeded 300.000 mts and 60 vessels.

FJDynamics is a global robotics company founded in 2017 and headquartered in China. The company specializes in digitalization, automation, and new energy technologies, focusing on transforming labor-intensive industries. FJDynamics develops autonomous solutions that are widely used in agriculture, forestry, landscaping, construction, surveying, and facility services. Their technology aims to improve productivity and support carbon neutrality goals.

With R&D and operations centers in over 10 regions worldwide, including Singapore, the U.S., Sweden, and Hong Kong, FJDynamics demonstrates a strong commitment to innovation. The company employs a large team, with over 60% dedicated to research and development, and holds more than 800 invention patents. FJDynamics collaborates with various partners and clients to promote sustainable practices and enhance operational efficiency.

The product portfolio includes a range of autonomous robots and digital solutions designed to simplify workflows and reduce labor intensity in various sectors. FJDynamics focuses on partnerships to expand its impact and drive digital transformation in traditional industries.

Short Description:
Gardex is a leading manufacturer of hand and striking tools, established in 1997. The company focuses on innovation, quality, and cost-efficiency, providing custom tool manufacturing services to OEMs, big-box retailers, and private label brands in 64 countries. Their product range includes hammers, axes, chisels, prying tools, and professional-grade industrial tools, catering to both DIY enthusiasts and trade professionals.

With a workforce of 1,500 employees and five manufacturing facilities spanning 750,000 square feet, Gardex emphasizes high standards of ethics and social responsibility. Their manufacturing capabilities include forging, hardening, surface finishing, and packaging, allowing them to produce high-quality tools with excellent design. The company also manages multiple brands, including Gardex, Filex, Ashva, and Rockforge, and is committed to delivering value through reduced production costs and efficient operations.

Short Description:
impact.com is a global partnership management platform founded in 2008 and based in Santa Barbara, California. The company specializes in helping enterprises manage, optimize, and scale various types of partnerships, including affiliate marketing, influencers, and B2B collaborations. Their technology platform automates partnership workflows, tracks performance, and provides insights to enhance revenue growth and operational efficiency.

The services offered by impact.com include partnership automation, performance marketing, data and analytics, and a marketplace for discovering new partners. Their platform supports businesses in navigating the partnership economy, focusing on authentic connections and community-driven marketing. Major brands like Walmart, Uber, and Shopify utilize impact.com’s solutions to drive significant revenue growth, with the company reporting over $100 billion in annualized sales from partner referrals.

impact.com is dedicated to innovation and customer success, fostering a culture of agility and continuous improvement to meet the evolving needs of its clients.

Short Description:
Kenworth Truck Company is a prominent American manufacturer of medium and heavy-duty trucks, established in 1923 and based in Seattle, Washington. The company was formed from the names of its founders, Harry Kent and Edgar K. Worthington, who aimed to create rugged trucks for the challenging conditions faced by Pacific Northwest loggers. Over its century-long history, Kenworth has gained a reputation for innovation, quality, and customization, producing over a million trucks across various models, including super heavy-duty options like the C500 6x6.

Kenworth offers a wide range of trucks, from Class 5 to Class 8, including specialized models such as the W900 and K100 series, which are known for their performance in construction and mining. The company is also committed to sustainability, producing battery electric vehicles for medium and heavy-duty applications. With a strong focus on customization, Kenworth tailors its trucks to meet specific customer needs and supports them through a network of dealerships and service centers, ensuring operational efficiency and reliability across various industries, including logging, construction, mining, and freight transport.

Short Description:
Little Giant Ladder Systems is an American company based in Springville, Utah, founded in 1972. It is a leader in ladder safety and innovation, holding over 270 patents for ladder design and functionality. The company began when Harold "Hal" Wing improved a German painter's ladder prototype, resulting in the versatile Little Giant Ladder System®, which can be configured into 24 different positions, including straight, extension, A-frame, and scaffolding.

The core product, the Little Giant Ladder System®, is known for its strength and safety features. It includes flared legs for stability, adjustable heights with locking side rails, trapezoidal rungs for a secure standing surface, and "tip-n-glide" wheels for easy movement. Little Giant Ladder Systems is committed to reducing ladder-related injuries through innovative design and user feedback, aiming to lower on-site injuries significantly. The company serves a wide range of customers, including professional tradespeople, DIY homeowners, and industrial clients, and markets its products in over 40 countries.

Short Description:
Makita U.S.A., Inc. is the American subsidiary of Makita Corporation, a leading manufacturer of power tools and accessories. Established in 1984, the company operates a manufacturing and assembly plant in Buford, Georgia, as part of a global network of facilities. Makita has a rich history, beginning in 1915 in Japan as an electric motor sales and repair company and evolving into a pioneer of portable electric power tools.

The company offers a wide range of professional-grade power tools, including cordless drills, saws, grinders, and outdoor equipment. Known for its innovation in battery technology, Makita introduced the first rechargeable power tools in the late 1960s and continues to develop advanced cordless tool lines, such as the 40V MAX XGT series. Makita products are designed for durability and performance, catering to the needs of professional contractors and tradespeople. The company also emphasizes product development aligned with user needs, supported by strong research and development capabilities.

Short Description:
Malta Dynamics is a manufacturing company located in Malta, Ohio, specializing in fall protection solutions and safety equipment for the general industry and construction sectors. Founded in 2015 by Damian Lang, the company is dedicated to enhancing worker safety, particularly for those working at heights, to minimize injuries and fatalities from falls.

The company designs, engineers, and manufactures a range of products, including harnesses, lanyards, anchors, and lifelines, all engineered to meet or exceed OSHA and ANSI safety standards. Malta Dynamics also provides custom-engineered solutions and equipment rental services. With a focus on protecting workers in various industries, the company has expanded its reach internationally, partnering with Flexra Safety in the United Arab Emirates to distribute its products globally.

Malta Dynamics aims to be the preferred supplier of fall protection equipment and a leader in mobile fall arrest systems, emphasizing quality, safety, and strong customer partnerships. It is part of the EZG Group, which has extensive experience in the construction industry.

Short Description:
Martin Engineering is a global leader in bulk material handling solutions, founded in 1944. The company began with the invention of the Vibrolator, a compact ball vibrator that improved safety and productivity in manufacturing. With over 80 years of experience, Martin Engineering is committed to innovation and engineering excellence in this field.

Operating in 18 countries across six continents, Martin Engineering provides a wide range of products and services aimed at enhancing safety, efficiency, and profitability in bulk material handling operations. Their offerings include industrial vibrators, conveyor belt cleaners, dust control systems, and various engineered solutions that address challenges like material buildup and spillage. The company serves a diverse array of industries, focusing on tailored solutions that protect workers and optimize operational costs.

Led by CEO Edwin H. Peterson, who has been with the company since 1948, Martin Engineering emphasizes research and development, customer service, and global expansion as key components of its success.

Short Description:
Medtrade is a UK-based biotechnology company founded in 1999 and headquartered in Crewe. Led by CEO Russ Mably, the company focuses on transforming global healthcare through innovative medical solutions. Medtrade specializes in areas such as women's health, wound care, trauma, and haemostasis. It is particularly known for its CELOX haemostatic products, which have delivered over one million units to frontline medics in Ukraine, addressing critical healthcare challenges like bleeding control and infection prevention.

In the United States, Medtrade refers to a prominent trade show and conference for the Durable Medical Equipment, Prosthetics, Orthotics, and Supplies (DMEPOS) industry. Established in 1979, this annual event is organized by Emerald Expositions and takes place in Dallas, TX. It features a large expo floor with hundreds of manufacturers and thousands of providers showcasing various medical products. The conference also offers educational sessions on legislative and regulatory strategies for home medical equipment providers, attracting around 7,000 attendees and 500 exhibitors each year.

Short Description:
Meridian Manufacturing Inc. is a prominent North American manufacturer focused on bulk storage and material handling solutions for the agriculture, industrial, and energy sectors. With over 60 years of experience, the company designs and builds reliable equipment known for its performance and value.

Headquartered in Alberta, Canada, and a division of WGI Westman Group Inc., Meridian operates manufacturing, sales, and distribution facilities across North America. The company employs around 1,000 people and generates approximately $310 million in revenue. Its product offerings include SmoothWall bins, conveyors and augers, liquid storage tanks, seed tenders, and tailored industrial solutions. Meridian also provides specialized equipment for the energy sector, such as sand silos and secondary containment systems.

Meridian Manufacturing has a strong reputation for innovation and growth, supported by strategic acquisitions that enhance its manufacturing capabilities and expertise. Short Description:
MULTI SEAL is the world leader in superior tire sealant technology.  

Our goal is simple: To enhance driver safety, protect equipment and save you money.

MULTI SEAL protects your fleet with our 21st century sealant formula backed by decades of rigorous scientific testing. Since 1981 MULTI SEAL has been developing and manufacturing high performance tire sealants scientifically formulated to virtually eliminate air loss due to punctures and slow leaks. Our tire sealants prevent up to 95% of tire failures from punctures and underinflation keeping your trucks rolling safely, on or off-road.

One easy application of MULTI SEAL extends your tire tread life by 20% and saves you money on expensive tire replacement. Get the superior, scientific tire sealant and save on new tires down the road.

Short Description:
Noregon Systems is a prominent company based in Greensboro, North Carolina, specializing in diagnostic tools, software, and services for heavy-duty commercial vehicles and equipment. Founded in 1993, Noregon has over 30 years of experience in vehicle data, focusing on enhancing vehicle health, diagnostics, and repair processes.

The company offers a range of products, including the JPRO Commercial Vehicle Diagnostics software and the TechPRO® VDS1000HD diagnostic tool. Noregon also provides remote diagnostic technology through TripVision®, which allows for real-time vehicle health monitoring. Their services extend to diagnostic tool management, data analytics, and shop management solutions like ShopPulse, which streamline repair workflows. Additionally, Noregon is committed to education and training, offering programs to advance technician skills.

Noregon serves a diverse clientele, including large commercial fleets, service centers, municipalities, and various industry sectors such as oil, gas, and construction. With over 16 million JPRO connections and more than 2 million vehicles connected via TripVision, Noregon is recognized for its innovative solutions that enhance the performance and efficiency of the commercial vehicle ecosystem.

Short Description:
Poly-America, LP is a prominent manufacturer and recycler in the polyethylene plastics industry, established in 1976 and based in Grand Prairie, Texas. The company is recognized as the world's largest producer of polyethylene construction film and a leading manufacturer of commercial trash bags in the United States. It also stands out as the largest recycler and compounder of polyethylene globally.

The company offers a wide range of products, including barrier films, agricultural films, shrink films, and its well-known Husky brand of trash bags. These products cater to various markets such as construction, agriculture, and waste management. Poly-America operates multiple manufacturing and service locations across the U.S., enhancing its ability to serve a national customer base efficiently. The company is committed to innovation, holding over 10 patents related to its products, and is focused on continuous improvement and customer satisfaction.

Raken is a construction management software company based in Carlsbad, California, founded in 2012. The company specializes in cloud-based, mobile-first solutions that streamline field workflows for the construction industry. Raken's mission is to empower construction companies of all sizes by providing intuitive software tools that enhance communication, data collection, and project visibility.

Raken offers a comprehensive suite of tools accessible via web and mobile apps, including daily progress reporting, time tracking, safety management, production tracking, and labor management. These features create a digital toolbox that connects field teams with office staff, improving productivity and compliance. Raken serves a diverse customer base, including general contractors and subcontractors, supporting various project types and workflows. The company promotes a culture of innovation and customer empathy, focusing on continuous improvement and employee growth.

Safety Vision is a Houston, Texas-based company with over 30 years of experience in mobile video surveillance and fleet management solutions. Founded in 1993, it has established itself as a leading provider of advanced video capture and management systems for various fleet operations, including mass transit, commercial trucking, public safety, and school transportation.

The company designs and manufactures a wide range of hardware and software products that support video recording, live viewing, real-time GPS mapping, vehicle performance monitoring, driver behavior analysis, and passenger counting. Safety Vision emphasizes innovation and quality, employing a dedicated team of engineers to ensure reliable technology in its solutions. Their offerings include mobile video surveillance systems that integrate with security platforms, enhancing security management for fleet operators.

Safety Vision serves over 3,000 clients across the United States, including public transit agencies, commercial fleet operators, school districts, and public safety organizations. Their solutions have been deployed in projects worth over a billion dollars, showcasing their significant market presence and trusted reputation.

Short Description:
setcom wireless products GmbH was a supplier of wireless device application test solutions, founded in Munich, Germany. The company initially focused on 2G and 2.5G protocol test solutions and supplying test scripts and software to leading test equipment manufacturers. setcom developed to become a global test equipment provider and a recognised leader in LTE-IMS and 3G application testing for chipset and handset manufacturers.

In April 2015, the trade and assets of setcom were acquired by Anite, a leading provider of mobile device, infrastructure and network testing systems to the international wireless market. The product portfolio continues under the Anite brand, including setcom's market-leading application test solution, S-CORE.

Short Description:
Trusted by Pros. Made for Everyone.
Seymour is the brand of choice for pros and DIYers who demand excellence on the first coat. We consistently deliver unsurpassed quality, selection, and value through a comprehensive line of premium products that is trusted around the world.

Seymour paints are used every day across the nation to keep our communities beautiful and our lives colorful. Our paints are used on roads and highways to keep us safe; they are applied to athletic fields on which our children play; they are used on our cars and in our homes, even on farms and industrial equipment. 

As the inventor of aerosol paint, our company's founder, Ed Seymour, spawned a global industry and changed the way the world paints. We are proud of our heritage of ingenuity and our standing as the largest family-owned and privately held aerosol paint manufacturer in the United States.

Today, Seymour is an industry leader that continues to enhance people's lives throughout the country and across the globe. Our legacy of innovation endures with a diverse line of premium paints, spray paints, coatings, and chemicals. Whether at home, in the garage, or on the job site, the world turns to Seymour for the jobs that matter most.

Short Description:
Siplast is a prominent manufacturer specializing in advanced commercial roofing, waterproofing, and building enclosure systems. Established in the late 1960s and now part of Standard Industries, the company has over 50 years of experience and is known for developing SBS-modified bitumen membranes, a significant advancement in roofing technology.

The company offers a wide range of products, including modified bitumen roofing membranes, waterproofing systems like the Teranap geomembrane, liquid-applied roofing products, lightweight insulating concrete, and Eco-Activ depolluting roofing granules. Siplast is committed to quality, providing a Certificate of Analysis for each production run and a ten-year labor and material guarantee against leaks on approved projects. 

Headquartered in Irving, Texas, Siplast serves commercial building owners, architects, contractors, and municipalities. The company has been involved in notable projects such as the renovation of the Seattle Space Needle observation deck and the California Aqueduct. With a focus on innovation and customer service, Siplast continues to lead in the roofing and waterproofing industry.

Somero Enterprises is a global leader in designing and selling advanced concrete leveling and placing equipment. Since pioneering the Laser Screed® machine market in 1986, the company has expanded its product range to over 20 models, including Boomed Screeds, Ride-ons, and 3D Profilers. Their equipment is essential for creating smooth, flat concrete surfaces in various commercial construction projects, such as warehouses, hospitals, and retail centers.

With a strong presence in over 90 countries, Somero serves a diverse customer base, including major companies like Costco, Amazon, and Tesla. The company maintains long-standing relationships with clients through direct sales and a network of representatives and dealers, offering comprehensive service and support. Headquartered in Fort Myers, Florida, Somero employs over 200 people and has demonstrated strong financial performance, generating annual revenues exceeding $120 million. Their commitment to quality and innovation positions them as a market leader in the concrete placement industry.

At Strong Manufacturing, we strive to design and build the ideal solution for each of our customers needs.  Whether you need a mixer compact enough to fit in the bed of a small pickup, or a self contained machine to mix and pump 100 yards per hour. Short Description:
Superlegal is an AI-powered contract review platform designed for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs). It enables efficient management and negotiation of legal contracts without the need for an in-house legal team or external counsel. As the only AI licensed to practice law in the USA, Superlegal combines advanced artificial intelligence with lawyer verification to provide accurate and cost-effective contract reviews.

The platform automates the review of various commercial contracts, including NDAs, MSAs, and service agreements. It leverages a human-in-the-loop approach, where AI-generated reviews are vetted by expert attorneys, ensuring reliable results typically delivered within 24 hours. Superlegal helps businesses reduce legal costs by up to 90% and shorten deal cycle times by up to 70%, allowing them to close deals faster.

Superlegal serves diverse industries, including construction, technology, and healthcare. It simplifies complex contracts, streamlines negotiations, and ensures compliance with regulations, all while maintaining data security. The platform is particularly beneficial for SMBs facing high contract volumes, making it a preferred choice for optimizing legal processes.

Tenax Corporation is an international manufacturer and distributor based in Baltimore, Maryland, specializing in polymer extrusion products. The company operates manufacturing facilities in Baltimore, Evergreen, Alabama, and Modesto, California, employing over 100 people in the U.S. 

Tenax offers a diverse range of specialty plastic products for civil, environmental, commercial, industrial, and agricultural markets. Their product lineup includes various fencing solutions, barrier protections, wildlife containment netting, plant trellis supports, privacy screening products, and geosynthetic materials for geotechnical applications. The company serves multiple sectors, including waste management, construction, agriculture, and aquaculture, focusing on innovative solutions tailored to customer needs.

Committed to environmental responsibility, Tenax manufactures its products using 100% virgin materials, ensuring safety for employees and customers. With a significant production and warehousing space of approximately 564,000 square feet in the U.S., Tenax Corporation emphasizes quality and innovation in its operations.

Short Description:
TOPWERK GROUP is a leading full-service provider of machinery and systems for the industrial production of concrete products. Founded in 2013 and based in Germany, the company employs over 1,100 people and generates an annual turnover of approximately EUR 260 million. It operates globally, with a strong presence in Europe, North America, South America, Asia, and the Middle East.

The company specializes in offering highly automated and innovative machinery that covers the entire production process for the concrete and building materials industry. Its product range includes concrete block machines, mixers, conveyor lines, tile presses, and specialized equipment for precast concrete industries. TOPWERK GROUP is known for its integrated solutions that combine production, handling, and finishing of concrete products, supported by its acquisitions of several renowned companies. The management team is led by CEO Robert Gruss, and the company is backed by the investment fund CGS III.

Short Description:
Utest Material Testing Equipment is a prominent manufacturer and supplier of testing equipment for construction materials, based in Türkiye. Established in 2004, the company has become a trusted global brand known for its high-quality and reliable products. Utest operates from a large production facility in Ankara and employs over 160 qualified experts. It has branch offices in Florida, London, and India, providing sales support and technical assistance to customers worldwide.

Utest specializes in a wide range of testing machines and equipment, including soil, aggregate, cement, concrete, asphalt, and rock testing devices, as well as universal testing machines and custom test devices. All products meet international quality standards, reflecting the company's commitment to excellence. Utest serves a diverse clientele, including construction companies, material testing laboratories, and quality control departments, ensuring comprehensive after-sales service and technical support. The company exports to over 80 countries, reinforcing its position as one of the leading manufacturers in the material testing equipment sector.

Short Description:
Viaflex is a South Dakota-based company that develops and manufactures high-performance polymer films and sheeting solutions. Established as an independent entity in April 2022, Viaflex originated from Raven Industries in the 1950s. The company focuses on creating thinner, lighter, and stronger polymer products that address complex containment and protection challenges across various industries, including agriculture, construction, energy, waste management, and environmental protection.

Their product range includes flexible films, covers, liners, and caps designed for critical applications that protect ecosystems and customer assets while promoting sustainability. Viaflex offers custom-made solutions tailored to meet specific client needs, integrating sustainable design practices for long-term performance. The company emphasizes a customer-centric approach, collaborating closely with clients to develop innovative solutions. Headquartered in Sioux Falls, South Dakota, Viaflex employs around 450 people and reported revenues of approximately $122 million.

WASA AG is a German company with over 60 years of experience in producing high-quality production boards. Headquartered in Darmstadt, with production facilities in Neubrunn, WASA AG is recognized as a world market leader in this field. The company specializes in boards made from wood, wood-plastic composites, and solid plastic reinforced with glass fiber, catering to concrete factories and precast industries globally.

WASA AG's product range includes wood boards, wood-plastic composite boards, and solid plastic boards, such as the patented WASA UNIPLAST® ULTRA. They also offer WETCAST molds for precast concrete applications and specialized boards like WASA WOODPLAST®. The company focuses on delivering tailored solutions, including large-sized molds for significant projects and durable wear parts, ensuring optimal performance in demanding environments. With a commitment to innovation and sustainability, WASA AG continues to expand its capabilities and product offerings to meet the evolving needs of its customers.

Short Description:
Wooster Products is a USA Manufacturer of anti-slip safety stair and walkway products. We manufacture products for any size project. In operation since 1921; our work includes transit stations, stadiums, schools, parks and residential and office towers.  All of our product lines ensure excellent protection from liability from slips, trips, and falls. 

Our brand names include:
•       Supergrit® a heat-treated, corrosion resistant, extruded aluminum base with satin/lacquered finish.  The use of diamond-hard aluminum oxide in the filler assures long tread life.
•       Spectra® a high content of aluminum oxide abrasive grit for long life and lasting beauty.  Safety surface has easy maintenance features. 	
•	Stairmaster®  is a renovation and safety enhancement product for heavy pedestrian traffic.
•	Walk-A-Sured® is water Clear Epoxy floor coating designed for use on wood, metal, tile, marble, terrazzo and concrete.
•	WP-70® is a heavy-duty two-part epoxy coating for a long-lasting, anti-slip durable solution.
 •	FlexTred® is our anti-slip tape used for stairs, walkways, ramps and more.

Please contact us at woosterproducts.com | 800-321-4936

Short Description:
Zenni Optical is an American online retailer based in Novato, California, specializing in affordable prescription glasses, sunglasses, and contact lenses. Founded in 2003 by Tibor Laczay and Julia Zhen, Zenni has established itself as a significant player in the eyewear market by utilizing a vertically integrated business model. This approach allows the company to manufacture its own frames in a facility near Shanghai, China, enabling it to offer glasses at very low prices, sometimes starting as low as $7.

Zenni offers a diverse range of products, including over 2,000 types of prescription glasses and sunglasses, along with 45 types of contact lenses. The company also features themed collaborations with notable figures, appealing to a wide audience that includes budget-conscious consumers, first-time online buyers, and fashion-forward individuals. Zenni has embraced digital marketing strategies and innovative technologies, such as augmented reality try-ons, to enhance its online presence and customer experience, solidifying its reputation for affordability and variety in the eyewear industry.

Short Description:
Zonar Systems, founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, Washington, specializes in smart fleet management and mobility solutions. The company focuses on enhancing safety, efficiency, compliance, and asset utilization for various fleet types, including vocational, pupil transportation, mass transit, commercial trucking, construction, utility, mining, and quarry sectors.

Zonar is known for its Electronic Vehicle Inspection Report (EVIR®) system, the first electronically verified tool for vehicle inspections. Its product offerings include cloud-based fleet and asset management solutions, maintenance management tools, telematics and tracking systems, dash cameras, and compliance tools like Electronic Logging Devices (ELD) and Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports (DVIR). With over 60 patents and multiple industry awards, Zonar is recognized for its innovative technology and customer-centric approach, providing ongoing support and services to its clients. The company is majority-owned by Continental AG and employs around 500 people.

Fab-Form's mission is to accelerate the transition to sustainable foundations for building structures.

Since 1995 Fab-Form has invented, developed and commercialized foundation products that are greener and more sustainable for the building industry. Each product is cost-effective and uses less embodied energy in their production.

Faresin Formwork is an Italian company that designs, produces, and distributes formwork and scaffolding systems for industrialized construction. Founded in 1987, it has its roots in a family engineering business established in 1973. The company has expanded significantly, exporting to over 68 countries and establishing subsidiaries in regions such as Russia, Australia, and the United States.

The product range includes solutions for constructing silos, aluminum slab systems, pier cups, and various adaptable formwork systems. Faresin Formwork is dedicated to innovation and sustainability, focusing on high-performance engineering and minimizing environmental impact. The company serves major construction firms globally, offering tailored projects to meet diverse industrial construction needs.

Short Description:
Fleetio is a fleet management software company based in Birmingham, Alabama, founded in 2012. It offers a cloud-based platform that helps businesses automate and optimize their fleet operations, focusing on vehicle and equipment maintenance, asset management, and operational visibility.

The core product is a comprehensive fleet maintenance and optimization platform that allows users to manage vehicles, equipment, parts, and drivers efficiently. Fleetio's software automates routine tasks, tracks service history, schedules maintenance, and provides performance metrics to enhance operational efficiency and reduce costs. The platform has seen recent enhancements, including improved automation features and deeper performance insights.

Fleetio serves a diverse customer base, including small and medium-sized businesses operating vehicle fleets and heavy equipment. With thousands of customers managing hundreds of thousands of assets, Fleetio aims to provide increased control, transparency, and scalability in fleet operations. The company continues to grow through product innovation and strategic partnerships, focusing on delivering smarter automation and stronger data connectivity in the fleet ecosystem.

Short Description:
FleetWatcher by AlignOps provides telematics and materials management software solutions tailored for heavy equipment contractors in the construction industry. Founded in 2000 and based in Indianapolis, Indiana, FleetWatcher specializes in wireless tracking technology designed for workflows in heavy civil construction, including asphalt paving and site development.

The company offers a Materials Management Solution that optimizes cycle times and reduces costs for asphalt paving contractors by integrating scale data and supporting electronic load capture. Their Construction Management Solution enhances asset utilization and lowers operational costs by analyzing equipment and field data for both on-road and off-road projects. 

Since joining AlignOps in 2024, FleetWatcher’s capabilities have been integrated into a comprehensive platform that connects various operational functions, including safety compliance and workforce management. This unified approach serves a diverse customer base, helping contractors improve efficiency and profitability through enhanced visibility and control over their operations.
