Short Description:
Slide Sledge is a family owned business located in Missoula, Montana. Its roots began with a hand-tool manufacturing company in Dewitt, Nebraska for vise-grip wrenches that was established in 1924. Since then, our Midwestern family values drive us to relate to customers in a professional, yet personal way. We service many industries and customers around the globe, including construction, heavy equipment, railroad, mining, agriculture, military, factory maintenance, and petrochemical.

Slide Sledge's unique linear impact design provides the safest sledgehammer on the market today. The cylindrical body of the Slide Sledge hammer contains a drive bar that slides inside in cylinder with a linear contained motion for maximum impact. One person can operate the tool to deliver a sledgehammer impact. The Slide Sledge can be used with a wide variety of specialized, easy-switch tips to perform various maintenance and repair jobs. Benefits include decreased hammer-chisel risks, including threat of injury to the person holding the chisel, damage to the machinery and sledgehammer "bounce back."

Here at Slide Sledge, we are dedicated to bringing you heavy-duty, quality tools. We are here to answer any questions and pride ourselves on exceptional customer service.

Short Description:
Spray-Lock Concrete Protection (SCP) specializes in spray-applied concrete treatments that protect and waterproof concrete by filling its capillaries and pore structure. Their proprietary technology utilizes colloidal silica to create Calcium Silicate Hydrate (C-S-H), enhancing concrete durability and effectively stopping liquid water movement. This process minimizes issues like shrinkage cracking, scaling, and spalling, while improving resistance to salt, chemicals, and freeze-thaw cycles.

SCP offers a range of products, including premium concrete protection, time-of-placement treatments, and hardening treatments. Their environmentally safe solutions have zero VOC content and allow for coatings to be installed shortly after concrete placement. Additionally, SCP provides industry-acclaimed adhesives that work with their treatments, enabling faster installation and immediate access to treated areas. The company serves the architectural and structural concrete markets, focusing on projects that require enhanced durability and fast-track construction solutions.

Short Description:
STUDSON is a Portland, Oregon-based company that designs and manufactures high-performance head protection for industrial workers, often referred to as "industrial athletes." Founded to enhance safety standards in the industrial head protection market, STUDSON focuses on providing advanced, comfortable, and stylish helmets to ensure workers return home safely each day.

The company offers innovative safety helmets, including the STUDSON SHK-1 Full Brim Safety Helmet. This helmet features Koroyd® technology for impact absorption, a TwICEme® NFC chip for emergency safety information access, an Ionic+ antimicrobial fabric lining for hygiene, and a Fidlock SNAP helmet buckle for easy fastening. STUDSON's products cater to workers in construction, manufacturing, and other demanding environments, combining safety with comfort and modern design.

STUDSON's commitment to innovation is rooted in the founder's personal experiences and a dedication to family safety. The company aims to redefine industrial head protection by blending advanced materials and technology with user-centered design, enhancing both safety outcomes and the overall user experience.

Short Description:
The Barrett Company was started in 1928 by Noah Barrett, an out of work blacksmith, and his son Emmett, who together began business as roofing contractors. As relatives of Col. Samual Barrett, the patent holder of built-up roofing, Noah and Emmett enjoyed success and steady growth in the built-up roofing contracting business. Their focus was on contracting residential and commercial roofs.

In 1975, the Barrett Company concentrated on the development of polymer-modified asphalt systems. Then in 1982, Barrett Company launched its most well-known, nationwide roofing line of products, Ram-Tough. For over ten decades, the Barrett Company has had hands-on experience, professionally engineered products, systems in the high-performance roofing, and waterproofing markets.

Today the Barrett Company continues its growth in the contracting business but has also become a national leader in evolving bitumen modification technology and design of high-performance waterproofing, built-up roofing systems, and vegetated roofs.

In August of 2019, Barrett Company was acquired by Keene Family of Companies with a renewed energy and commitment to the Roofing industry.

Short Description:
U-drain™ is an engineered slotted trench drain that features a single slot opening that has revolutionized the surface drainage industry with its minimal maintenance, sleek look and ability to be used in a wide range of applications.

The basic U-drain™ floor drain system consists of pre-sloped and/or neutral sections, an adapter plate/end cap and a sump pit. All U-drain™ components are bolt-together in order to provide user-friendly assembly and installation.

Short Description:
Uptake is an industrial artificial intelligence software company based in Chicago, Illinois, founded in 2014 by Brad Keywell. The company specializes in software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions that utilize data science, machine learning, and AI to optimize operations in heavy industries such as manufacturing, mining, rail, and energy.

Uptake's platform processes large volumes of data from industrial machines, including sensors and work orders, to provide actionable insights. These insights help customers predict and prevent asset failures, improve maintenance strategies, and enhance productivity. The company offers a range of products, including predictive maintenance solutions, operational efficiency modules, and asset management tools like the Uptake Fleet solution. 

Uptake serves various teams within organizations that manage industrial assets, delivering a comprehensive view of operations to support better decision-making. The company has received significant recognition for its innovation in AI and industrial IoT, earning accolades from organizations such as the World Economic Forum and Forbes.

Short Description:
Vermeer Corporation is a family-owned manufacturer based in Pella, Iowa, specializing in industrial and agricultural equipment. Founded in 1948 by Gary Vermeer, the company has expanded into a global enterprise with over 3,000 employees and operations in multiple countries, including the United States, the Netherlands, Germany, China, Singapore, Canada, and Brazil. Led by third-generation management, Vermeer emphasizes core values such as prioritizing people, producing high-quality products, and contributing to communities.

The company offers a diverse range of over 100 products tailored for agricultural, construction, landscaping, environmental, excavation, and forage markets. Their product lines include hay balers, pipeline directional drills, wood grinders, and trenchers, among others. Vermeer is committed to innovation, holding several patents that enhance the design and functionality of its equipment. The company serves a wide customer base, including farmers, construction contractors, and utility companies, providing durable machinery that supports productivity and efficiency in various operations.

Short Description:
Vita Industrial is a technology and manufacturing company based in Broomfield, Colorado, specializing in intelligent lifting systems. Founded in 2015, the company aims to enhance safety, control, and efficiency in industrial construction lifting and search and rescue operations. With additional offices in Washington, DC, the UK, Dubai, Silicon Valley, and Huntsville, Alabama, Vita Industrial serves various sectors, including construction, military, firefighting, public safety, wind energy, and oil and gas.

The company develops advanced lifting technologies, such as the Vita Load Navigator, which improves load control and safety during operations. Vita Industrial also offers training services to ensure the effective use of its systems. Through a global sales agreement with WOLFFKRAN, a leading crane manufacturer, the company aims to integrate safety and technology in construction projects worldwide. With a team of professionals from diverse backgrounds, Vita Industrial is committed to innovation, quality, and ethical practices in all its endeavors.

Short Description:
Ready to get away from the daily routine, unplug and experience the excitement of fishing in Alaska while enjoying personal service, comfortable accommodations, great food and the beauty of southeast Alaska and its Tongass National Forest?  Are you looking for a great incentive for your team or perhaps a one-of-a-kind fund-raising event? Capture the experience of wild Alaska ocean fishing that you'll never forget.  Call 800-544-5125 for more info.

Accessible only by air and sea, our record-setting salmon cannery turned legendary sport-fishing resort draws anglers from around the world who come to our remote shores in pursuit of wild king and silver salmon, halibut, lingcod, and more than 20 other fish species.

We're just a short floatplane flight away from Ketchikan in Southeast Alaska, 90 minutes from Seattle, Washington. At Waterfall Resort, guests can arrive at the airport in the morning and be on the water fishing with us in the afternoon.  We have the largest and best managed sport fishing fleet in Alaska!

Waterfall Resort is the most popular fishing lodge in Alaska, a storied venue for saltwater anglers set on 52 acres on Prince of Wales Island, amid the world's second largest rain forest. This historic property began in 1912 as a record-setting salmon cannery. Now beautifully renovated, the resort has welcomed more than 60,000 anglers to date. Enjoy our ultra-personalized service for an unparalleled Alaska sport-fishing experience.

Let's go fishing!

Steamboat Bay Fishing Club and The Residence are sister properties and the closest lodges to Southeast Alaska's best fishing spots.  Get more detail about Steamboat Bay by clicking on our Showcase pages below.

Wharton is a family owned company founded in 1948 in Pennsauken, New Jersey. We now have additional locations in Clinton, MD, Springfield, VA, and Carson City, NV. "讯达通"多年来坚持以"质量为生命、客户为上帝、科技求发展、诚信赢市场"的理念，视客户的需求为己任，服务周到、价格合理、供货及时，因而赢得了国内外客户的信赖。

Short Description:
Crafco, Inc. is a manufacturer based in Chandler, Arizona, specializing in packaged pavement preservation products and related application equipment. Established in 1976, the company offers a wide range of products for asphalt and concrete maintenance, including hot-applied crack sealants, silicone joint sealants, hot-applied mastics, and cold-mix materials for surface patching and repair. Crafco is unique in that it manufactures both the specialized products and the equipment used to apply them.

In addition to pavement solutions, Crafco provides preservation materials for bridges, airports, roofing, and waterproofing. Their products are designed to seal, protect, repair, and strengthen various surfaces, aiming to extend the service life of infrastructures like pavements, bridge decks, and airport runways. Crafco operates multiple manufacturing facilities in the U.S. and distributes its products globally, serving a diverse customer base that includes transportation departments, contractors, and infrastructure maintenance companies.

Depureco Industrial Vacuums has over 50 years of experience in designing, manufacturing, and supplying high-performance industrial vacuum cleaners and related equipment. Founded in 1972, the company serves various sectors, including chemical-pharmaceutical, textiles, metalworking, food industry, additive manufacturing, and construction. Depureco focuses on creating innovative vacuum solutions tailored to the specific needs of these industries.

The company offers a wide range of products, including wet and dry industrial vacuum cleaners, dust collectors, fume extractors, central vacuum systems, and various accessories. Depureco emphasizes a people-centered approach, collaborating closely with clients to understand their cleaning needs and improve workplace hygiene and production processes. Their commitment to customer satisfaction is reflected in their personalized support and extensive stock of parts for rapid response to customer needs.

Digital Fleet, LLC is a Chicago-based company that specializes in GPS asset tracking and fleet telematics, focusing on the construction materials industry, particularly ready-mix concrete and heavy building materials. Founded in 2012, Digital Fleet offers a cloud-based software platform designed to optimize fleet operations, workforce management, and workflow for construction material producers and suppliers.

Their product suite includes real-time fleet and driver management technology that enhances visibility and operational efficiency. Key features encompass asset and truck tracking, automated delivery cycle statusing, driver management tools, and communication capabilities. The platform is tailored for the ready-mix concrete and construction materials sector, allowing companies to manage their fleets remotely, whether in the office or working from home. Digital Fleet is known for its responsive service and deep industry expertise, serving customers in the heavy building materials market. In 2025, the company was acquired by Command Alkon, aiming to integrate its technology into a broader ecosystem of fleet management solutions.

Short Description:
Eastman Exports Global Clothing Pvt Ltd is a prominent manufacturer and exporter of high-quality knitwear and garments, located in Tiruppur, India. Established in 1983, the company has grown from a dyeing unit into one of India's largest knitwear producers, with a production capacity exceeding 8 million knitted garment pieces each month. Eastman Exports operates a fully integrated production setup that covers all stages of garment manufacturing, ensuring high quality and quick turnaround times.

The company specializes in a wide range of knitted garments, including custom T-shirts, cotton leggings, and hosiery, primarily made from cotton and organic materials. It also produces men’s and boys’ knitted shirts, pantyhose, tights, stockings, and socks. With a dedicated Research & Development team, Eastman Exports focuses on fabric innovation and sustainable manufacturing practices, enhancing efficiency and environmental responsibility. The company exports to major international markets, supplying high-end fashion brands and boutiques while maintaining a strong commitment to quality and sustainability.

Short Description:
Enviro-Port manufactures the world's highest quality, most durable and most dependable concrete reclaimer and Ready Mix Recycling systems for the ready mix and precast industries. Our reclamation systems also aid in managing process and storm water. 

Every year in America, 23.1 million tons of ready mix concrete is wasted, thrown away, and left to harden. That's almost 2 billion dollars worth of revenue left sitting in piles, every year. It's time to capture lost revenue from wasted materials, while aiding in environmental compliance and plant aesthetics.

Individuals are becoming more aware of their effects on the environment. Enviro-Port supplies a cost effective solution to gain capital return on waste materials and help your company grow. Our systems ensure that what we take from nature is used efficiently, aiding in the control of eliminating solid and liquid waste and recycling these materials into useful products, made to increase the efficiency and profitability of ready mix operations. The result is a system that can fit the needs of all ready mix and precast producers to have a positive impact on the environment and your bottom line.

From aggregate recovery to complete recovery systems, Enviro-Port offers a variety of systems each tailored to your specific operational needs by analyzing your company's recycling goals and potential for expansion or enhancing your existing process. We design the best system for you, built for long term reliability, and support our systems by assembling your customized equipment on your site. We are prepared to meet unique challenges, including cold weather operation, accommodations for any size fleet and custom layout to meet your facility criteria.

EYERIDE is a fleet management company based in Austin, Texas, specializing in military-grade, real-time remote supervision and communication systems for vehicle fleets. Their technology meets the high standards of the Israeli security industry and serves a wide range of clients, including all branches of the U.S. military, the Department of Defense, and various police agencies.

Their platform allows remote administrators to monitor and control up to 5,000 devices simultaneously, offering comprehensive features such as route optimization, maintenance tracking, and driver behavior monitoring. EYERIDE emphasizes safety and operational efficiency, helping clients achieve significant savings on fuel and insurance costs.

Short Description:
Hannay Reels, Inc. is a family-owned company based in Westerlo, New York, with a history dating back to 1933. As an international leader in the design and manufacture of hose and cable reels, the company has produced over 3 million reels and operates from a 200,000 square foot facility. Hannay Reels exports its products to customers across six continents.

The company specializes in custom manufacturing reels for various applications, including hose reels, cable reels, and specialized reels for industries such as firefighting, pest control, and LP gas delivery. Their products are designed for durability and efficiency, featuring options like corrosion-resistant materials and various drive mechanisms. Hannay Reels is committed to quality and customer service, ensuring that their products meet the specific needs of businesses and professionals who require reliable equipment. With nearly a century of expertise, Hannay Reels continues to innovate and maintain a strong presence in both domestic and international markets.

Short Description:
Hengelhoef Concrete Joints NV (HCJ) is a Belgian company established in 2007, specializing in the development and manufacturing of armoured expansion joints for industrial concrete floors. Based in Genk, Belgium, HCJ draws on over 30 years of expertise in industrial flooring to provide innovative solutions that enhance the durability and efficiency of concrete floors in logistics, manufacturing, retail, and warehousing sectors.

The company's flagship product, the Cosinus Slide® joint, is a patented system designed for superior load transfer and crack control. This joint system effectively distributes dynamic and static loads, reducing maintenance costs and downtime while optimizing floor thickness for sustainability. HCJ also offers stainless steel expansion joints that withstand heavy loads and dynamic impacts, improving the performance and longevity of industrial floors.

HCJ provides comprehensive services, including complimentary design checks and in-house support for floor design and estimating. With a strong international presence, the company has completed over 1,000 projects in more than 40 countries, serving notable clients like Amazon, IKEA, and Coca-Cola.

Short Description:
1996 ORIGINATION
Industrial Concrete Incorporated (ICI) started business in 1996 in Fredericksburg, Virginia. In it's first year, ICI employed approximately twenty people and worked mainly on small, commercial, turn-key concrete projects in the general area located between Richmond, VA and Washington DC.

2001 PLACE & FINISH DIVISION
ICI started a "Place and Finish" division in 2001. This division specializes in large commercial, industrial and governmental mass concrete placement. The average pour size is normally between 10,000 sf and 15,000 sf, but the ICI place and finish crews have also poured 40,000 to 50,000 sf in one day with multiple crews.

2009 MANAGEMENT STRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS
ICI added an in-house engineer/estimator, a project development director and purchased technically advanced estimating software packages. These changes to the ICI management structure are already helping to improve their relationships and bidding procedures with all customers. ICI now has the capabilities to produce large scale, accurate, and mass concrete estimates.

CURRENT STATISTICS
On a yearly average, ICI employs over 100 employees, works in the Mid-Atlantic area, places over 50,000 cubic yards and finishes over 1,000,000 sf of concrete.

GROWTH AND THE FUTURE
The company's growth has been the result of the expanding customer base that has continued to expand over the years, mainly due to ICI's job performance history. In the future, ICI strives to take the company to the next level. ICI is devoted to continue to improve its job performance reputation that has been built over the years.

Short Description:
Egan Company is a specialty trade contractor and system integrator with a history dating back to 1903. Originally founded as a pipefitting shop, it became Egan & Sons Plumbing and Heating Company in 1945. Today, Egan has nearly 1,000 employees and offers a wide range of services, including mechanical contracting, electrical contracting, and plumbing.

The company operates as a single-source partner, providing comprehensive solutions in mechanical, electrical, and plumbing services. Egan is known for its commitment to craftsmanship, safety, and customer service. It has a strong safety culture and was one of the first companies in Minnesota to implement an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) in 1974. Egan also has a sister company, Egan Food Technologies, which specializes in food processing equipment.

Egan has been involved in notable projects such as the Amway Tower and the Minneapolis Convention Center. The company serves a diverse clientele, including educational institutions and commercial developers, primarily in Minnesota and the surrounding region. Egan is dedicated to community support and has a strong corporate culture focused on integrity and innovation.

Short Description:
The International Powered Access Federation (IPAF) is a global, not-for-profit organization founded in 1983. It promotes the safe and effective use of powered access equipment and serves a diverse membership that includes manufacturers, rental companies, distributors, contractors, and users. With over 1,800 members operating in more than 80 countries, IPAF represents a significant portion of the Mobile Elevating Work Platform (MEWP) rental fleet and platform manufacturing.

IPAF's core mission focuses on enhancing safety and efficiency in the powered access industry. It offers comprehensive training programs for operators, certified by TÜV, with over 180,000 individuals trained annually. Members benefit from technical advice, legislative influence, safety initiatives, and networking opportunities. IPAF also runs safety campaigns and provides resources to help members comply with industry standards, ensuring high safety practices across the powered access supply chain.

Short Description:
LA KNOW-HOW COMPANY DEL CEMENTO CELLULARE
Isoltech è stata tra le prime realtà italiane ad introdurre sul mercato sistemi per produrre cemento cellulare mediante apposite macchine e agenti schiumogeni. Grazie alle competenze specialistiche nella tecnologia del cemento cellulare acquisite in oltre 40 anni di esperienza – Isoltech è stata in grado, nel corso del tempo, di ritagliarsi un proprio spazio in ambito internazionale diventando un partner affidabile per posatori, imprese, progettisti, produttori di blocchi in muratura e prefabbricatori del settore edile. Oggi l'attività di Isoltech si è evoluta, non limitandosi alla sola vendita di agenti schiumogeni, di macchinari e di impianti chiavi in mano, ma proponendo un servizio integrato e altamente personalizzato capace di offrire ai clienti tutti gli strumenti e le competenze necessarie alla produzione del cemento cellulare in maniera autonoma ed eccellente.

THE KNOW-HOW COMPANY ON CELLULAR CONCRETE
Isoltech has been amongst the first Italian companies to introduce systems for producing cellular concrete to the market using appropriate machines and foaming agents. Thanks to specialist capabilities in cellular concrete technology, acquired over 40 years of experience – Isoltech has been able, over time, to carve out its own space internationally, becoming a reliable partner for layers, companies, designers, manufacturers of blocks for walls and pre-fabricators in the building sector. Today, the business of Isoltech has evolved, not only limiting itself to the sale of foaming agents, of machinery and of off the shelf plant, but by offering an integrated and highly personalized service able to give the client all the means and capabilities necessary for the production of cellular concrete in an excellent and autonomous manner.

Jetstream of Houston, LLP, a division of Federal Signal Corporation, specializes in the design, manufacture, and distribution of high-pressure waterblasting equipment. Founded in 1976 and based in Houston, Texas, the company is recognized as a pioneer in the industrial cleaning and surface preparation sectors. Jetstream offers a wide range of products, including skid- and trailer-mounted pump units, control guns, valves, hoses, fittings, and specialized nozzles, all maintained in one of the largest inventories of waterblasting equipment in North America.

Their equipment is utilized in various applications, such as heat exchanger cleaning, hydrodemolition, and tank cleaning, offering an environmentally friendly alternative to traditional methods. With a commitment to American manufacturing and a focus on productivity, safety, and quality, Jetstream aims to deliver tailored solutions that enhance performance and reduce downtime for its global customers.

Short Description:
Machinery Partner is a Boston-based B2B marketplace that specializes in the sale and procurement of heavy machinery and industrial equipment. Founded in 2020 and led by CEO Clement Cazalot, the company aims to modernize the heavy equipment market by enabling online transactions between manufacturers and dealers, which helps deliver cost savings to buyers.

The company offers a comprehensive platform that includes procurement solutions, financing options, and lifecycle tracking for a wide range of heavy machinery essential for construction and infrastructure projects. Machinery Partner operates as a digital dealership, providing transparency and efficiency throughout the equipment lifecycle. Currently active in 35 U.S. states, the company plans to expand its operations nationally and internationally to better serve local construction and infrastructure needs. 

Machinery Partner primarily serves construction companies, infrastructure developers, and equipment manufacturers, helping them access critical heavy machinery more efficiently. The company has raised over $12 million in funding and reports revenues around $22 million, with a team of approximately 30 employees.

Short Description:
Oman Systems, Inc. is a software development company that specializes in technology solutions for the civil construction and heavy/highway infrastructure industry. Founded in 1992 by John and Jack Oman, the company draws on over 140 years of family experience in civil construction to create user-driven software tailored for contractors, Department of Transportation (DOT) agencies, and construction professionals.

The company offers several core products, including ProEstimate.NET, a crew-based estimating system that enhances bid preparation accuracy; BidTabs.NET, a tool for bid tabulation and data analysis used in DOT projects; and FieldManagement Pro (FMP), which aids construction teams in managing project data, payroll, and scheduling. Oman Systems focuses on ease of use and efficiency, helping clients improve project outcomes through reliable technology solutions. Their customer base includes heavy/highway contractors, subcontractors, DOTs, and consultants across the nation, supported by a dedicated team of industry experts available 24/7.

OneCrew is a business management software platform tailored for the asphalt and concrete paving industry. Founded in 2022 and based in San Francisco, CA, OneCrew simplifies complex workflows for paving contractors by integrating various operational tools into a single platform.

The platform offers a comprehensive solution that includes customer relationship management (CRM), accurate project cost estimating, efficient scheduling and dispatching, job costing for tracking expenses and profitability, and project management from the office to the job site. This integration helps paving contractors streamline their operations and improve efficiency by managing all aspects of their business in one place.

OneCrew's software is designed to provide paving contractors with data-driven insights, enabling them to drive growth and enhance their operations. The company recently secured $3.25 million in seed funding, reflecting strong investor confidence in its innovative approach to the paving industry.

Short Description:
PassTime is a Colorado-based company that specializes in automotive GPS tracking and vehicle telematics solutions. Founded in 1990 and headquartered in Littleton, PassTime has over 30 years of experience in the industry. The company is known for inventing the first starter-interrupt device in 1997, which has positioned it as a leader in automotive Internet of Things (IoT) technology. PassTime serves a global customer base of over 10,000 businesses, protecting more than $10 billion in mobile assets.

The company provides a range of products, including starter-interrupt devices and advanced GPS tracking systems. These solutions are designed to enhance payment compliance, reduce defaults, and improve asset management across various markets, including automotive finance, RV, construction, and equipment rental. PassTime emphasizes strong customer support and strategic partnerships with lenders and dealerships to facilitate financing and optimize operational efficiency. The company is also actively involved in legislative and educational efforts to support the automotive finance industry.

Patcraft is a commercial flooring company based in Dalton, Georgia, founded in 1946. With a workforce of around 705 employees, the company generates approximately $250 million in revenue. Patcraft specializes in high-performance flooring solutions tailored for various market sectors, including offices, hospitality, healthcare, and education.

The company offers a diverse range of products, such as carpet tile, broadloom carpet, rugs, entryway systems, homogeneous tile, stair treads, and wall coverings. Patcraft emphasizes innovation, quality, and sustainability in its designs, with notable collections like the Artefact collection showcasing a collaborative design process. 

Patcraft's team is dedicated to transforming market experiences through creativity and collaboration, fostering a culture of teamwork that drives product development and brand evolution. The company is recognized for its commitment to providing durable and stylish flooring solutions that meet the functional and aesthetic needs of its commercial clients.

Short Description:
Pilosio is an Italian company founded in 1961, specializing in scaffolding, formwork, and shoring systems for the construction, infrastructure, and maintenance sectors. With a global presence, it operates in regions such as the UK, GCC, Canada, Australia, and South Africa.

The company offers a wide range of products, including traditional and suspended scaffolding, concrete formwork, and shoring systems. One of its notable innovations is the FlyDeck suspended access system, designed for safe and efficient use on complex structures like bridges and stadiums. FlyDeck has gained recognition for its innovative design and is utilized in significant projects, including the Abu Dhabi Guggenheim Museum.

Pilosio serves a diverse clientele, including construction firms and infrastructure developers, and actively participates in industry trade fairs like Bauma to showcase its latest innovations. In 2021, Pilosio was acquired by Euroedile, enhancing its market position and capabilities in the scaffolding industry.

Polybol S.A.S. is a Colombian company that specializes in manufacturing and supplying industrial plastic packaging solutions. With nearly five decades of experience, it operates as a subsidiary of the Globalpak Group, which has a presence in over 35 countries. Headquartered in Bogotá, Polybol employs around 286 people and has shown steady financial growth, including an increase in net sales revenue and profit margin in 2024.

Polybol is committed to innovation and sustainability, having modernized its production capabilities through a partnership with Windmöller & Hölscher. This collaboration has allowed the company to implement advanced equipment and exclusive products, enhancing both operational efficiency and product quality. Polybol continues to invest in new technologies and services to meet the evolving demands of its customers in various sectors.

Ramp is a financial operations platform founded in 2019 that helps businesses automate and streamline their finance processes. It serves over 40,000 finance teams and has facilitated tens of billions of dollars in purchases annually. Ramp's vision is to become the central hub for a company’s transaction layer, focusing on automating tasks like expense management, bill payments, and bookkeeping.

Ramp offers a suite of integrated financial products, including corporate cards with flexible credit limits and no annual fees, automated expense management, bill payment solutions, procurement workflows, travel management, and accounting automation. The platform is designed to scale with businesses, catering to startups, small and medium enterprises, and large global corporations. Ramp has enabled its customers to save $2 billion and 20 million hours, providing better control and visibility over their financial operations.

Short Description:
The Scaffold & Access Industry Association (SAIA) is a nonprofit trade association founded in 1972. It represents dealers and distributors of scaffold and access equipment, aiming to enhance professionalism, safety, and success in the elevated work environment. SAIA connects and educates its members, focusing on safety and excellence throughout the industry.

SAIA offers a range of services, including training programs, workshops, and seminars that cover safety, compliance, and best practices. The association provides up-to-date information on occupational safety and health laws, often collaborating with OSHA. It also promotes workforce development and facilitates communication among members and regulatory agencies to improve workplace safety standards. Through its educational resources and networking opportunities, SAIA supports its members in navigating industry challenges and advancing safety practices.

The company is known for producing high-quality concrete mixers, heavy-duty replacement central mix drums, and blades. They also offer Durex urethane liners for sale and installation, which enhance the performance and longevity of mixer drums.

Their product range includes new concrete mixers, custom mixing systems, stationary mixer units, and truck wash solutions. Short Description:
Silicone Specialties, Inc. (SSI) is a private company founded in 1969, originally in Tulsa, Oklahoma, and now based in Dallas, Texas. It has evolved from a small business selling silicone sealants and lubricants to a significant supplier in the commercial waterproofing, glazing, building materials, and heavy machinery industries. With a workforce of around 100 to 200 employees, SSI generates annual revenues estimated between $25 million and $100 million.

The company specializes in providing high-quality silicone-based materials and related products, primarily for the commercial construction and highway sectors. SSI has expanded its offerings over the years to meet the needs of its customers, focusing on enhancing the durability and sealing performance of building materials and machinery components. With a commitment to customer satisfaction, SSI emphasizes competitive pricing and strong relationships with its clients, serving a niche market that includes commercial construction contractors and glazing specialists across six states.

SimplyTek is a prominent electronics and gadgets retailer based in Sri Lanka, founded in 2017 by a group of friends with a vision to provide the latest technology products to the local market. The company offers a diverse selection of consumer electronics, including mobile phones, smart watches, earphones, speakers, and various smart devices, all at competitive prices.

As Sri Lanka’s most trusted electronics store, SimplyTek continuously updates its inventory with innovative tech products. It operates both online and through its flagship experience store, the first of its kind in the country, allowing customers to explore products hands-on before making a purchase. SimplyTek also provides island-wide delivery, ensuring safe and prompt service within 2-5 working days. Customers can enjoy features like pre-ordering, installment payment options, and exclusive discounts through their online shopping platform. 

SimplyTek caters to tech-savvy consumers seeking authentic and affordable electronics, emphasizing convenience, product authenticity, and reliable customer service.

Short Description:
Sioux Chief Manufacturing is a family-owned company based in Kansas City, Missouri, founded in 1957. It specializes in designing and manufacturing rough plumbing products for various applications, including residential, commercial, industrial, and government projects. The company’s product offerings are organized into four main categories: Supply, Drainage, Support, and Specialties, and are distributed worldwide through qualified wholesale and retail channels.

The company has a rich history of innovation, starting with specialty fasteners and expanding to include a wide range of plumbing products such as water hammer arresters, drainage systems, and testing tools. Notable products include the Finish Line™ adjustable drainage system and the Ox Box™ installation box. Sioux Chief is committed to quality, producing over 90% of its products domestically and holding more than 25 patents. The company collaborates closely with industry professionals to ensure its products meet market needs, emphasizing American manufacturing and customer-driven development.

Founded in 1904, the company has grown from a small team to over 400 professionals across the United States, China, and Canada. Smith-Emery operates under Smith-Emery International, which includes several subsidiaries that provide specialized services in various regions. Smith-Emery is committed to delivering expert services that meet rigorous safety and compliance standards. Their reputation is built on a large team of licensed engineers, geologists, inspectors, and technicians dedicated to exceeding client expectations in the construction industry.

SRP Environmental is a multi-disciplinary environmental, health, and safety consulting firm based in Shreveport, Louisiana. Founded in 1996, the company operates over 20 offices across North America and the Pacific, including locations in states like California, Florida, and Texas. SRP Environmental focuses on delivering high-quality, ethical, and cost-effective solutions that protect human health and promote environmental sustainability.

The firm offers a wide range of services, including environmental compliance consulting, industrial hygiene consulting, safety management services, and EHS training programs. Their team consists of environmental scientists, certified industrial hygienists, and safety professionals, allowing them to provide tailored compliance solutions. SRP serves various industries, such as oil and gas, healthcare, and manufacturing, and is committed to regulatory compliance and customer service excellence. With a strong leadership team and a commitment to ethical practices, SRP Environmental is dedicated to meeting the needs of its diverse client base.

Stabila North America is the North American branch of STABILA Messgeräte Gustav Ullrich GmbH, a well-established manufacturer of measurement technology for the construction industry. Headquartered in South Elgin, Illinois, the company employs between 25 to 100 people and generates annual revenues of $25 million to $100 million. Stabila North America acts as a regional distributor and service provider for the brand's products in the U.S. and Canada.

The company offers a wide range of precision measuring tools designed for professional use, including spirit levels, construction lasers, electronic measuring tools, tape measures, folding rules, angle finders, and digital protractors. All products are engineered for accuracy and durability, making them reliable choices for construction professionals. Stabila North America is committed to customer service and technical support, working closely with clients to provide tailored solutions for their measurement needs. With over 135 years of expertise, Stabila North America continues to uphold a tradition of quality and innovation in measurement technology.

Sundström Safety AB is a Swedish company that designs and manufactures respiratory protective equipment to safeguard individuals from contaminated air. Founded in 1926 by Ivan Sundström, the family-run business is now in its third generation and is based in Lagan, Sweden, where it has modern production facilities.

The company offers a modular range of respiratory protection systems, including full and half masks, hoods, helmets, screens, filters, and accessories. These products are designed for flexibility and comfort, catering to the specific needs of various workplaces. Sundström Safety focuses on providing high-quality, user-friendly equipment that is durable and easy to maintain, exceeding regulatory standards.

Sundström Safety serves a diverse clientele across industries such as agriculture, construction, painting, and auto body repair. Its products are distributed in over 30 countries through established partnerships, with sales organizations in Europe, Asia, and the USA. The company employs around 160 people and reports annual sales of approximately 450 million SEK.

Texas Pneumatic Tools has American made, quality manufactured tools you can count on. When your application requires pneumatically driven tools, Texas Pneumatic has just what you need. Short Description:
Thrace Group is a Greek multinational company founded in 1977, based in Xanthi, Greece. It is one of the largest global producers of technical fabrics and packaging solutions, operating through 16 member companies across 9 countries. With a workforce of around 2,000 professionals, Thrace Group serves over 1,500 customers in more than 80 countries.

The company specializes in the design, production, and distribution of polypropylene-based products, converting over 110,000 metric tons of polypropylene and polyethylene annually. Its operations are divided into two main divisions: Technical Fabrics and Packaging Solutions. The Technical Fabrics division offers a range of products, including geosynthetics and engineered solutions for various sectors such as construction and agriculture. The Packaging Solutions division focuses on industrial and consumer packaging, particularly in the Balkans and Nordic regions.

Thrace Group is committed to sustainability, integrating environmentally responsible practices into its operations, including hydroponic cultivation of vegetables using geothermal energy. The company emphasizes innovation and aims to provide durable and sustainable material solutions across multiple industries.

Short Description:
Tingley is a historic American company founded in 1896 in Rahway, New Jersey. Originally a manufacturer of bicycle tire plugs, it has grown into a leading innovator in protective, liquid-proof footwear and apparel for demanding work environments. As a 5th generation family business, Tingley employs between 51-200 people and has a legacy of innovation, including the creation of the world’s first seamless rubber overshoe in 1938.

The company specializes in protective footwear and apparel designed to safeguard workers from environmental hazards such as mud, rain, chemicals, and darkness. Their product range includes rubber overshoes and boots, Hazmat boots for chemical protection, insulated boots for cold environments, and exterior-coated polyurethane protective clothing. Tingley’s products are engineered for durability, comfort, and safety, catering to workers in industrial, construction, and chemical handling sectors. The company was acquired by Bunzl plc in late 2021, enhancing its presence in the North American safety product market.
